finding: The locus indexed by rs12927162 was associated with sleep proxy behaviors, including TLA during specific night hours.
title: Genome-wide association studies of 27 accelerometry-derived physical activity measurements identifies novel loci and genetic mechanisms

finding: The missense variant rs149989682 in ABCA3 was associated with reduced FEV1/FVC and has been previously linked with pediatric interstitial lung disease, denoting its significance in lung function pathology.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The SNP rs11074451 at 16p12.3 was found to be a splicing quantitative trait locus (sQTL) for GP2 in the pancreas, suggesting a novel connection between depression and T2D.
title: Multi-trait genetic analysis identifies novel pleiotropic loci for depression and schizophrenia in East Asians

finding: The SNP rs35626903 at 16q12.2 was identified in the context of HDL analysis and previously related to psychological traits, indicating its relevance in both depression and related metabolic processes.
title: Multi-trait genetic analysis identifies novel pleiotropic loci for depression and schizophrenia in East Asians

finding: The SNP rs804172 was found to be associated with prostate cancer and confirmed to have regulatory effects based on a high maximum mean log e-value (> 2) using the DeepSEA model, suggesting stronger regulatory impacts compared to a reference distribution.
title: Novel discoveries and enhanced genomic prediction from modelling genetic risk of cancer age-at-onset

finding: The SNP rs17794645 was associated with decreased body weight in mice, highlighting its relevance to weight regulation.
title: The genetic architecture of changes in adiposity during adulthood

finding: The rs8047587 variant at FTO was confirmed as a novel GWAS signal for PCOS, which strengthened the reported association between increasing BMI and the risk of developing PCOS.
title: Genomic and proteomic evidence for hormonal and metabolic foundations of polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: This variant was recognized for its association with significant changes in PSA profiles.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The SNP rs7193778, associated with the genes NFAT5 and TERF2, was linked to blood sodium levels in a new manner not documented previously in the GWAS Catalog, despite its prior association with urate levels, as established by Köttgen et al. (2013).
title: DeepPheWAS: an R package for phenotype generation and association analysis for phenome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs924135, associated with ABCC1, significantly contributed to the epistatic interaction with rs17806888, affecting succinylcarnitine levels and thereby influencing cognitive decline rates in individuals, showcasing its relevance in the context of Alzheimer's disease biomarker profiles.
title: Individual bioenergetic capacity as a potential source of resilience to Alzheimer’s disease

finding: Finding associated with YPEL3 showed a significant link to BMI through 10 SNP-transcript-BMI associations, highlighting its potential role in transcriptional pathways affecting obesity.
title: Integrating Genetic and Transcriptomic Data to Identify Genes Underlying Obesity Risk Loci

finding: The SNP rs9925964 was found associated with ZNF646 in the same genomic region as YPEL3 and was part of the 46 SNP-transcript-BMI associations that connected genetic variation to BMI outcomes.
title: Integrating Genetic and Transcriptomic Data to Identify Genes Underlying Obesity Risk Loci

finding: This SNP was also implicated in association with SPNS1, contributing to 91 significant SNP-transcript-BMI associations, revealing its involvement in obesity risk mechanisms.
title: Integrating Genetic and Transcriptomic Data to Identify Genes Underlying Obesity Risk Loci

finding: Novel association was observed for rs28545123 in the PDXDC1 locus linked to decreased risk for DNMT3A-associated CH (OR = 0.90 [0.87-0.93], P = 2.15 x 10^-8).
title: Comparative analysis of 136,401 Admixed Americans and 419,228 Europeans reveals ancestry-specific genetic determinants of clonal haematopoiesis

finding: At the PSMB10 locus, the BP allele of rs5923 was associated with both increased expression of PSMB10 in various blood immune cells and decreased expression in blood monocytes CD14+ (P = 9.56×10^-7) and blood neutrophils CD16+ (P = 8.21×10^-6).
title: Pathway-based polygenic score analysis identifies the NRF2-KEAP1 and mRNA splicing - minor pathways as enriched in shared genetic variation between chronotype and bipolar disorder

finding: was linked to FTO, which has been previously associated with addiction risk.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: associated with FTO and marked as a significant finding, aligning with previous European GWAS findings.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: The SNP rs6497523 overlapped an open chromatin region essential for fetal telencephalon development and marked another ASD-SV likely significant for ASD pathology.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The locus at rs542745170 showed significant interaction with STST for PP, associated with the WWOX gene (P_GxE=3.1×10^-5).
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The rs72824905 (Pro522Arg) variant in the PLCG2 gene was associated with a 1.49-fold increased likelihood of longevity while decreasing the risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD) by 1.75-fold, indicating its protective effects against multiple conditions.
title: The effect of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants on longevity

finding: It was another variant with a greater effect allele frequency within the EstBB and FinnGen cohorts related to hypothyroidism.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: The SNP rs4984636 in CACNA1H was associated only with late T2D diagnosis, which highlighted its role in the later stages of T2D development.
title: Sex-specific genetic loci linked to early and late onset type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs11860769 was identified as a pleiotropic index SNP. It exhibited an opposite effect on the risk of Restless Legs Syndrome (RLS) and Parkinson's Disease (PD). This finding is significant as it suggests that while RLS was used as an exposure in the analysis, rs11860769 influenced both disorders in contrary directions, indicating its potential role in a complex genetic architecture linking these conditions.
title: Lack of Causal Effects or Genetic Correlation between Restless Legs Syndrome and Parkinson’s Disease

finding: The intergenic variant rs13333582-C was significantly associated with decreased risk of OA, with a p-value of 3.58 × 10^-8, despite weaker associations from variants in high LD.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study of opioid addiction: OPRM1 and Beyond

finding: The SNP <italic>rs7189975</italic> in the <italic>LUC7L</italic> gene was positively associated with mean corpuscular hemoglobin, with a trans-ancestry effect size of beta=0.105. A significant discordant effect was noted, showing a negative association for African participants (beta=-0.336) against a positive association for European participants (beta=0.134).
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP <italic>rs217181</italic> was also a part of the independent associations related to low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol, showcasing the genetic complexity of blood biomarkers.
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs804172 was associated with prostate cancer and was confirmed to have regulatory effects on chromatin features. It exhibited a maximum mean log e-value greater than 2, indicating a higher likelihood of regulatory effects compared to a reference distribution of 1000 Genomes variants. This finding was part of the discovery of additional genomic regions related to cancer pathways.
title: Novel discoveries and enhanced genomic prediction from modelling genetic risk of cancer age-at-onset

finding: The lead trans-meQTL, rs17611866 in ZNF75A, was associated with the expression of nearby genes and regulated methylation at significant loci including cg17944885, which was associated with late DKD progression.
title: Blood methylation biomarkers are associated with diabetic kidney disease progression in type 1 diabetes

finding: This SNP was identified as the lead variant for cystic kidney disease and among the lead loci for congenital malformations of the urinary system, thus supporting its relevance in kidney health.
title: Blood methylation biomarkers are associated with diabetic kidney disease progression in type 1 diabetes

finding: This SNP was identified in the FTO locus and was associated with HFrEF, with no significant association to HFpEF.
title: Genetic Architecture of Heart Failure with Preserved versus Reduced Ejection Fraction

finding: This SNP, also in the FTO locus, was found to be genetically associated with HFpEF, with an odds ratio of 1.10, indicating a higher risk of this subtype.
title: Genetic Architecture of Heart Failure with Preserved versus Reduced Ejection Fraction

finding: This SNP (NFAT5) was also replicated in other heart failure GWAS studies, confirming its association.
title: Genetic Architecture of Heart Failure with Preserved versus Reduced Ejection Fraction

finding: The ZFHX3 SNP rs2106261 minor allele was associated with maintenance of a low inflammation level, which contributed to a reduced recurrence of atrial fibrillation after pulmonary vein isolation. This finding suggested a protective effect related to the inflammatory response in the context of AVNRT.
title: Integrative analyses identify potential key genes and calcium-signaling pathway in familial AVNRT using whole-exome sequencing

finding: The FTO variant (rs7202116) was associated with phenotypic variability of body mass index (BMI). This finding arose from a large genetic association study, in which a two-stage procedure was implemented. The study found a significant p-value of 2.4E-10 with a sample size of 131,233, establishing rs7202116's influence on the variance of BMI.
title: On Mendelian Randomization Mixed-Scale Treatment Effect Robust Identification (MR MiSTERI) and Estimation for Causal Inference

finding: The SNP rs11642015 linked to FTO revealed significant association with substance consumption in the study.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The PLCG2:rs72824905-G variant was recognized as protective against Alzheimer's disease.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The rs10852372 signal was near C16orf72, recently identified as a regulator of telomere integrity and p53 regulation. It replicated at nominal significance in the pregnancy loss GWAS, showing directionally consistent findings.
title: Trans-ancestral Genome Wide Association Study of Sporadic and Recurrent Miscarriage

finding: The SNP rs217184 served as the leading SNP for the second most significant locus associated with MetaboAgeMort and was found within the genes TXNL4B, HPR, and HP on chromosome 16, indicating its role in the genetic etiology of metabolomic aging.
title: Heterogeneous metabolomic aging across the same age and prediction of health outcome

finding: The rs1558902 variant within the FTO gene was associated with fat mass and eating behavior. It was also used in a sensitivity analysis to capture the count of effect alleles related to fat mass percentage. The analysis showed that the PGI including this SNP had the strongest association in the youngest cohort, supporting the role of this genetic variant in modifying BMI and fat mass as obesity rates have increased.
title: Genetic Risk for High Body Mass Index Before and Amidst the Obesity Epidemic: Cross-Cohort Analysis of Four British Birth Cohort Studies

finding: The SNP rs7193778 was previously associated with urate levels. The application of Deep-PheWAS revealed various associations for rs7193778 that were not documented in the GWAS Catalog, most notably with blood sodium levels.
title: Deep-PheWAS: a pipeline for phenotype generation and association analysis for phenome-wide association studies

finding: This SNP in the FTO gene was linked to atypical subtypes of major depression, showing that its effects on major depression symptoms differ across subtypes, as noted in earlier research.
title: Genetic structure of major depression symptoms across clinical and community cohorts

finding: This missense variant in ABCA3 was associated with reduced FEV1/FVC and was reported to cause paediatric interstitial lung disease.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The rs1805008 variant in MC1R was positively associated with melanoma, showing an odds ratio of 1.56 and a p-value of 2.73×10^-9 when comparing individuals with at least one melanoma diagnosis to cancer-free controls.
title: Assessment of Genetic Susceptibility to Multiple Primary Cancers through Whole-Exome Sequencing in Two Large Multi-Ancestry Studies

finding: The rs9934438 A allele was found to be associated with lower VKORC1 expression in the liver, which reinforced the association with a decreased NAFLD-S phenotype. Additionally, this allele was linked to lower hip and waist circumference, decreased BMI, and multiple fat mass phenotypes, alongside protective associations with several cardiometabolic biomarkers, including lower plasma triglycerides, ApoB, and HbA1c, as well as higher HDL and ApoA levels.
title: A functional genomic framework to elucidate novel causal non-alcoholic fatty liver disease genes

finding: The SNP rs12446759 was identified as sitting upstream of the canonical PLCG2 transcription start site and was associated with increased expression of both the RP11-960L18.1 lncRNA and PLCG2_RP11-960L18.1 fusion isoforms. Its location was crucial, as it was only 13bp away from a splice site directly impacted by genetic variants, indicating that it likely altered splice site choice.
title: Long-read RNA-seq atlas of novel microglia isoforms elucidates disease-associated genetic regulation of splicing

finding: SNP rs12446781 was found to have a significant association with junction usage due to its proximity to a splice site. It was noted that this variant could act in conjunction with rs12446759 to impact splice site choice, and was part of the overall colocalization results with PLCG2 and RP11-960L18.1 isoforms.
title: Long-read RNA-seq atlas of novel microglia isoforms elucidates disease-associated genetic regulation of splicing

finding: The SNP rs1143679, a missense variant in ITGAM, disrupted several transcription factor binding sites and considerably weakened enhancer activity, linking it to immune function alterations in SLE.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS analysis pipeline defines functional variants and target genes for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

finding: This coding SNP, with a CADD score of 23.1, was positioned in the FBRS gene on chromosome 16 and had a p-value of 2.08E-08, recently linked to smoking initiation.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: The ECI1 variant was associated with dodecadienoate levels, indicating its metabolic functions.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: This SNP displayed a nominal association (p=8.10E-07) with the CDH13 gene, marked by its previous links to methamphetamine response.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: This SNP showed significant association (p=3.80E-08) near CYLD and SALL1, historically linked to risk-taking.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: The SNP rs7194734 showed a significant association with shorter telomere length and an increased likelihood of coronary heart disease, implicating it in cardiac aging processes.
title: Leukocyte Telomere Length and Cardiac Structure and Function: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The SNP rs6498552 in the BMERB1 locus was prioritized due to its proximity to the GWS threshold and replicated fine-mapped TWAS hits showing an inverse association with sCJD risk.
title: Multiomic Analyses Direct Hypotheses for Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease Risk Genes

finding: The rs78887288 variant, located in the ATP2C2 gene, was identified in a family with specific language impairment (SLI). This rare non-synonymous variant (chr16:84405221, c.G304A, p.V102M) was previously implicated in language disorders through association studies. The finding was consistent with earlier reports that also highlighted the same variant's significance in susceptibility to language disorders. In further analyses, it showed a higher frequency in individuals with language impairment compared to those with dyslexia and ADHD, emphasizing its potential role in language-related phenotypes.
title: A rare missense variant in the ATP2C2 gene is associated with language impairment and related measures

finding: The sentinel SNP rs4986970 near LCAT was associated with HDL modulation and coronary heart disease, highlighting its potential as a drug target for lipid management.
title: Lipo-proteomic and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: The SNP rs821840 located near CETP was shown to influence HDL metabolism and has implications for coronary heart disease risk.
title: Lipo-proteomic and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: The SNP rs752371476 was identified as a heterozygous mutation c.1206G>A (p.Trp402*) in the CCDC78 gene, leading to a premature stop codon at position 402 of the CCDC78 protein. This genetic alteration was linked to cases of autosomal dominant centronuclear myopathy-4 (CNM4) and highlighted the role of CCDC78 as a causative gene for this condition.
title: CCDC78: unveiling the function of a novel gene associated to hereditary myopathy

finding: The SNP rs112525682, found in the gene GSE1 on chromosome 16, exhibited suggestive association with a p-value of 2.64×10^-7. Despite this significant finding, it was also not tested in a replication cohort because it was not directly genotyped in the respective dataset.
title: Phenotypic and genetic factors are associated with absence of cardiomyopathy symptoms in PLN c.40_42delAGA carriers

finding: The rs11117420 SNP associated with the IRF8 gene displayed significant interactions exclusively in CD14+ monocytes and was correlated with a higher expression of IRF8, indicating its role in SSc through cell type specific interactions.
title: Functional genomics in primary T cells and monocytes identifies mechanisms by which genetic susceptibility loci influence systemic sclerosis risk

finding: The SNP rs7185636 was associated with a 22 kb deletion at the IQCK locus. This variant showed nominal association patterns resembling those of established Alzheimer's Disease genome-wide association studies (GWAS) SNPs and was related to depression in the cohort study.
title: Structural variants linked to Alzheimer’s Disease and other common age-related clinical and neuropathologic traits

finding: The tag eSNP rs2937127 was shown to have no eQTL effect in females, while it was associated with downregulation of TERF2 gene expression in males. The minor allele of this SNP was linked to altered expression of this male-biased gene, further revealing sex-specific genetic regulation connected to stress responses.
title: Autosomal sex-biased genetic regulation of the stress response

finding: The SNP rs72786786 was identified as an outlier in the general population analysis, contributing to a weakly significant P-value of 0.047 when removed using MR-IVW and MR-LASSO estimation. This analysis suggested that the presence of this SNP may distort the association between insulin resistance and major depressive disorder, indicating its potential importance in understanding the relationship between these conditions.
title: Sex-Specific causal dynamic between Insulin resistance and MDD, a bidirectional Mendelian randomization study

finding: Similar to rs1712355, this SNP was associated with heart failure, contributing to the overall significant findings of the GWAS related to HF.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: In terms of time to irreversible EDSS milestones, rs11399831 was shown to have aHR of 0.77 (p=0.036) for irEDSS3 and 0.74 (p=2.82×10-4) for irEDSS6, indicating a role in predicting the progression of MS disability.
title: Not all roads lead to the immune system: The Genetic Basis of Multiple Sclerosis Severity Implicates Central Nervous System and Mitochondrial Involvement

finding: This SNP was identified as a migraine with aura (MA)-specific variant with a high probability (>95%) of being subtype-specific.
title: Genome-wide analysis of 102,084 migraine cases identifies 123 risk loci and subtype-specific risk alleles

finding: The SNP rs56094641, an intronic variant in the FTO gene, showed a significant association with body fat distribution traits such as VAT, ASAT, and GFAT, with ASAT demonstrating the strongest association (P = 1.3 x 10^-22). This SNP had previously been linked to childhood and adult obesity.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: Rs1544637 had genetic overlaps with mean axial diffusivity across the whole brain, indicating a correlation with insomnia.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs4784256 also exhibited genetic overlaps with sleep-related linear traits.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: SNP rs1421085 was associated with increased risk for both preeclampsia (PE) and hypertension (HTN), demonstrating a genetic overlap between these two health issues.
title: Spatially Constrained Gene Regulation Identifies Key Genetic Contributions of Preeclampsia, Hypertension and Proteinuria

finding: The SNP rs9939609, located in the fat mass and obesity-associated gene (FTO), was positively associated with Body Mass Index (BMI) and systolic blood pressure (SBP). This was demonstrated through two-sample Mendelian randomization, which estimated the causal effect of BMI on SBP from various studies, including one involving 2,479 individuals measured at 11 occasions between ages 2 and 53 and another with 37,027 Danish individuals. The findings were consistent with results from the Rotterdam Study with 5,123 individuals.
title: Interpretation of mendelian randomization using one measure of an exposure that varies over time

finding: This variant showed significant association with overweight and obesity in both cohorts, linking it to metabolic pathways potentially relevant to Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Cross-phenotype associations between Alzheimer’s Disease and its comorbidities may provide clues to progression

finding: The SNP rs11642015, related to FTO, was also newly associated with non-caffeine substances intake, highlighting its emerging significance.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The SNP rs7188250 was noted for its association with OUD with a p-value of 3.63×10⁻⁸, indicating relevance within the genetic landscape of OUD and contributing to its understanding.
title: Genome-wide association study and multi-trait analysis of opioid use disorder identifies novel associations in 639,709 individuals of European and African ancestry

finding: It was the second most significant lead SNP found on chromosome 16, associated with delayed walking with a p-value of 2.637 x 10^-11, and located near the gene RBL2.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis of age at onset of walking

finding: This SNP was identified as a causal variant impacting both age at onset of walking and RBL2 expression, leading to a missense variant (p.Tyr210Cys) highlighted for its functional significance in delayed walking.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis of age at onset of walking

finding: SNP rs4638568 was linked to all epilepsy groups, indicating a broader association across various forms of epilepsy despite the gene HEATR3's precise role remaining unclear.
title: Systematic review of genome wide association studies (GWAS) of epilepsy identifies common risk variants and associated genes

finding: The SNP rs9939609 was determined to relate to the FTO gene, which has been widely studied in connection to obesity and body mass index (BMI). It represented a functional haplotype of significant clinical relevance in the field of genetics, showcasing its importance in qualitative assessments of genetic characteristics.
title: PAGEANT: Personal Access to Genome and Analysis of Natural Traits

finding: The SNP rs72802342 was identified as a candidate causal variant at the CTRB1/2 locus, which colocalized with pQTLs for multiple pancreatic enzymes including PRSS2 and CPA1. This variant exhibited a posterior probability of 0.26 for being associated with T1D risk, indicating a significant relationship. It was found to overlap with cell type-specific regulatory elements (cREs) in acinar cells, suggesting that altered acinar regulation contributes to the shared associations between T1D risk and pancreatic enzyme levels.
title: Circulating pancreatic enzyme levels are a causal biomarker of type 1 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs3924376 was identified as a cis eQTL in CD4NC for SPNS1, a gene associated with mitochondrial homeostasis. Additionally, it was recognized as a trans eQTL for MRPL32, a gene on chromosome 7 encoding Mitochondrial ribosomal protein L32.
title: Efficient and accurate mixed model association tool for single-cell eQTL analysis

finding: This SNP was included in the group that had very strong evidence for an association with periodontal disease and was associated with colorectal cancer risk, although specific p-values for cancer were not provided.
title: Two-sample Mendelian randomization analysis of associations between periodontal disease and risk of colorectal, lung, and pancreatic cancers

finding: The rs3087456 polymorphism, located in the CIITA promoter III, was significantly associated with 28-day mortality in patients with septic shock. The GG genotype correlated with a higher risk of mortality (OR 2.29; 95% CI: 1.01 to 5.22; P = 0.043) and was linked to persistently low levels of monocyte HLA-DR expression throughout the ICU stay, unlike the AA or AG genotypes which showed increased levels of HLA-DR after one week of treatment. Functional assays demonstrated that the GG genotype resulted in decreased promoter activity, which could be restored by IFN-γ stimulation.
title: CIITA G-286A promoter polymorphism impairs monocytes HLA-DR expression in septic shock and is rescued by interferon-γ

finding: Associated with COVID-19 hospitalization (OR=1.31, p=9.64×10^-9), this variant was linked near the CREBBP locus.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: The SNP rs1421085 at the FTO locus was identified as a putative causal variant for body mass index (BMI), body fat percentage (BFP), hip circumference (HC), and waist circumference (WC). It was validated to play a causal role in adipocyte thermogenesis regulation.
title: Genome-wide fine-mapping improves identification of causal variants

finding: The SNP rs76488452 was identified as a secondary signal at the FTO locus with a PIP of 0.85. It was found to reside in a conserved region in primates and had a p-value of 1.8×10^-17 conditional on the known causal variant, implicating it in a potentially masked effect.
title: Genome-wide fine-mapping improves identification of causal variants

finding: Included in super variant chr16_57 (OR=1.394, p=1.19×10−7), where its association with COVID-19 sheds insight into disease mechanisms.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: In a similar context, SNP rs112525682 on chromosome 16 near GSE1 had a suggestive association with a p-value of 2.64×10^-7, identified during the analysis of genetic variants among PLN c.40_42delAGA carriers.
title: Phenotypic and genetic factors are associated with absence of cardiomyopathy symptoms in PLN c.40_42delAGA carriers

finding: The rs55993634 SNP was highlighted for its trans-colocalizing signal, associating genetically predicted lower PNLIPRP1 protein with a lower risk of type 2 diabetes but a higher risk of type 1 diabetes, demonstrating the complexity of diabetes-related genetic risk factors.
title: Systematic disease-agnostic identification of therapeutically actionable targets using the genetics of human plasma proteins

finding: The SNP rs35994878 was associated with an 11% increase in posterior brain arterial diameter and achieved genome-wide significance (P=2.94×10^-8), mapping to an intron of the TCF25 gene.
title: Chromosome 10q24.32 Variants Associate with Brain Arterial Diameters in Diverse Populations: A Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The SNP rs1421085 was notably associated with obesity through its role in activating the genes IRX3 and IRX5, which are involved in the differentiation of adipocyte subtypes. This association highlighted the genetic predisposition to changes in body mass index (BMI), particularly in the context of environmental factors such as job loss.
title: The Impact of Late-Career Job Loss and Genotype on Body Mass Index

finding: This SNP was reported as a non-synonymous variant associated with the CNOT1 gene and was implicated in the risk of mood disorders based on its presence in stronger linkage with lead SNPs.
title: Genome-wide significant risk loci for mood disorders in the Old Order Amish founder population

finding: Like rs201250006, this SNP is also a non-synonymous variant in strong linkage with the CNOT1 gene, reinforcing its association with mood disorder risk within the studied population.
title: Genome-wide significant risk loci for mood disorders in the Old Order Amish founder population

finding: This SNP, another non-synonymous variant in the CNOT1 gene, was identified as being in perfect LD with rs960417287 and tied to mood disorder risk.
title: Genome-wide significant risk loci for mood disorders in the Old Order Amish founder population

finding: This SNP, associated with the CNOT1 gene, was noted for its strong linkage to other lead SNPs within the context of mood disorder risk.
title: Genome-wide significant risk loci for mood disorders in the Old Order Amish founder population

finding: The variant rs7187776, located in the 5' UTR of the TUFM gene, was identified as likely causal for increased BMI and decreased caudate volume. This association was attributed to the alternate allele creating an ETS binding site that increased chromatin accessibility specifically in microglial cells, as supported by genetic correlation analyses and previous GWAS associations.
title: Exploring the molecular basis of the genetic correlation between body mass index and brain morphological traits

finding: Identified within the CLEC16A gene, rs8062322 had a significant association with pSSNS (p = 1.61 × 10^-10), marking it as a novel finding related to the disease's genetic architecture.
title: Multi-population genome-wide association study implicates both immune and non-immune factors in the etiology of pediatric steroid sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The rs28372783 SNP was identified as a <italic>cis</italic>-pQTL for the protein CDH1 in the Chinese Biobank (CKB) but not in the UK Biobank Plasma Proteome Project (UKB-PPP), highlighting its potential importance in determining plasma levels of this protein.
title: Ancestry diversity in the genetic determinants of the human plasma proteome and associated new drug targets

finding: The rs752405406 variant, corresponding to c.13801delG, was identified in PCD patients and was enriched in the Finnish population with an allele frequency of 0.0005309. It was specifically noted that this variant was linked to the pathogenesis of PCD in the Finnish cohort, contributing to genetic diagnostics.
title: HYDIN variants cause primary ciliary dyskinesia in the Finnish population

finding: The rs200169224 variant, represented by c.12899G>C, was more common in the Finnish population with an allele frequency of 0.003242. Although it appeared in other populations (European, African, American), its prevalence in Finland suggested it could be a significant contributor to PCD within this population.
title: HYDIN variants cause primary ciliary dyskinesia in the Finnish population

finding: The variant rs173539 was associated with high density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol levels, connecting it to increased levels of the APOA1 protein, a component of HDL, suggesting a mechanism by which it influences cholesterol levels.
title: Plasma Proteome Variation and its Genetic Determinants in Children and Adolescents

finding: The lead SNP rs876987 was associated with an inverse effect on placental weight relative to birth weight and was intragenic in SLC7A5, which plays a role in the uptake of essential amino acids in the placenta.
title: Genome-wide association study of placental weight in 179,025 children and parents reveals distinct and shared genetic influences between placental and fetal growth

finding: For rs60782127, the low-frequency missense variant p.Arg433Ser was identified with a very high probability of causality (PP=0.99) at the ABCC1 locus. This variant was linked to decreased levels of glutathione metabolites, implicating MRP1 in glutathione metabolism.
title: Genomic discovery and functional validation of MRP1 as a novel fetal hemoglobin modulator and potential therapeutic target in sickle cell disease

finding: The common intronic variant rs246232 was found in the ABCC1 locus with a probability of causality of 0.92, establishing its role in the genetic landscape influencing fetal hemoglobin.
title: Genomic discovery and functional validation of MRP1 as a novel fetal hemoglobin modulator and potential therapeutic target in sickle cell disease

finding: A genome-wide significant association was discovered at rs2161648 near the BCAR1 and CFDP1 genes for spontaneous pneumothorax (p=4.8e-08, MAF=0.41318, OR=1.268), indicating its potential role in lung function.
title: Large-scale trans-ethnic replication and discovery of genetic associations for rare diseases with self-reported medical data

finding: The locus rs9931494, near FTO, was associated with AF and also with several cardiometabolic traits, suggesting it had universal effects influencing both AF development and metabolic health.
title: Deciphering the genetic architecture of atrial fibrillation offers insights into disease prediction, pathophysiology and downstream sequelae

finding: The FTO variant (rs7202116) was found to be associated with the phenotypic variability of body mass index (BMI), with a significant P-value of 2.4E-10 across a sample size of 131,233. This association was established through a two-stage procedure analyzing the impact of the SNP on BMI variance.
title: On Mendelian Randomization Mixed-Scale Treatment Effect Robust Identification (MR MiSTERI) and Estimation for Causal Inference

finding: The rs13331259 SNP, an intronic variant in the FAM234A gene, was identified as having a significant effect on haemoglobin concentration with a P-value of 3.32 × 10^-4 and an IRNT effect size of -0.2495, indicating a decrease of approximately -3.10 g/L per allele. This variant had a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.11 in the African (AFR) population and was noted as one of the few loci with a large effect size that surpassed specified thresholds.
title: Statistical haemoglobin thresholds to define anaemia across the lifecycle

finding: The rs180924818 SNP, identified in the XYLT1 locus, was significantly associated with LiD, showing a hazard ratio of 3.13 (p = 6.27 × 10^-9), indicating a high probability of developing LiD related to this variant.
title: Genetic meta-analysis of levodopa induced dyskinesia in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs7193665 was identified as a significant contributor to brain shape variations, confirming its relevance alongside volumetric measures.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: Identified as a significant contributor to variations in white matter structure, rs56023709 underscored previous genetic findings with neurological implications.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: Found to correlate with multiple shape features of the left hippocampus, this SNP served as an eQTL for several genes important in neural development.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: Located near the CREBBP gene, rs76564172 reached statistical significance (OR=1.31, 95% CI: 1.25-1.38, p=9.64×10^-9) in association with COVID-19 hospitalization.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: The rs7203642-A variant, located in the intronic region of the UMOD gene at locus 16p12, was associated with increased blood NfL levels, with a significant P-value of 1.37x10^-8. This association indicates a potential link between kidney function and neurodegenerative processes.
title: Genome-wide Association Study Meta-analysis of Neurofilament light (NfL) levels in blood reveals novel loci related to neurodegeneration

finding: The rs77924615-A variant, identified within the PDILT gene at locus 16p12, was associated with increased blood NfL levels, although the finding became less significant when conditioned on kidney function, suggesting a complex relationship with renal processes.
title: Genome-wide Association Study Meta-analysis of Neurofilament light (NfL) levels in blood reveals novel loci related to neurodegeneration

finding: The SNP rs8050136 showed a significant association with Body Mass Index (BMI), evidenced by a p-value of 1.6E-08 and a beta coefficient of 0.064 in the GWAS. This connection highlighted its potential impact on BMI and its relevance to the genetic predisposition for Type 2 Diabetes (T2D).
title: Improved Type 2 Diabetes Risk Stratification in the Qatar Biobank Cohort by Ensemble Learning Classifier Incorporating Multi-Trait, Population-Specific, Polygenic Risk Scores

finding: Identified as associated with mild progression subtype (Subtype I), further illustrating genetic diversity in Parkinson's disease progression.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: Identified as associated with mild progression subtype (Subtype I), adding to the genetic nuances in Parkinson's disease progression.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: The SNP rs113078989 was identified as having male-specific effects on gray matter volume (GMV) in the six motor area (6MA), linked to the gene RBFOX1, which is associated with several male-biased neuropsychiatric disorders including autism spectrum disorder and schizophrenia. Male carriers of the minor allele (CT genotype) exhibited higher GMV compared to homozygous individuals (TT genotype). This SNP showed a statistically significant association with neural anatomy at a strict statistical threshold.
title: A sex-stratified analysis of the genetic architecture of human brain anatomy

finding: The missense variant rs117169628:G>A (p.Pro256Leu) in SLC22A31 conferred an increased risk for hospitalization from COVID-19 (OR = 1.09, P = 2.6 × 10^-8), linking this locus to important biological functions in lung surfactant transport.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19: an update

finding: This SNP, associated with the adipose-associated gene FTO, had positive causal effect estimates for both PCOS and pre-eclampsia and was part of the substantial cluster for these conditions.
title: The role of obesity in female reproductive conditions: A Mendelian Randomisation study

finding: This SNP, linked to SH2B1 and associated with insulin resistance, also had positive causal effects for PCOS and pre-eclampsia, belonging to the substantial cluster.
title: The role of obesity in female reproductive conditions: A Mendelian Randomisation study

finding: Associated with heart failure at a combined analysis threshold, highlighting its role in the genetic predisposition to HF.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The SNP rs3915499 showed a positive finding as it was linked to two distinct pathways, 'renal' and 'vessel', which related to the disruption caused by it in the smooth muscle myosin heavy-chain 11 gene. This SNP's association emphasized the complexity of its role in cardiovascular and renal conditions, particularly in blood pressure regulation.
title: Distinct pathway-based effects of blood pressure and body mass index on cardiovascular traits: comparison of novel Mendelian Randomization approaches

finding: The SNP rs12102767 was associated with non-invasive biomarkers for the early detection of breast cancer. This finding highlighted its potential relevance in contributing to the biological pathways affected in the disease, particularly in relation to circulating miRNA changes observed in the study.
title: BioDecoder: A miRNA Bio-interpretable Neural Network Model for Noninvasive Diagnosis of Breast Cancer

finding: Previously suggested association with phoneme awareness in the dyslexia context, showing relevance to cognitive markers of dyslexia.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of quantitative reading skill and dyslexia improves gene discovery

finding: This SNP at the CDH13 locus was associated with adiponectin levels, and maintained statistical significance in models accounting for high heterogeneity.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: This SNP was listed among the putative causal variants in the analysis, specifically near the CMIP gene.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: This SNP was associated with increased risk for Alzheimer's disease (MAF=12.2%, beta=0.07, p-value<2.3×10^-8). It was linked with structural alterations leading to truncated IL-34 protein affecting receptor signaling.
title: From genome to phenome via the proteome: broad capture, antibody-based proteomics to explore disease mechanisms

finding: The rs8046424 variant was related to reduced childhood obesity (MAF=48.2%, beta=-0.008, p-value<4.4×10^-9), mapping to a binding domain of IL-34 receptor CSF-1R.
title: From genome to phenome via the proteome: broad capture, antibody-based proteomics to explore disease mechanisms

finding: The variant rs2042395 exhibited a significantly higher frequency in Europeans compared to Africans and has been previously associated with well-being spectrum traits in individuals of European ancestry.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Pulmonary Function in Europeans and Africans from the UK Biobank Identifies Distinct Variants

finding: Similar to rs2042395, rs3748400 also showed a significantly higher frequency in Europeans and has been implicated in traits associated with pulmonary function.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Pulmonary Function in Europeans and Africans from the UK Biobank Identifies Distinct Variants

finding: The SNP rs8045843 was found at a higher frequency in Europeans and is associated with sensitivity to environmental stress and adversity among European populations.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Pulmonary Function in Europeans and Africans from the UK Biobank Identifies Distinct Variants

finding: The SNP rs12925700 was reported as being associated with pulmonary function in Europeans and found to be more frequent in this group as compared to Africans.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Pulmonary Function in Europeans and Africans from the UK Biobank Identifies Distinct Variants

finding: The SNP rs4843559 in C16orf95 was linked to pTau levels in CSF, marking it as a novel finding in the pathway of Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis for Alzheimer’s disease cerebrospinal fluid biomarkers

finding: The SNP rs35994878 was associated with an 11% increase in posterior brain arterial diameter (β = 0.11, P = 2.94×10^-8), being part of the TCF25 gene locus.
title: Chromosome 10q24.32 Variants Associate with Brain Arterial Diameters in Diverse Populations: A Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: This SNP was an index for the ZFHX3 locus and was included in significant findings for CES as noted, but no novel context was provided for this specific SNP.
title: MULTITRAIT ANALYSIS EXPANDS GENETIC RISK FACTORS IN CARDIOEMBOLIC STROKE

finding: Located at 16p12.1, the lead variant rs144651842 is a missense variant in IL4R, previously linked to psoriasis in earlier studies. It mediates signals from interleukins known to be implicated in the disease.
title: Genetic study of psoriasis highlights its close link with socio-economic status and affective symptoms

finding: For the PLCG2 gene, variant rs370477719 was identified uniquely in the B1 line and was classified as 'rare' (ExAC_SAS score of 0.0004). It was categorized as 'deleterious' by three prediction tools, highlighting its potential contribution to abnormal cellular migration in the context of bipolar disorder.
title: Dysregulation in EGF/ERBB signaling pathway may explain abnormalities in cellular migration in bipolar disorder in patient-derived neural precursors

finding: PLCG2 variant rs138637229 was found in the B2 line and was similarly rare (ExAC_SAS score of 0.0004) and marked as 'deleterious' by three prediction tools, thus being relevant to the dysfunctional cellular migration observed in bipolar disorder.
title: Dysregulation in EGF/ERBB signaling pathway may explain abnormalities in cellular migration in bipolar disorder in patient-derived neural precursors

finding: The SNP rs11574938 served as a genetic proxy for ITGAL inhibition, with a very significant eQTL (p = 7.9E-150). This finding pointed to the off-target effects of statins, suggesting a relationship between immune activation and depression.
title: Statins and antidepressants induce similar in vitro gene expression responses

finding: This SNP was prioritized at the RMI2 locus, a known component that suppresses alternative lengthening of telomeres (ALT), through identified association with shorter LTL.
title: Genomic, phenomic, and geographic associations of leukocyte telomere length in the United States

finding: At locus AXIN1, this SNP was associated with regulation of Wnt signaling, a pathway known to contribute to telomere maintenance, indicating its involvement in telomere length regulation.
title: Genomic, phenomic, and geographic associations of leukocyte telomere length in the United States

finding: The SNP rs12051090 was associated with the expression levels of estrogen receptor (ER) and progesterone receptor (PR) in tumors. Specifically, the study illustrated that patients with ER+PR+ tumors had improved survival outcomes compared to those with differing receptor statuses, thereby confirming the original finding of PR as a significant prognostic marker in high-grade serous carcinoma (HGSC) and its response to chemotherapy.
title: Hormone Receptor Expression and Disease Prognosis in High-Grade Serous Ovarian Cancer

finding: The SNP rs8051014 was found to be associated with RP and showed a shared genetic signal with coronary atherosclerosis. It explained about 22% of the genetic signal in the RP context, reinforcing its role in cardiovascular conditions.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies ADRA2A and IRX1 as novel risk genes for Raynaud’s phenomenon

finding: Identified as a proxy for one of the absent SNPs, rs7187819 could still be inferred to have biological implications even though no direct association was reported.
title: Causal effects of maternal circulating amino acids on offspring birthweight: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The intronic variant rs7499892 at the CETP locus was identified in a female-only meta-analysis for stroke, exhibiting a stronger association in females (effect size (se) of 0.078, p-value = 1.08×10^-8) compared to males (effect size (se) of 0.007, p-value = 0.56). Previous research indicated that CETP's transgenic expression affects plasma triglyceride levels through different mechanisms for each sex (Palmisano et al., 2016; 2021).
title: Global Biobank Meta-analysis Initiative: powering genetic discovery across human diseases

finding: Labrecque et al. provided an empirical example to estimate the lifetime effect of body mass index (BMI) on systolic blood pressure using the rs9939609 variant. They demonstrated that when the genetic variable-exposure relationship was constant over time, estimates were unbiased at both ages 30 and 50 years. In scenarios where this relationship varied, the estimates differed, indicating potential bias related to the timing of measurement.
title: A systematic literature review of methodological approaches, challenges, and opportunities in the application of Mendelian randomisation to lifecourse epidemiology

finding: The index SNP rs1566452, situated at the 16q22.1 locus, was significantly associated with eQTLs in coronary and tibial arteries, indicating its involvement in gene regulation related to cardiovascular disease through the WWP2 gene, which participates in disease progression.
title: Contribution of leukocyte telomere length to major cardiovascular diseases onset: phenotypic and genetic insights from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: The SNP rs7206790 was identified as a direct causal variant linked to the FTO locus, which is associated with BMI. It remained significant upon applying the CS-Pratt threshold.
title: Uncovering causal gene-tissue pairs and variants: A multivariable TWAS method controlling for infinitesimal effects

finding: Similar to rs7206790, the SNP rs3751813 was identified as a direct causal variant in the FTO locus. It was successfully retained after applying the CS-Pratt threshold, indicating a persistent association.
title: Uncovering causal gene-tissue pairs and variants: A multivariable TWAS method controlling for infinitesimal effects

finding: While initially not highlighted prominently, the SNP rs11642841 was mentioned in the context of sQTLs for the FTO locus. Its identification alongside rs7206790 suggests an association with obesity.
title: Uncovering causal gene-tissue pairs and variants: A multivariable TWAS method controlling for infinitesimal effects

finding: This SNP was associated with childhood and adult obesity.
title: VAREANT: a bioinformatics application for gene variant reduction and annotation

finding: The study associated the FTO-rs9939609 polymorphism with metabolic obesity phenotypes, highlighting its role in influencing the atherogenic index of plasma (AIP) and cardiometabolic indices in the Azar cohort population. This finding was relevant to understanding the link between genetic predisposition and obesity-related cardiovascular risks.
title: Association between cardiometabolic phenotypes with atherogenic index of plasma: a cross-sectional study from the Azar Cohort Study

finding: The SNP rs7140 was identified as a major contributor to the selection of the candidate gene SPNS1 in its respective locus for Parkinson's disease (PD). This variant resulted in the p.L512M mutation in the SPNS1 gene, which encodes a sphingolipid transmembrane transporter at the lysosomal membrane. SPNS1 expression was found to be lower in the SOX6_ATGR1 dopaminergic neuron subpopulation in PD patients compared to controls, indicating its potential involvement in PD pathogenesis related to the autophagy-lysosomal pathway.
title: Identification of novel variants, genes and pathways potentially linked to Parkinson’s disease using machine learning

finding: The SNP rs450674 was linked with the gene MAF, found in microglia, indicating its potential role in AD through immune response mechanisms.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing data reveals rewiring of transcriptional relationships in Alzheimer’s Disease associated with risk variants

finding: The SNP rs1140239 was associated with the gene ZNF785, prioritized in the context of AD.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing data reveals rewiring of transcriptional relationships in Alzheimer’s Disease associated with risk variants

finding: The study found that the intronic rs2925049 SNP of the human COTL1 gene was significantly associated with estimated bone mineral density (eBMD) in a large cohort from the UK Biobank (p = 2.84×10-6, beta = -0.0013). This SNP's p-value was below the Bonferroni-corrected threshold, indicating a strong association. Furthermore, several SNPs near rs2925049 also showed moderate significance, reinforcing the notion that variations in the COTL1 gene could play a crucial role in determining bone density in humans.
title: Loss of coactosin-like F-actin binding protein 1 (Cotl1) decreases platelet-mediated osteoclastogenesis and causes osteopetrosis phenotypes in mouse

finding: The SNP rs113962704 located in the LITAF gene demonstrated an association with serum IgA levels (Beta=0.05, P=1.91×10^-12), supporting its function in TNF-alpha regulation in intestinal macrophages.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: The SNP rs1458201 at the CTF1 locus was strongly associated with serum IgA levels (Beta=0.052, P=2.02×10^-11), implicating it in various immune-related pathways.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: This SNP at 16p12.3 served as a splicing quantitative trait locus (sQTL) for the GP2 gene in the pancreas, suggesting its potential influence on the interplay between depression and T2D.
title: Multi-trait genetic analysis identifies novel pleiotropic loci for depression and SCZ in East Asians

finding: This SNP at 16q12.2 is positioned in the intron of the AMFR gene, associated with psychological issues in prior studies and newly identified in the context of depression.
title: Multi-trait genetic analysis identifies novel pleiotropic loci for depression and SCZ in East Asians

finding: The SNP rs17817288 located within <italic>FTO</italic> was associated with a rapid increase in BMI following the adiposity rebound.
title: Characterization of the genetic architecture of BMI in infancy and early childhood reveals age-specific effects and implicates pathways involved in Mendelian obesity

finding: The SNP rs9939609 at the FTO locus was highlighted as having the strongest evidence for association with BMI. The study utilized this SNP as part of the analysis to explore its role in maternal pre-/early pregnancy BMI and its potential causal effect on offspring adiposity outcomes.
title: Exploring the causal effect of maternal pregnancy adiposity on offspring adiposity: Mendelian randomization using polygenic risk scores

finding: The BCKDK rs14235 A allele was associated with milder motor impairment and altered network topology in Parkinson's disease, indicating a potential protective effect against severe symptoms.
title: Striatal dopamine depletion drives disease progression and network topology aberrations specifically by impairing left M1 network

finding: The rs9923231 variant (VKORC1 -1639G>A) was identified as a highly prevalent PGx risk variant among the 486,956 Han Chinese participants in the Taiwan Precision Medicine Initiative (TPMI). This finding aligned with previous studies in other Han Chinese cohorts. It contributed to the overall observation that 99.9% of participants carried at least one PGx variant. The significance of this SNP in relation to drug response indicated its role in influencing the efficacy and safety of anticoagulant medications, particularly warfarin.
title: Clinical Impact of Pharmacogenetic Risk Variants in a Large Chinese Cohort

finding: The T allele at rs1558902 was associated with an increased rate of BMI change from infancy to late childhood (P<7×10^-7) but did not show association with adolescent slope (P=0.129). The SNP was also correlated with lower AUC in infancy (P=0.002) and higher AUC in late childhood and adolescence (P<4×10^-14), displaying a pattern of early decrease followed by a later increase in BMI.
title: A framework for conducting time-varying genome-wide association studies: An application to body mass index across childhood in six multiethnic cohorts

finding: The T allele at rs55872725 was associated with increased BMI change rate during childhood (P<7×10^-7), showing a consistent pattern with prior findings. It was linked to lower AUC in infancy (P=0.002), no association in early childhood (P=0.502), and higher AUC in late childhood and adolescence (P<4×10^-14), confirming established earlier observations of age-related BMI influences.
title: A framework for conducting time-varying genome-wide association studies: An application to body mass index across childhood in six multiethnic cohorts

finding: The SNP rs3927943 was shown to explain over 0.8 of variance in the expression of the trans-eGene NPIPB15, demonstrating a high level of influence on gene expression.
title: Whole Genome DNA and RNA Sequencing of Whole Blood Elucidates the Genetic Architecture of Gene Expression Underlying a Wide Range of Diseases

finding: The common rs6979 variant was associated with HGSOC, albeit with a modest risk estimate, contributing to the understanding of telomere maintenance in cancer susceptibility.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study of 398,238 women unveils seven novel loci associated with high-grade serous epithelial ovarian cancer risk

finding: The variant rs7196726 located within the ZNF646 gene demonstrated a strong association with dermatophytosis, with a p-value of 6.60×10^-79 and a beta of 0.07, implicating it in skin integrity and immune defense against the infection.
title: The genetic basis of dermatophytosis skin infection susceptibility

finding: The variant rs35713203 in the PRSS53 gene was also significantly associated with dermatophytosis (p = 1.90×10^-78, beta = 0.065), contributing to the understanding of genetic risk factors for this fungal infection.
title: The genetic basis of dermatophytosis skin infection susceptibility

finding: The variant rs9938550 in the HSD3B7 gene was significantly associated with dermatophytosis (p = 3.43×10^-57, beta = 0.056), suggesting its involvement in the disease.
title: The genetic basis of dermatophytosis skin infection susceptibility

finding: The variant rs1421085 at the FTO locus was implicated in dermatophytosis, with a significant relationship to body mass index (BMI), suggesting obesity-related risk factors for this condition.
title: The genetic basis of dermatophytosis skin infection susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs12051093 was associated with cervical cancer risk due to Mycoplasma co-infection, as reported in the study by Klein et al. (2020). This finding suggested a significant correlational relationship between specific genetic variations and susceptibility to cancer in individuals co-infected with Mycoplasma.
title: Oncogenic human papillomavirus and anal microbiota in men who have sex with men and are living with HIV in Northern Taiwan

finding: The variant rs62040020, located in an intron of JPT2 on chromosome 16, was found to increase IPF risk in females (OR 1.34) and decrease risk in males (OR 0.82). This SNP had not been previously identified in GWAS related to IPF susceptibility and suggested sex-specific effects on genetic risk for IPF.
title: Genome-wide SNP-sex interaction analysis of susceptibility to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The SNP ZNF646/KAT8/BCKDK rs14235 was identified as significantly influencing gene expressions in multiple brain regions related to Parkinson's disease, supporting its role in the disorder.
title: The multi-modality neuroimaging analysis identified an essential genetic variant associated with Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs7499892, which was previously established as associated with LDL-C levels in Europeans, was found to be strongly associated with HDL-C levels in the British Pakistani and Bangladeshi cohort (G&H), with a p-value of 7.08×10^-56. However, it did not show a significant association with LDL-C levels (p=0.23), even though it had sufficient power (>80%) for replication.
title: Transferability of genetic loci and polygenic scores for cardiometabolic traits in British Pakistanis and Bangladeshis

finding: The variant rs76564172 near <italic>CREBBP</italic> reached significance in the analysis (OR=1.31, 95% CI=1.25-1.38, p=9.64×10^-9) indicating its contribution to genetic risk in COVID-19.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: The missense variant rs7185774 within the PKD1L2 gene was associated with various risk estimates, including psychotic disorders (beta=-0.08, p<2.3×10^-43) and chronic liver diseases (beta=-0.08, p<3.1×10^-41). This locus demonstrated a pleiotropic effect, linking eye health indirectly to liver disorders and other systemic diseases.
title: A predictive atlas of disease onset from retinal fundus photographs

finding: Similar to rs1712355, rs12325072 exhibited significant association with HF at a Bonferroni-corrected threshold, implicating it in heart failure susceptibility.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The rs1362756 variant was discussed as having additive association effects with rs33912345 in Brazilian populations, suggesting complex interactions influencing POAG.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The SNP rs113693994 was identified as a cis-sd-pQTL for cadherin -15 (CDH15), significant in both sexes but with opposite effect directions, marking it as unique among findings and revealing its role in cell adhesion.
title: Similar and different: systematic investigation of proteogenomic variation between sexes and its relevance for human diseases

finding: The SNP rs7188841 was associated with significant down-regulation of exon expression for the Glutamate Ionotropic Receptor NMDA Type Subunit 2A (GRIN2A). This alteration was noted specifically in cases of schizophrenia and major depressive disorder, highlighting its relevance to the expression profiles in psychiatric disorders.
title: Variant-risk-exon interplay impacts circadian rhythm and dopamine signaling pathway in severe psychiatric disorders

finding: The IRF8 variant rs12444486 was linked to protection from COVID-19 mortality in African-Americans, indicating a potential beneficial effect that was not observed in European ancestry subjects.
title: Interferon pathway lupus risk alleles modulate risk of death from acute COVID-19

finding: Identified a significant association near CYLD and SALL1, related to risk-taking and smoking initiation.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: The SNP rs9924686 was associated with the Scz intersected with CanUD and was located in the 3′ untranslated region of the serine/threonine-protein kinase gene TAOK2 on chromosome 16. It had a CADD score indicating potential deleteriousness and was also an eQTL for several genes related to metabolic and immunological traits.
title: Cross-ancestry genetic investigation of schizophrenia, cannabis use disorder, and tobacco smoking

finding: The rs372755452 variant found in HBA1 was associated with lower MCH and MCV, replicated across different populations, particularly East Asians.
title: Whole genome sequencing association analysis of quantitative red blood cell phenotypes: the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: The rs868351380 variant, located in the HBA1 gene region, was associated with reduced MCH and MCV, notably among Hispanic individuals, and successfully replicated in further studies.
title: Whole genome sequencing association analysis of quantitative red blood cell phenotypes: the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: This intronic variant of TXNL4B was significantly associated with the HP-TXNL4B locus in the AA population and represented a positive original finding.
title: Antithrombin, protein C and protein S: Genome and transcriptome wide association studies identify 7 novel loci regulating plasma levels

finding: The SNP rs5472, a haptoglobin promoter polymorphism, was identified as a prognostic biomarker for peptide vaccine efficacy in patients with castration-resistant prostate cancer. This finding related to the broader context of biomarkers for prostate cancer and highlighted the potential for rs5472 to impact treatment strategies in aggressive forms of the disease.
title: Accurate prognosis for localized prostate cancer through coherent voting networks with multi-omic and clinical data

finding: The SNP rs77924615 exhibited significant colocalization with chronic kidney disease for subtype 1, with a PPH4 of 1.0, indicating a probable shared causal variant.
title: Identification of distinct trajectories in preclinical type 2 diabetes and their associations with outcomes

finding: The CDH8 variant rs186124051-C, located at a novel gout-associated locus at 16q21, was linked to gout but showed a non-significant negative effect on circulating urate concentration, suggesting independent factors influencing its gout association.
title: Exploring metabolic changes in gout – Insights from a genetic study

finding: The SNP rs3104783 located at the TOX3 locus (16q12.1) was significantly associated with both RLS and Parkinson's disease. For RLS, the p-value was recorded as 1.29 × 10^-12 with an OR of 1.07 (95% CI 1.05-1.09), indicating its relevance in both conditions but noted that the direction of the association differed.
title: Genomic analysis identifies risk factors in restless legs syndrome

finding: The missense variant rs117169628:G>A (p.Pro256Leu) in SLC22A31 also conferred risk for hospitalization, having an OR of 1.09 with a p-value of 2.6 x 10^-8. This variant belonged to a family of solute carrier proteins involved in membrane transport.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19: an update

finding: This SNP acted as a proxy for the analysis focused on genetically determined pancreas fat levels, reinforcing the findings related to PDAC risk.
title: Genetic Evidence Causally Linking Pancreas Fat to Pancreatic Cancer: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: Using this SNP as a proxy, the study underscored the association between genetic variation influencing pancreas fat and the risk of developing PDAC.
title: Genetic Evidence Causally Linking Pancreas Fat to Pancreatic Cancer: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: This SNP was identified as one of the 18 novel shared genetic SNPs related to a positive genetic correlation between body mass index (BMI) and multiple sclerosis (MS).
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: This SNP contributed to the identification of shared genetic risk factors between BMI and MS, being part of the 18 novel SNPs discovered.
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: This SNP was included in the 18 novel shared SNPs that demonstrated a positive genetic correlation between BMI and MS.
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: Identified as one of the 18 novel SNPs indicating shared genetic risk factors between BMI and MS.
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: This SNP was part of the 18 novel shared SNPs that exhibited a positive genetic relationship between BMI and MS.
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: This SNP was involved in the identification of genetic correlations between obesity (BMI) and MS.
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: The SNP rs7200543-A was associated with an odds ratio of 2.2 (1.1-4.8) and its risk allele was linked to lower expression levels of NPIPA1 and PDXDC1, critical genes in metabolic processes.
title: Severe liver damage, low bone mineral content, and PDXDC1/TTC39B gene variations linked to NAFLD with metabolic syndrome

finding: This SNP was associated with schizophrenia (SCZ) and was found to predict the expression of the RBFOX1 gene, which is crucial for neuronal function. The RBFOX1 gene was upregulated uniquely in vasoactive intestinal peptide (VIP) cells across SCZ, bipolar disorder (BD), and major depressive disorder (MDD). For SCZ, the log fold change (logFC) was 0.41 with a false discovery rate (FDR) of 4.4 x 10^-7; for BD, logFC was 0.53 with an FDR of 2.97 x 10^-6; and for MDD, logFC was 0.22 with an FDR of 0.025.
title: Transcriptomic pathology of neocortical microcircuit cell types across psychiatric disorders

finding: This SNP was identified as an independent lead variant associated with major depressive disorder (MDD) and was also predicted to impact the RBFOX1 gene. The gene was found to be upregulated in VIP cells across SCZ, BD, and MDD, reinforcing the relevance of RBFOX1 in these disorders.
title: Transcriptomic pathology of neocortical microcircuit cell types across psychiatric disorders

finding: This SNP was also an independent lead variant associated with major depressive disorder (MDD) and shared the same predictive outcome regarding the RBFOX1 gene. The findings emphasized the upregulation of RBFOX1 specifically in VIP cells across SCZ, BD, and MDD, indicating its role in these psychiatric conditions.
title: Transcriptomic pathology of neocortical microcircuit cell types across psychiatric disorders

finding: At 16q12.2, rs17817449 associated with V, had known associations with PD and breast cancer risk, relating to its potential role in mammographic texture features.
title: A genome-wide association study of mammographic texture variation

finding: The SNP rs11538963 at the MTSS1L/IL34 locus was associated with Alzheimer’s disease with a p-value of 7.80×10^-9 during stage 2 analyses.
SNP rs149416930 located in MRTFB showed a statistically significant association with Alzheimer's disease with p-value of 1.94×10^-8, highlighting its potential implications.
The SNP rs9926151 at IQCK locus observed a significant association with a p-value of 3.61×10^-8 in stage 3 analyses.
The PLCG2:rs72824905-G variant was identified as protective, reinforcing the significance of variant interactions with the APOE gene in the context of AD risk.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The SNP rs8062322, which is located within the CLEC16A gene, showed a significant association with pSSNS with a p-value of 1.61 × 10−10. This locus was part of the broader genetic architecture of pSSNS identified in the meta-analysis.
title: Multi-population genome-wide association study implicates both immune and non-immune factors in the etiology of pediatric steroid sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs153793 colocalized with a CNV region that was associated with age at menarche and menopause. The analysis indicated that variations at this SNP were linked to reproductive timing, specifically showing that certain alleles influenced the onset of menarche and menopause, thus providing insights into its role in female reproductive traits.
title: The individual and global impact of copy number variants on complex human traits

finding: Adeleterious variant associated with the FOXF1 gene, important in developmental pathways and cell function, indicating a potential role in IIH etiology.
title: The genetics of idiopathic intracranial hypertension (IIH): Integration of population studies and clinical data

finding: The rare missense variant rs201871085 in KAT8 exhibited a significant association with Alzheimer's disease and was also detected in low-frequency gene-based analyses.
title: Key variants via Alzheimer’s Disease Sequencing Project whole genome sequence data

finding: The SNP rs9939609 at the FTO locus was assessed for its association with maternal BMI. It was noted to have the strongest evidence for association with BMI. The Mendelian randomization estimates, when using this specific SNP, aimed to determine its influence on offspring adiposity, particularly across different analyses that included varying numbers of SNPs in the polygenic risk scores (PRS). The findings suggested that while maternal BMI had a positive correlation with offspring outcomes, the effect of rs9939609 alone on adolescent adiposity through MR was not demonstrated strongly, as indicated in sensitivity analyses regarding horizontal pleiotropy.
title: Exploring the causal effect of maternal pregnancy adiposity on offspring adiposity: Mendelian randomization using polygenic risk scores

finding: SNP rs258322 showed significant associations with Phecodes related to skin cancers, including Melanomas of skin and Other non-epithelial cancer of skin, indicating its potential role in these phenotypes.
title: Overcome the Limitation of Phenome-Wide Association Studies (PheWAS): Extension of PheWAS to Efficient and Robust Large-Scale ICD Codes Analysis

finding: The SNP rs56313538, located in the intronic region of FTO on chromosome 16, was associated with treatment-resistant depression (TRD) in the MGB TRD meta-analysis with a beta of -0.0220 and significant p-value (P = 4.3×10^-11). This SNP was linked to metabolic traits, demonstrating an inverse effect on body mass index (BMI) and TRD.
title: Genome-wide association study of treatment resistant depression highlights shared biology with metabolic traits

finding: The lead SNP rs27741 was identified as the most significant risk locus for frailty in the genome-wide association study (GWAS). It was located in the <italic>CLN3</italic> gene, which is associated with 16p11.2 distal deletion syndrome. This syndrome is linked to symptoms such as intellectual disability, developmental delay, and autism spectrum disorder. The association of rs27741 with frailty was statistically significant, with a P-value of 1.09x10^-35, highlighting its importance in the genetic understanding of frailty.
title: Uncovering the multivariate genetic architecture of frailty with genomic structural equation modelling

finding: RS12919683 was situated on the KCTD13 gene and showed multiple trans QTL effects, influencing the expression of various brain genes, thus indicating its relevance to both hippocampal volumes and AD.
title: Identification of novel associations of candidate loci with Alzheimer’s disease by leveraging the shared genetic basis with hippocampal volume

finding: The rs1800775 variant (CETP -629C>A) was associated with significantly lower CETP activity, leading to favorable lipid biomarker profiles. Specifically, a 1 standard deviation decrease in the CETP genetic score, which included rs1800775, was linked to an increase in HDL-cholesterol levels by 0.167 standard deviations, corresponding to 0.064 mmol/l. Furthermore, women exhibited a greater beneficial effect on lipid profiles from the genetically predicted lower CETP levels compared to men, indicating that this SNP was instrumental in predicting variations in HDL-c and LDL-c.
title: Study of effect modifiers of genetically predicted CETP reduction

finding: In the analysis of lung function, an 841-base SV deletion was identified in an intron of the gene CFDP1 associated with FEV1/FVC measures. This SV was found to be a conditionally independent variant and provided strong evidence through follow-up analyses linking CFDP1 expression to a lower FEV1/FVC measure, particularly in tissues relevant to respiratory diseases.
title: Imputation of structural variants using a multi-ancestry long-read sequencing panel enables identification of disease associations

finding: The PLCG2:rs72824905-G variant was classified as protective and showcased distinctive interactions that merit further exploration.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: This SNP was found associated with the mild progression subtype (Subtype I), highlighting its potential influence in slower disease progression.
title: Integrative analyses of multimodal clinical, neuroimaging, genetic, and transcriptomic data identify subtypes and potential treatments for heterogeneous Parkinson’s disease progression

finding: Associated with the mild progression subtype (Subtype I), highlighting its potential influence on milder disease manifestations.
