title: Integrative analyses of multimodal clinical, neuroimaging, genetic, and transcriptomic data identify subtypes and potential treatments for heterogeneous Parkinson’s disease progression

finding: The A allele of BCKDK rs14235 was associated with milder motor symptoms in Parkinson's disease (PD) patients. It significantly influenced the topology of brain structural and functional networks, mediating its effects on rigidity scores and UPDRS-III scores.
title: BCKDK rs14235 A allele is associated with milder motor impairment and altered network topology in Parkinson’s disease

finding: SNP rs8058928 was located in an intergenic region associated with several genes and was found to significantly correlate with MG after correcting for multiple tests, further supporting its role in MG susceptibility.
title: A Myasthenia Gravis genomewide association study of three cohorts identifies Agrin as a novel risk locus

finding: The SNP rs73550818, located in the GOT2 gene, demonstrated a protective effect against alcohol consumption among heterozygotes. This SNP was novel in the context of this study and was associated with increased expression of GOT2 in the liver, indicating potential relevance to ethanol-induced liver injury.
title: Genotype-stratified GWAS meta-analysis reveals novel loci associated with alcohol consumption

finding: The interaction of occupational exposures and the rs9931086 variant in SLC38A8 was studied regarding its effect on FEV<sub>1</sub>. Network analyses suggested that this variant might influence inflammatory processes connected to smoking-related lung function decline, although this was indicated to be a small study requiring further replication.
title: Smoking Interaction with a Polygenic Risk Score for Reduced Lung Function

finding: Associated with FTO and showed significant linkage with a p-value of 3.04×10^-11, indicating its relevance to traits connected to body mass index but potentially influencing ERM.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: Associated with FOXL1 and significantly correlated with ERM, implicating novel mechanisms in this ocular condition.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: The SNP rs4888606 was found to be associated with MSW in CFSRS (p=9×10⁻⁶) and nonword reading (ALSPACread) in ALSPAC (p=0.046), demonstrating its significance in phonological processing.
title: Association between genes regulating neural pathways for quantitative traits of speech and language disorders

finding: This SNP was linked to the gene CLUAP1 within super-variant chr16_4, emphasizing its role in ciliary function and its potential impact on respiratory health in COVID-19.
title: Genetic variants are identified to increase risk of COVID-19 related mortality from UK Biobank data

finding: The SNP rs55993634, overlapping the CTRB2 locus, displayed nominally significant local genetic correlation with T1D and CAD, adding to the evidence of shared genetic determinants affecting these diseases.
title: Genetic relations between leukocyte counts, type 1 diabetes, and coronary artery disease

finding: Associated with the CFDP1 locus, rs8046696 showed a local genetic correlation with T1D and CAD at nominal significance, indicating its potential role in the genetic overlap of these disorders.
title: Genetic relations between leukocyte counts, type 1 diabetes, and coronary artery disease

finding: This variant was significantly associated near CYLD and SALL1, with novel ties to impulsivity.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans and mice

finding: The SNP rs488327 was associated with the ascending aorta minimum area (AAo min area) and neuroticism in the 16q24.3 region, which indicates a genetic connection to mental health.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The SNP rs1673931 showed association with neuroticism and colocalized with the ascending aorta minimum area, highlighting its relevance to both cardiovascular and mental health.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The SNP rs112527105 located at the 16p13.11 locus was found to be colocalized alongside other traits, indicating its potential involvement in the comorbidity of MDD and MI.
title: Role of Blood Lipids in the Shared Genetic Etiology Between Major Depressive Disorder and Myocardial Infarction: A Large-scale Multi-trait Association Analysis

finding: The lead variant rs139397276 located in SNX20 presented an association with P-value=1.3×10−6 and an OR of 3.74, suggesting a significant risk for UC.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The variant rs61736932 was identified with substantial association, P-value of 1.15×10−6 and OR 4.22, contributing to the understanding of NOD2 in UC.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The study referenced the FTO rs9939609 polymorphism, which was found to be associated with elevated homocysteine levels in patients with multiple sclerosis (pwMS) who were screened for vascular risk factors. This finding is pertinent because elevated homocysteine levels are linked to vascular issues, which may contribute to disability variation in pwMS.
title: Disability in Multiple Sclerosis is Associated with Vascular Factors: An Ultrasound study

finding: The SNP rs4788115-A was associated with lower LAT expression, leading to increased autoimmune disease risk (specifically type 1 diabetes) while decreasing endometrial cancer risk, showcasing a reverse relationship between immune function and tumorigenesis.
title: Mapping inherited genetic variation with opposite effects on autoimmune disease and cancer identifies candidate drug targets associated with the anti-tumor immune response

finding: This variant was linked to Crohn's disease as it affects the NOD2 gene.

finding: The SNP rs56313538, located in the intronic region of FTO on chromosome 16, was associated with treatment resistant depression (TRD) in the MGB cohort, showing a significant P value of 4.3×10^−11. It had a beta coefficient of -0.0220 for the G allele, indicating an inverse relationship with body mass index (BMI). This finding highlighted a potential shared biological mechanism between TRD and metabolic traits.
title: Genome-wide association study of treatment resistant depression highlights shared biology with metabolic traits

finding: It was identified as the likely causal SNP for the oligodendrocyte GRIN2A eQTL with a probability of 0.94. The GRIN2A gene is associated with schizophrenia.

finding: The SNP rs111469125, located within the C16orf95 gene, was correlated with 19 out of 22 brain regions, particularly notable for its correlation with several ventricles including the 3rd and 4th ventricles, which accounted for 3% of total voxels. It was also associated with the left and right lateral ventricles and cerebrospinal fluid, representing 1% and 1.5% of total voxels respectively. Additionally, this SNP was identified as the only new variant correlated with the left cerebellum white matter, left thalamus, and right caudate.
title: TransferGWAS of T1-weighted Brain MRI Data from the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs1421085 at the FTO locus was identified as a putative causal variant for body mass index (BMI), body fat percentage (BFP), hip circumference (HC), and waist circumference (WC). This variant played a causal role in adipocyte thermogenesis regulation and was significantly associated with BMI, demonstrating its relevance to obesity-related phenotypes.
title: Genome-wide fine-mapping improves identification of causal variants

finding: The SNP rs76488452 was identified as a secondary signal at the FTO locus with a PIP of 0.85. It represented a novel finding, residing in a conserved region and showing significant association in conditional analyses, although it displayed only nominal significance in the standard GWAS analysis.
title: Genome-wide fine-mapping improves identification of causal variants

finding: SNP rs61757601 was identified as significantly associated with CAD (p=1.3E-14), marking it as a notable variant among the seven non-pleiotropic SNPs evaluated. This association has highlighted the pleiotropic nature of the loci related to glycine levels and CAD risk.

finding: The synonymous SNV on TAOK2 was one of the suggestive associations that significantly replicated in the discovery phase.

finding: The missense variant rs1597000001 was identified in the CETP gene among Māori and Pacific peoples and was associated with significantly higher HDL-C levels (95% CI 0.211; 0.260) and lower LDL-C levels (95% CI -0.209; -0.058). The T-allele of this SNP lowered CETP activity, which mimicked the effects seen with Mendelian loss-of-function mutations.
title: A population-specific missense variant rs1597000001 in CETP promotes a favorable lipid profile and reduces CETP activity

finding: The male-biased tag eSNP rs2937127 demonstrated no eQTL effect in females; however, in males, the minor allele was associated with downregulation of TERF2 gene expression, showcasing a significant male-specific eQTL effect (FDR = 0.04). This gene was positioned approximately 470 kb upstream of the tag eSNP, which resided within the gene WWP2, determined to be male-biased (FDR = 0.005 in males vs. 0.09 in females).
title: Autosomal sex-biased genetic regulation of the stress response

finding: This locus was noted for harboring the genes CARMIL2 and SMPD3. CARMIL2 was linked to early onset IBD, while SMPD3 was involved in TNF-alpha response, emphasizing their contribution to IBD development.

finding: Analysis identified rs4133124 in the intron of PLCG2 as a novel association with Age-related Macular Degeneration (AMD), supported by a p-value of 2.59 x10^-6 in late AMD GWAS data. This variant indicated regulatory potential, showing significant enhancer activity in luciferase assays and being reported as an eQTL for PLCG2 in the hippocampus.
title: Integrating explainable machine learning and transcriptomics data reveals cell-type specific immune signatures underlying macular degeneration

finding: The SNP rs62033413, located at the FTO locus, was found to be associated with increased weight, body mass index, and hip circumference, implicating obesity as a risk factor for the development of varicose veins.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-wide Association Study of Varicose Veins Reveals Polygenic Architecture, Genetic Overlap with Arterial and Venous Disease, and Novel Therapeutic Opportunities

finding: The missense variant rs77681059 was associated with cancer types, showing an odds ratio (OR) ranging from 1.11 to 1.32, specifically linked to the TUBB3 gene.
title: Exome-wide association studies discover germline mutation patterns and identify high-risk populations in human cancers

finding: The snippet mentions rs1805007, a missense variant in MC1R, which exhibited an odds ratio (OR) between 1.34 and 1.64 across certain cancers.
title: Exome-wide association studies discover germline mutation patterns and identify high-risk populations in human cancers

finding: The SNP rs56288641, a missense variant in VPS9D1, associated with an odds ratio (OR) ranging from 1.28 to 1.59, influencing cancer susceptibility.
title: Exome-wide association studies discover germline mutation patterns and identify high-risk populations in human cancers

finding: The intron variant rs9921399 at CES1 was found to be associated with LDL cholesterol, with a significance of p = 1.37 × 10^-9 in KoGES and 5.5 × 10^-5 in BBJ.
title: Genome-wide study on 72,298 Korean individuals in Korean biobank data for 76 traits identifies hundreds of novel loci

finding: The SNP rs12051220 was identified in the context of Triple Negative Breast Cancer (TNBC), specifically related to the study's findings concerning the association of African ancestry with distinct gene expression profiles. The research highlighted that African ancestry was linked to distinct molecular signatures in TNBC, contributing to immune cell infiltration and activity within tumors, which may lead to variations in clinical outcomes observed among different racial groups.
title: African-Ancestry Associated Gene Expression Signatures and Pathways in Triple Negative Breast Cancer, a Comparison across Women of African Descent

finding: The rs11150601 intron variant of SETD1A was linked to an increased risk of schizophrenia specifically in women, with an odds ratio of 1.6 (p < 0.001). This finding indicated a significant sex-specific effect, enhancing the understanding of schizophrenia's genetic architecture, particularly relating to the influence of obesity and hypertension as comorbid conditions.
title: The rs11150601 intron variant of SETD1A is associated with female schizophrenia in the UK Biobank cohort

finding: The rs2238432 variant within the ADCY9 gene demonstrated a significant protective effect against stroke in SCD patients, showing a P-value of 0.0008553 and an odds ratio of 0.45 (95% CI 0.29-0.72). This effect was attributed to anti-inflammatory cytokine production linked to the enzyme activity of type 9 adenylate cyclase.
title: Genetic variants associated with the risk of stroke in sickle cell disease: a systematic review and meta-analysis

finding: The rs7191721 polymorphism in the RBFOX1 gene modified the association between walking pace and lung cancer risk. Specifically, the protective effect linked to faster walking pace was stronger among participants carrying a higher number of A alleles, evidenced by P interaction values of 0.01 for lung cancer incidence and 0.004 for lung cancer mortality. Subgroup analysis showed that the association was particularly beneficial in participants with the AA genotype, who had significantly reduced hazard ratios for incident lung cancer when engaging in brisk walking.
title: Endurance and power genes modify the protective effect of fast walking pace on lung cancer risk: a UK Biobank prospective cohort study

finding: The variant rs9921085 was associated with lung function, demonstrating significant associations with both FEV1 (p-value = 1.00 x 10^-14) and FVC (p-value = 1.10 x 10^-14) in the UK Biobank study, indicating its relevance to COPD physiology.
title: Proteomic Networks and Related Genetic Variants Associated with Smoking and Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

finding: The SNP rs56738967 was identified as a novel PCOS locus associated with the lncRNA MAFTRR, acting as an eQTL in various tissues, including the thyroid and ovary. This finding highlights the potential regulatory role of this gene in the context of PCOS.
title: Understanding and Predicting Polycystic Ovary Syndrome through Shared Genetic Architecture with Testosterone, SHBG, and Inflammatory Markers

finding: The rs12102805 SNP was identified as playing a significant role in the rapid identification of homologous recombination-deficient ovarian carcinomas as part of the RECAP test. This finding underscored the association between this SNP and improved outcomes for patients undergoing therapy for HGSC.
title: Functional homologous recombination assay on FFPE specimens of advanced high-grade serous ovarian cancer predicts clinical outcomes

finding: The rs146069306 variant in FOXF1 was one of the top findings in assessing associations with IIH, showing a significant likely deleterious effect in developmental processes linked to the pathology.
title: The Genetics of Idiopathic Intracranial Hypertension (IIH): Integration of Population Studies and Clinical Data

finding: The SNP rs28940579 was significantly elevated in frequency within the Armenian (MAF: 0.042, Fisher's exact test p-value: 1.72e-21), Lebanese Christian (MAF: 0.037, Fisher's exact test p-value: 1.1e-08), and Egyptian Christian IBD clusters (MAF: 0.033, Fisher's exact test p-value: 0.00087) when compared to the general biobank MAF of 5.5e-03. This finding was consistent with prior knowledge of the high burden of Familial Mediterranean Fever in Armenians.
title: Health care utilization of fine-scale identity by descent clusters in a Los Angeles biobank

finding: The SNP rs41464951 had a significantly elevated minor allele frequency in the Iranian Non-Jewish cluster (cluster MAF: 0.0051, biobank MAF: 8.79e-05, Fisher's exact test p-value: 5.02e-05). finding: The SNP rs247616 in the CETP locus was strongly associated with HDL-C change when adjusted for baseline, reporting a p-value of 7.77e-10.

finding: The intronic tag eSNP rs2937127 exhibited no effect in females, but in males, the minor allele was linked to a downregulation of TERF2 gene expression with an FDR of 0.04. TERF2 is located approximately 470 kb upstream of rs2937127, which is situated in the gene WWP2.
title: Sex differences in the genetic regulation of the blood transcriptome response to glucocorticoid receptor activation

finding: The study confirmed a direct association between rs1421085 and neuroticism, independent of age, sex, alcohol use, BMI, and childhood adversities. T allele carriers exhibited higher neuroticism scores, significantly affecting subjective well-being, where lower well-being levels were reported by the same allele carriers. Although there was no direct association with alcohol intake, mediation analysis revealed an indirect relationship between rs1421085 and problematic alcohol use via increased neuroticism.

title: Re-weighting MC1R, ASIP and IRF4 risk variants optimises polygenic risk scores for keratinocyte cancer stratification in solid organ transplant recipients

finding: The SNP rs9939609, located in the fat mass and obesity-associated gene (FTO), was analyzed to estimate its causal effect on Body Mass Index (BMI) and subsequently on systolic blood pressure (SBP). The study utilized a two-sample Mendelian randomization approach across multiple time points, observing FTO-BMI associations from a study of the 1958 National Survey of Health and Development cohort and FTO-hypertension associations from the Copenhagen General Population Study. It was established that the association results were consistent with findings from the Rotterdam Study, indicating that the effect of the FTO genotype on both BMI and SBP varied over time.
title: Interpretation of mendelian randomization using one measure of an exposure that varies over time

finding: In inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), the SNP rs7201325, residing in the CLEC16A locus on chromosome 16, showed a suggestive association with a p-value of 1.4 × 10^-7, which reached genome-wide significance after conditioning with a p-value of 1.1 × 10^-10.

finding: This SNP was used as a replacement for rs312262906 due to its strong linkage disequilibrium with it, allowing for analysis of pigmentation traits relevant to skin cancer susceptibility.
title: The skin we live in: pigmentation traits and tanning behaviour in British young adults, an observational and genetically-informed study

finding: The SNP rs2303262 located at the MPHOSPH6 locus showed a causal association between longer leukocyte telomere length (LTL) and increased risk of lung adenocarcinoma (OR=2.43, p=3.8×10^-21). Furthermore, this SNP was linked with reduced pulmonary function and higher MPHOSPH6 gene expression, implicating its role in lung cancer pathology.
title: Common genetic variations in telomere length genes and lung cancer

finding: SNP rs2531995 was linked with ADCY9 at its locus and was shown to affect gene expression in natural killer cells, further associating it with obesity-related signaling pathways.
title: 3D genomic features across >50 diverse cell types reveal insights into the genomic architecture of childhood obesity

finding: The ZNF646/KAT8/BCKDK rs14235 A-carriers showed lower UPDRS-III scores than GG carriers, suggesting it influences motor assessment in Parkinson's disease.
title: Parkinson’s disease-associated genetic variants synergistically shape brain networks

finding: The T allele in rs61732418 was associated with 0.8 SD higher levels of injury/inflammation (SE=0.41, p=0.04). It was identified as a rare variant in the NLRC3 gene, contributing to the injury/inflammation biological dimension linked to dementia symptoms.
title: Rare variants in IFFO1, DTNB and NLRC3 associate with Alzheimer’s disease CSF profile of neuronal injury and inflammation

finding: The variant ZFHX3 (rs2359171) was specifically associated with cluster 5 (respiratory- and metabolic disease-related AF), which represented the most severe type of AF. This association underscored the shared genetic link between overweight/obesity and AF, as ZFHX3 was previously reported in genome-wide association studies related to both conditions.
title: Outcome and life expectancy associated with novel subgroups of atrial fibrillation: a data-driven cluster analysis

finding: The SNP rs113693994 related to cadherin -15 (CDH15) was unique in this study as it was significant in both sexes but exhibited opposite effect directions, suggesting a complicated role in male and female biology.
title: Similar and different: systematic investigation of proteogenomic variation between sexes and its relevance for human diseases

finding: The SNP rs837763, which was previously identified, was part of a study that showed a rare variant gene-level association with HbA1C, specifically within the <italic>PIEZO1</italic> gene. The investigation revealed that this rare variant association explained a greater proportion of variance in HbA1C compared to the common variant rs837763 itself, providing evidence that rare variants can offer additional explanatory power for complex traits such as HbA1C levels in Type 2 Diabetes diagnosis.
title: A combined polygenic score of 21,293 rare and 22 common variants significantly improves diabetes diagnosis based on hemoglobin A1C levels

finding: The rs7191721 polymorphism in the RBFOX1 gene showed that a faster walking pace conferred additional protection against lung cancer risk, particularly for participants carrying a higher number of A alleles (P_interaction=0.01 for incidence, P_interaction=0.004 for mortality). The HRs for incident lung cancer based on walking pace were as follows: 0.63 (AA), 0.74 (GA), and 0.79 (GG) genotypes, indicating a significant protective effect associated with brisk walking.
title: Walking Pace, Sport Genes, and the Lung Cancer

finding: This SNP showed association with severity in COVID-19 cases, located in ACSF3 with MAF of 22%, OR of 1.17, and P-value of 8×10^(-9), indicating its relevance to severe COVID-19 outcomes.
title: Common genetic variants identify therapeutic targets for COVID-19 and individuals at high risk of severe disease

finding: The SNP rs4788084 in IL27 was associated with mLOX and linked to autoimmune conditions, supporting the role of autoimmune pathways in mLOX susceptibility.
title: Population analyses of mosaic X chromosome loss identify genetic drivers and widespread signatures of cellular selection

finding: The rs11075646 variant was linked to lower TMB in esophagogastric carcinoma and slightly increased expression of the CBFB gene.
title: Germline cancer gene expression quantitative trait loci influence local and global tumor mutations

finding: The rs7201264-C allele was associated with increased TMC in endometrial cancer and decreased FANCA gene expression across tissues.
title: Germline cancer gene expression quantitative trait loci influence local and global tumor mutations

finding: The rs12918530 variant had a significant association with somatic mutations in the TSC2 gene in endometrial cancer.
title: Germline cancer gene expression quantitative trait loci influence local and global tumor mutations

finding: The rs55671402 variant was linked to FANCA expression in normal tissues and somatic mutations in FANCA in endometrial tumors.
title: Germline cancer gene expression quantitative trait loci influence local and global tumor mutations

finding: The locus rs1614576 was associated with early-onset acute myocardial infarction (AMI), indicating a potential role in thrombus formation. It was located upstream of the PRKCB gene and had an odds ratio (OR) of 1.646 with a p-value of 3.41 × 10−6.
title: Genome-wide analyses of early-onset acute myocardial infarction identify 29 novel loci by whole genome sequencing

finding: The IL4R variant rs1805015, associated with slow progression of HIV, was present in 8 patients, highlighting its potential significance in the COVID-19 context.
title: Clinical and molecular characterization of COVID-19 hospitalized patients

finding: The SNP rs3751884, located in exon 1 of the CLCN7 gene, was identified as one of the two heterozygous SNPs present in the proband. This SNP was significant in the context of Autosomal Dominant Osteopetrosis type II (ADOII), as its presence allowed further investigation into haploinsufficiency of CLCN7 mRNA expression. Sequencing revealed that CLCN7 mRNA was only transcribed from one allele in the proband, supporting the diagnosis of ADOII and suggesting that the reduced expression of CLCN7 mRNA resulted in the observed poor bone remodeling and high mineral content.
title: A case of autosomal dominant osteopetrosis type II with a severe bone phenotype but no amino acid converting mutation in the CLCN7 gene

finding: <italic>ZNF646/KAT8/BCKDK</italic> rs14235 had significant eQTL effects and was involved in multi-SNP models predicting clinical assessments, including UPDRS-III scores.
title: The multi-modality neuroimaging analysis identified an essential genetic variant associated with Parkinson’s disease

finding: This SNP showed a strong association with HF, being one of the 5 SNPs that maintained significance under a conservative Bonferroni-corrected replication threshold in the analysis.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The SNP rs12102767 was identified in the study conducted by Li et al. as a relevant non-invasive biomarker for the early detection of breast cancer. The research indicated that the use of this SNP was part of a larger miRNA-Gene-Module-Pathway-Disease model that demonstrated significant predictive capability, achieving an AUC of 0.989 for early diagnosis and 0.890 in an external cohort.
title: BioDecoder: A miRNA Bio-interpretable Neural Network Model for Noninvasive Diagnosis of Breast Cancer

finding: SNP rs7206122, an intronic variant in FTO, was found to have significant associations with alcohol use disorder (AUD).
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: The rs183130 variant was identified as a causal CETP variant for both LDL-C and HDL-C in European populations, with a strong support for a shared causal effect affecting HDL-C across both European and East Asian ancestries. A high posterior probability of 1.00 indicated a colocalized signal driven by this variant, confirming its association with HDL-C. In the context of drug target Mendelian randomization, lower CETP levels, related to this variant, showed protective effects against coronary heart disease (CHD) in both population groups but highlighted a more pronounced effect within European individuals.
title: Comparing the effect profile of CETP in individuals of East Asian and European ancestries

finding: The SNP rs60847828 was identified as a novel genome-wide significant locus for non-response to SSRIs/SNRIs, showing an odds ratio of 1.0844 and a p-value of 1.18e-08. This finding was noteworthy as it contributed to understanding genetic factors influencing treatment efficacy.
title: Genome-wide meta-analyses of non-response to antidepressants identify novel loci and potential drugs

finding: The study identified that SNP rs13333226 was strongly linked to hypertension, wherein carriers of a specific allele exhibited both lower urinary uromodulin levels and a reduced risk of developing hypertension. This finding highlighted a significant genetic association relevant to blood pressure regulation.
title: Association of urinary peptides with hypertension

finding: An association was detected (p=3.80E-08) near CYLD and SALL1, previously linked with risk-taking behaviors.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans and mice

finding: The rs11149612 variant was part of the group of variants that significantly altered chromatin accessibility, indicating its role in the regulation of nearby gene expression.
title: Joint genotypic and phenotypic outcome modeling improves base editing variant effect quantification

finding: This SNP was found to be significantly associated with Subtype I, reflecting its importance in mild symptom progression.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: This SNP was associated with Subtype I, highlighting its relevance to benign progression patterns.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: The SNP indexed by rs12927162 was linked with similar sleep-related proxy phenotypes, reinforcing the role of this genetic variation in influencing circadian rhythms.
title: Genome-wide association studies of 27 accelerometry-derived physical activity measurements identifies novel loci and genetic mechanisms

finding: The FTO locus rs7202116 was identified among early reported variance quantitative trait loci, associated with changes in variance of body mass index (BMI).
title: Hypothesis-free detection of gene-interaction effects on biomarker concentration in UK Biobank using variance prioritisation

finding: The rs10852372 signal was found near C16orf72, identified as a regulator of telomere integrity and p53 regulation, and replicated at a nominal level of significance for sporadic miscarriage.
title: Trans-ancestral Genome Wide Association Study of Sporadic and Recurrent Miscarriage

finding: Located in gene GNAO1:RP11-441F2.5, the variant rs9935936 showed a significant P-value of 1.72×10^-9 in heart failure association studies, pointing to its possible involvement in the disease's genetic landscape.
title: Exploring novel risk loci for heart failure and the shared genetic etiology with blood lipids, blood pressure, and blood glucose: a large-scale multi-trait association analysis

finding: The variant rs139397276 was strongly associated with UC (P-value=1.3×10^-6, OR=3.74), providing a credible association for further exploration in linked datasets.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: This SNP was associated with UC (P-value=1.15×10^-6, OR=4.22) and validated in public datasets, indicating significant linkage to UC genetic mechanisms.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The variant rs11648373 was linked to a cause-specific risk reduction for various cancers, indicating opposing effects for IPF and cancer when analyzed within a competing risk framework.
title: Genetic variant in SPDL1 reveals novel mechanism linking pulmonary fibrosis risk and cancer protection

finding: The SNP rs604639 mediated 32.7% of the effect of cg21375332, located near the SLC12A3 and NUP93 genes, on changes in IFN-γ levels. SLC12A3 is recognized for its role as a receptor for IL-18, which is known to contribute to cytokine production including IFN-γ, thereby highlighting the important role of rs604639 in immune response modulation following BCG vaccination.
title: Epigenetic Reprogramming Mediates Monocyte and Heterologous T Cell-derived Cytokine Responses after BCG Vaccination

finding: The SNP rs8052428-T was significantly associated with shorter sitting height (Beta = -0.101, P value = 1.1E-29) and standing height (Beta = -0.132, P value = 1.0E-17) in a genome-wide association study of height variation involving 361,194 UK Biobank samples. Although the study found no causal variant identified at this locus, the SV in complete linkage disequilibrium with rs8052428 was identified as the likely causal variant influencing height variation.
title: Long-read sequencing of 945 Han individuals identifies novel structural variants associated with phenotypic diversity and disease susceptibility

finding: At the CTRB1/2 locus, fine-mapping resolved a single causal variant, rs55993634, which had a high posterior inclusion probability (PIP) of 0.989, indicating it was likely responsible for T1D risk.
title: Genetic association and machine learning improves discovery and prediction of type 1 diabetes

finding: The rs11574938 SNP was identified as the most significant blood eQTL for ITGAL, with a strong association (p = 7.9E-150). This finding underscored the genetic proxy's utility in studying the effects of statin-mediated ITGAL inhibition during anti-depressive activity evaluation.
title: Using Genomic data to Investigate the Anti-Depressive Effects of Statins

finding: The SNP rs12448959 was linked to decreased JH levels through its effect on an H3K4me1 enhancer located upstream of the ABAT gene. The G variant of this SNP contributed to a lower odds of experiencing high JH by potentially increasing the ABAT protein, thus reducing GABA availability for binding to the GABA<sub>B</sub> receptor, which could lead to increased susceptibility to nicotine reward.
title: Genome-wide association study of John Henryism in the CARDIA Cohort suggests a molecular mechanism behind lower nicotine addiction rates

finding: This SNP was positively associated with plasma OT levels (β = 1.05, p-value = 5.9 × 10<sup>-6</sup>). Located in the first intron of the CACNG3 gene, it may play a role in calcium channel modulation and OT release.
title: Genetic and epigenetic signatures associated with plasma oxytocin levels in children and adolescents with autism spectrum disorder

finding: Associated with increased levels of plasma OT (β = 1.27, p-value = 6.2 × 10<sup>-6</sup>), rs7342769 is located upstream of the PRKCB gene, with implications for signaling pathways relevant to OT.
title: Genetic and epigenetic signatures associated with plasma oxytocin levels in children and adolescents with autism spectrum disorder

finding: The SNP rs3927943 was recognized as a lead trans-eQTL variant for NPIPB15, explaining a very large proportion (R² > 0.8) of the variance in the gene's expression.
title: Whole Genome DNA and RNA Sequencing of Whole Blood Elucidates the Genetic Architecture of Gene Expression Underlying a Wide Range of Diseases

finding: The study reported that each additional minor allele (A) of rs9939609 at the FTO locus was inversely associated with body mass index (BMI) at ages 0 to 3 and positively associated with BMI at ages 5.5 to 13. This finding indicated an age-varying genetic effect on BMI, which aligned with previously reported associations using individual participant data.
title: Meta-regression of Genome-Wide Association Studies to estimate age-varying genetic effects

finding: The NOD2 R702W mutation (rs2066844), identified as a heterozygous variant, was linked to early onset leprosy in the twins and previously associated with Crohn's disease, indicating its role in immune response.
title: Early onset leprosy reveals a joint effect of LRRK2 and NOD2 variants

finding: This rare variant was identified in connection with ST1A1, contributing to significant plasma protein level variation in the Greenlandic population.
title: Genetic regulation of the plasma proteome and its link to cardiometabolic disease in Greenlandic Inuit

finding: This SNP was part of the top IBI SNPs, reinforcing its role in hypertensive conditions within the patient population analyzed.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: The SNP rs8050136 was linked to BMI with a significant p-value of 1.6E-08 and a beta value of 0.064, which indicated a positive relationship with BMI.
title: Improved Type 2 Diabetes Risk Stratification in the Qatar Biobank Cohort by Ensemble Learning Classifier Incorporating Multi-Trait, Population-Specific, Polygenic Risk Scores

finding: The sentinel variant rs62040020 located in the intron of JPT2 demonstrated opposite associations with IPF risk based on sex: it was associated with increased risk in females (odds ratio 1.34, p=1x10^-4) and decreased risk in males (odds ratio 0.82, p=1x10^-3). This was a new finding that had not been previously identified in other IPF susceptibility GWAS.
title: Genome-wide SNP-sex interaction analysis of susceptibility to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The SNP rs113693994 was part of the cadherin -15 (CDH15) pQTL, which showed significant effects in both males and females but with opposite directions of effect. This unique finding highlighted a case of sexual dimorphism in genetic regulation, with CDH15 implicated in cell adhesion processes within brain and muscle tissue.
title: Similar and different: systematic investigation of proteogenomic variation between sexes and its relevance for human diseases

finding: In East Asians, this novel SNP was causally associated with an increased risk of CAD in the coronary artery, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.23 (95% CI: 1.14 – 1.33) for the CFDP1 gene.
title: Integrative multi-ethnic Mendelian randomisation identifies tissue-specific causal genes for Coronary Artery Disease and interactions with post-acute Covid

finding: This SNP was identified as protective against CAD in both whole blood and lung, influencing the expression of the CFDP1 gene, and was found to be associated with lower risk of CAD across both European and East Asian populations.
title: Integrative multi-ethnic Mendelian randomisation identifies tissue-specific causal genes for Coronary Artery Disease and interactions with post-acute Covid

finding: The SNP rs180924818 was identified as a significant marker for LiD, with a hazard ratio of 3.13, indicating a high risk for individuals carrying this variant. It is located close to the XYLT1 gene.
title: Genetic meta-analysis of levodopa induced dyskinesia in Parkinson’s disease

finding: Associated with RBC counts in TOPMed, the rs372755452 variant is primarily found among East Asians and contributes to MCH and MCV traits.
title: Whole genome sequencing association analysis of quantitative red blood cell phenotypes: the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: The rs868351380 variant was associated with MCH and MCV traits and is notably found among Hispanics/Latinos, indicating its role in red blood cell phenotypic variation.
title: Whole genome sequencing association analysis of quantitative red blood cell phenotypes: the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: SNP rs9939609 was shown to predict the risk of cardiovascular disease, linking it to metabolic dysregulation while emphasizing the potential genetic overlap between MAFLD and CVDs.
title: Genome-wide insights into the shared genetic landscape between metabolic dysfunction-associated fatty liver disease and cardiovascular diseases

finding: The variant rs1181041827 in PKD1 was linked to both left and right ventral diencephalon volumes, showing distinctive effects of 923.88 mm³ for right and 945.24 mm³ for left along with significant effect sizes ranging from 1.73 to 1.77 s.d. units, with both P-values < 5.2 × 10^-11.
title: Mapping rare protein-coding variants on multi-organ imaging traits

finding: The variant was significantly linked to <italic>CREBBP</italic> and displayed a strong association with COVID-19 hospitalization.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: The novel locus rs56738967 on chromosome 16 was identified as a significant eQTL for MAFTRR in multiple tissues, including the thyroid and ovary. This lncRNA was implicated in the regulatory mechanisms associated with PCOS.
title: Understanding and Predicting Polycystic Ovary Syndrome through Shared Genetics with Testosterone, SHBG, and Chronic Inflammation

finding: The variant rs12921187 was identified as the strongest novel association with heart failure (HF) and was located within the <italic>PPL</italic> gene, which encodes the cytoskeletal protein periplakin. Mutations in related proteins, such as desmoplakin, have previously been connected to arrhythmogenic cardiomyopathy, particularly associated with left ventricular fibrosis and systolic dysfunction.
title: Multi-ancestry Multivariate Genome-Wide Analysis Highlights the Role of Common Genetic Variation in Cardiac Structure, Function, and Heart Failure-related Traits

finding: The SNP rs78193826 was identified as a lead variant associated with pancreatic cancer susceptibility in the Japanese population, exhibiting significant associations with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.46 (95% CI=1.29-1.66, P=4.28×10^-9). This variant was part of the significant region at locus 16p12.3 and was classified as highly deleterious.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: This SNP was included among the top 3 SNPs at 16p12.3, significantly associated with pancreatic cancer risk and showed the same association as a lead variant in a T2D meta-analysis. It indicated a potential shared genetic susceptibility between pancreatic cancer and type 2 diabetes.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: As one of the significant SNPs at locus 16p12.3, rs73541251 was shown to be associated with pancreatic cancer. This SNP was also associated with T2D in a separate GWAS, suggesting overlapping genetic factors in these conditions.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: In an independent replication cohort, this intronic SNP indicated a nominally significant association with pancreatic cancer risk (P<0.05). The effect size was consistent with findings from the GWAS meta-analysis conducted prior.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: The frequency of the G allele in rs17822931 (ABCC11) in Amami-Oshima island (0.311) was significantly higher than in the Hondo cluster (0.121) with a p-value less than 0.001. However, the frequency of the G allele in Kikai island (0.118) was significantly lower than that in the Ryukyu cluster (0.258) and Amami-Oshima island.
title: Genetic lineage of the Amami islanders inferred from classical genetic markers

finding: The rs72824905 variant in the PLCG2 gene, leading to the P522R change, was found to be associated with a reduced risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD) with an odds ratio of less than 0.6. This specific variant was shown to enhance the primary function of the Plcγ2 enzyme as a Pip2-metabolizing enzyme, resulting in improved survival, increased phagocytic activity, and heightened acute inflammatory response in immune cells. Additionally, the variant was linked to a lower risk of other neurodegenerative diseases and was associated with increased longevity.
title: The Alzheimer’s disease-associated protective Plcγ2-P522R variant promotes beneficial microglial functions

finding: The missense variant Gly188Ser in GOT2 was strongly associated with AST levels (p = 6.3 × 10^-62), confirming its impact on enzyme activity.
title: Genome-wide association study of circulating liver enzymes reveals an expanded role for manganese transporter SLC30A10 in liver health

finding: The SNP rs9302752 was identified as a significant eQTL for the gene NOD2 based on data from Gene-Tissue Expression (GTEx). It was noted to be associated with leprosy and Crohn's disease through genome-wide association studies (GWAS). In the context of PBMC multiomic data, the ATACseq peak containing this SNP led to a nominal p-value of 0.07 when linked to NOD2 expression, though it did not achieve statistical significance using the Z-scores method. The associated expression in the dataset showed a correlation of R=0.12, specifically in monocytes, highlighting the cell-type specificity of the peak. However, due to the bimodal nature of the null distributions for trans-peaks, the Z-score statistics for this peak-gene link were deemed inaccurate.
title: Major cell-types in multiomic single-nucleus datasets impact statistical modeling of links between regulatory sequences and target genes

finding: The study by Perez-Diaz-Del-Campo et al. (2020) established a connection between the SH2B1 rs7359397 gene polymorphism and the severity of steatosis in individuals diagnosed with obesity and non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD). This finding highlighted how genetic variations could play a significant role in the clinical manifestations of NAFLD.
title: Differences in metabolic and liver pathobiology induced by two dietary mouse models of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease

finding: The SNP rs12051178 was identified in the context of therapeutic decision-making for metastatic prostate cancer. The research revealed how whole genome data, including this SNP, influenced treatment strategies and outcomes, highlighting its relevance in the broader scope of cancer genomics.
title: Transcriptomics Reveals Tumorigenesis and Pathogen Response in Scombrid Puffy Snout Syndrome

finding: The SNP rs12922863 was associated with genetic predisposition to gastrointestinal tract diseases, specifically colocalizing with Crohn's disease (CD) and linked to the gene CIITA, which is involved in antigen presentation. This finding suggested that this variant may play a role in the immune response related to these diseases.
title: Cross-disorder genetic analysis of immune diseases reveals distinct disease groups and associated genes that converge on common pathogenic pathways

finding: The SNP rs415595 was found to be associated with gastrointestinal tract diseases, colocalizing with CD as well. It is linked to the gene TNP2, which is involved in the regulation of protein processing, indicating its potential relevance in the pathophysiology of these disorders.
title: Cross-disorder genetic analysis of immune diseases reveals distinct disease groups and associated genes that converge on common pathogenic pathways

finding: The SNP rs13335254 was identified as being associated with gastrointestinal tract diseases and colocalized with CD. It is associated with the gene LITAF, which regulates TNF-alpha expression, suggesting that this SNP might influence inflammatory responses in gastrointestinal diseases.
title: Cross-disorder genetic analysis of immune diseases reveals distinct disease groups and associated genes that converge on common pathogenic pathways

finding: The sentinel SNP rs2080512 was associated with reduced H3K27ac peak heights and decreased gene expression of LITAF, which has been linked to cardiac electrocardiographic QT elongation. This SNP was part of a locus that met genome-wide significance in previous studies.
title: Disease and phenotype relevant genetic variants identified from histone acetylomes in human hearts

finding: The SNP rs8043757 was associated with the FTO enhancer and was shown to decrease binding affinity for FOXP3, a transcription factor regulating gene expression in pituitary cells. Using CRISPRi methodology, the expression of FTO and its target genes, IRX3 and IRX5, was significantly reduced in human astrocytes, indicating that this SNP affects enhancer activity and subsequent gene expression related to obesity.
title: Integrative single-cell characterization of hypothalamus sex-differential and obesity-associated genes and regulatory elements

finding: The SNP rs77924615 showed association with hypertension and kidney-related traits, supporting its role in kidney structure and function.
title: Genetic architecture of 11 abdominal organ traits derived from abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs12102764 was found to be associated with under-replicated DNA phenomena in the context of large genomes, as reported in the study by Bertolin et al. (2020). This finding was significant as it linked the SNP to cancerous replication processes, indicating that variations at this locus could influence DNA replication dynamics in tumors.
title: Modeling single cell DNA replication dynamics and aneuploidy in genomically unstable cancers

finding: The SNP rs7190458 was recognized as having a relevant role in pancreatic cancer and was confirmed as an important marker through multiple GWAS reports.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS assessment on genetic susceptibility to pancreatic cancer

finding: The SNP rs72786786 demonstrated a MACIE-regulatory score greater than 0.99 and was under moderate to high linkage disequilibrium with rs17231506. This finding suggested it may be functionally more important than rs17231506 for HDL-C.
title: A multi-dimensional integrative scoring framework for predicting functional variants in the human genome

finding: The SNP rs12720926 also showed a MACIE-regulatory score greater than 0.99 and was associated with HDL-C. This indicated its potential functional relevance compared to the leading SNV rs17231506.
title: A multi-dimensional integrative scoring framework for predicting functional variants in the human genome

finding: The variant rs11644125 was associated with changes in monocyte and lymphocyte blood cell counts in the UK Biobank, with a statistical fine-mapping indicating a greater than 0.99 causal probability. The minor allele T was found to decrease the expression of NLRC5 in whole blood compared to the major allele C. Enformer successfully predicted this reduced expression and identified that the variant influenced an SP1 transcription factor motif, suggesting that altered binding of SP1 in hematopoietic cells could impact NLRC5 expression.
title: Effective gene expression prediction from sequence by integrating long-range interactions

finding: At the α-globin locus, the presence of the minor allele of rs11864973 transformed an activating KLF1 site into a repressive SNAI1 site, thereby reducing the transcription activity of the α-globin regulatory region.
title: Functional dissection of complex and molecular trait variants at single nucleotide resolution

finding: The SNP rs12446999 in the USP7 gene was found to be associated with aggression symptoms in individuals, as shown by the Wilcoxon-Mann-Whitney test with a p value of 0.028, indicating its potential relevance in cocaine-induced aggressive behaviors.
title: USP7/Maged1-Mediated H2A Monoubiquitination in the Paraventricular Thalamus: An Epigenetic Mechanism Involved in Cocaine Use Disorder

finding: SNP rs7342770 in the USP7 gene was significantly associated with aggression symptoms, demonstrated by a Wilcoxon-Mann-Whitney test resulting in a p value of 0.0014, reinforcing the role of USP7 variants in modulating aggressive behavior related to cocaine use.
title: USP7/Maged1-Mediated H2A Monoubiquitination in the Paraventricular Thalamus: An Epigenetic Mechanism Involved in Cocaine Use Disorder

finding: The rs35816944 variant was identified as a rare predicted damaging missense variant (p.Ser171Leu) in the gene SPSB3. This gene is implicated in the degradation of the SNAIL transcription factor, which regulates the epithelial-mesenchymal transition. The finding was novel as SPSB3 had not been previously associated with cardiovascular traits.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of the electrocardiographic PR interval identifies 210 loci underlying cardiac conduction

finding: This SNP was identified as having a sex-biased eQTL effect for TERF2IP. It showed lower expression in females and higher in males and was associated with CAD trait risk, demonstrating a gender-specific regulatory role.
title: Genetic regulation of human aortic smooth muscle cell gene expression and splicing predict causal coronary artery disease genes

finding: The risk allele of this SNP was associated with increased SMC proliferation and higher expression of DHODH in quiescent SMCs, supporting its role in CAD-related phenotypic changes.
title: Genetic regulation of human aortic smooth muscle cell gene expression and splicing predict causal coronary artery disease genes

finding: The SNP rs8046859 functioned as an sQTL for the gene ATXN1L in tibial nerve tissue, distinct from muscle skeletal tissue where it primarily acting as an eQTL for the gene IST1. This exemplified the heteropleiotropic nature of genetic variants affecting splicing and expression in a tissue-specific context.
title: Identification and analysis of splicing quantitative trait loci across multiple tissues in the human genome

finding: Variant rs145650870 was identified as an activity-increasing variant located in an RG-specific chromatin loop affecting TUFM, ATXN2L, and SH2B1. Its alternative allele created a TFBS for EHF.
title: Massively parallel characterization of psychiatric disorder-associated and cell-type-specific regulatory elements in the developing human cortex

finding: The rs11647069 SNP presented significant associations with certain phenotypes, further establishing connections between genetic loci and metabolic traits.
title: Large-scale association analyses identify host factors influencing human gut microbiome composition

finding: The SNP rs11642657, located downstream of the IRF8 locus, was associated with monocyte counts and exhibited a low-frequency status (MAF=0.8%). Its effect size was larger compared to a common insertion in IRF8, demonstrating its potential role in the regulation of monocyte counts.
title: Influences of rare copy number variation on human complex traits

finding: The SNP rs12102760 was associated with pH dynamics in cancer cells. Higher expression levels impacted intracellular pH (pHi) and were found to be correlated to the regulation of transcription factors that control cancer phenotypes, notably vasculogenic mimicry (VM). This finding established a connection between pHi regulation and cancer progression.
title: Intracellular pH dynamics respond to microenvironment stiffening and mediate vasculogenic mimicry through β-catenin

finding: The SNP rs1805007, related to FANCA, was found to increase the risk of melanoma (OR=1.63) and non-melanomatous skin cancer (OR=1.36). The association with anthropometric traits showed that this SNP only linked to standing height, with a strong significance.
title: Heritable genetic variants in key cancer genes link cancer risk with anthropometric traits

finding: The SNP rs12102727 was correlated with promising applications of tumor spheroids and organoids in personalized medicine. This correlation indicated its potential relevance in understanding phenotypic variations in cancer biology and therapeutic responses.
title: ESPRESSO: Spatiotemporal omics based on organelle phenotyping

finding: The SNP rs12926153, in a DNAse region, was associated with the expression modulation of CLEC16A, which is involved in inflammatory processes and differentially expressed in AD brains.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: The SNP rs12922908 was involved in interactions with rs9652600 and rs12926153, suggesting a role in regulating CLEC16A expression linked to inflammation and AD.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: The SNP rs9652600 was associated with CLEC16A expression regulation in the context of brain inflammation related to Alzheimer's, in conjunction with rs12922908.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: This SNP related to CETP was associated with age-related macular degeneration in earlier studies, providing insights into its cardiovascular implications.
title: Genome-wide association study of plasma triglycerides, phospholipids and relation to cardio-metabolic risk factors

finding: In the study by Lewis et al. (2010), the SNP rs9939609, which is related to obesity through the FTO gene, was found to be associated with an increased risk of prostate cancer. This finding suggested that the genetic variant could potentially influence cancer susceptibility through mechanisms related to obesity, thereby linking m6A RNA methylation alterations to cancer risk.
title: m6A-TSHub: unveiling the context-specific m6A methylation and m6A-affecting mutations in 23 human tissues

finding: The analysis indicated that this SNP influenced AXL inactivation, which inhibited mesothelioma growth and migration. The mechanism involved regulation of p53 expression, underscoring the role of AXL in EMT and cancer cell behavior as reported by Song et al. (2020).
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing reveals microenvironment context-specific routes for epithelial-mesenchymal transition in pancreas cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs34515646 (R146Q) was identified as one of the two highest frequency human MLKL missense coding variants that altered the brace helix region. Its alterations suggested potential impacts on necroptosis regulation, similar to the findings observed in mice with the MlklD139V mutation.
title: Missense mutations in the MLKL ‘brace’ region lead to lethal neonatal inflammation in mice and are present in high frequency in humans

finding: The SNP rs35589326 (S132P) was noted as the third highest frequency MLKL variation. The study indicated that this variant also modified the brace helix. Further experiments confirmed that the mouse equivalent of this SNP (mMLKLS131P) formed membrane-associated complexes and exhibited cytotoxic activity, reinforcing its relevance in necroptosis.
title: Missense mutations in the MLKL ‘brace’ region lead to lethal neonatal inflammation in mice and are present in high frequency in humans

finding: The SNP rs144526386 (G202V) represented the fourth most common polymorphism found in the MLKL gene, occurring exclusively in the MLKL2 splice isoform. Its unique splice context and connection to the inflammatory disease in patients indicated that variations in this locus could influence the severity of necroptotic responses.
title: Missense mutations in the MLKL ‘brace’ region lead to lethal neonatal inflammation in mice and are present in high frequency in humans

finding: The variant rs8048449 showed a strong marginal association with the red hair phenotype. It was noted that 25% of the weight mass for gene TUBB3 was attributed to this variant, indicating its significant role in the expression related to red hair.
title: Learning epistatic polygenic phenotypes with Boolean interactions

finding: The intronic variant rs12925026 in the gene ZNF276 was found to be associated at genome-wide significance with non-melanoma skin cancer. This finding contributed to the understanding of ZNF276's role as a candidate tumor suppressor gene in breast cancer.
title: Pleiotropy-guided transcriptome imputation from normal and tumor tissues identifies new candidate susceptibility genes for breast and ovarian cancer

finding: The rs16940186 risk variant was associated with ulcerative colitis and resided within an intergenic cCRE specific to gastrointestinal tract epithelial cells. It was predicted to contact the transcription start site of IRF8, a transcription factor that plays a role in immune cell maturation and innate immunity in gastric epithelial cells. Additionally, the risk allele was identified as an eQTL that increased IRF8 expression in human colon tissue, indicating its potential to alter the transcriptional responses of intestinal epithelial cells to inflammatory cytokines.
title: A cell atlas of chromatin accessibility across 25 adult human tissues

finding: The SNP rs8048449 was found to show a strong marginal association with red hair, contributing significantly to the response surface for the gene TUBB3, which exhibited marked transitions corresponding to different values of its highly weighted variants.
title: Learning epistatic polygenic phenotypes with Boolean interactions

finding: Used as an instrumental variable for DGLA in the MR analysis, SNP rs6498540 contributed to the inferred significant causal relationship between DGLA and BMI (p-value < 0.05). However, the concurrent use of both rs968567 and rs6498540 as IVs for DGLA, along with the linkage disequilibrium with rs174556, complicated the interpretation of results and underscored the risk of violating causal inference assumptions.
title: Bayesian network analysis complements Mendelian randomization approaches for exploratory analysis of causal relationships in complex data

finding: The CETP-related SNP rs1532624 was linked with age-related macular degeneration in earlier GWAS, indicating its continuing relevance to lipid-related conditions.
title: Genome-wide association study of plasma lipids

finding: SNP rs72802342 demonstrated an association (p-value = 2.9e-15, beta = 0.11) with pancreatic volume and diabetic traits.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: SNP rs7404039 was significantly associated with pancreatic fat (p-value = 1.1e-12, beta = 0.06) and connected to the expression of CBFA2T3.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs77924615 near PDILT/UMOD exhibited a significant association (p-value = 4e-11, beta = 0.0558), linking it to kidney-related traits such as hypertension and kidney function.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: SNP rs1421085 was strongly associated with ASAT volume (p-value = 1.6e-21, beta = 0.07) and linked to numerous hematological measurements.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs12103023 was associated with the regulation of Nrf2-mediated antioxidant responses, which were linked to lung tumor initiation and progression. Original findings indicated that this SNP may influence the expression of cellular mechanisms that support tumorigenesis in the context of lung cancer, particularly in relation to the roles of the thioredoxin and glutathione systems.
title: Distinct Roles for the Thioredoxin and Glutathione Antioxidant Systems in Nrf2-Mediated Lung Tumor Initiation and Progression

finding: The polymorphism rs3794624 in CYBA was linked to decreased susceptibility to TB in a study involving Chinese Han individuals. This suggested a genetic mechanism that could contribute to lower TB risk and indicated that the differential expression observed in PMN_HITTIN could involve reduced ROS formation.
title: Altered neutrophil extracellular traps in response to Mycobacterium tuberculosis in persons living with HIV with no previous TB and negative TST and IGRA

finding: Associated with reduced SA in ADHD, rs9931589 illustrates the genetic factors influencing brain morphology.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: This SNP showed connections with greater thickness related to ANX, highlighting its role in brain anatomical features.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: With a p-value of 7.34×10−10, this SNP was found in the promoter of SETD1A, a histone methyltransferase, supporting its involvement in PD risk through epigenetic regulation.
title: Parkinson’s Disease Genetic Risk Evaluation in Microglia Highlights Autophagy and Lysosomal Genes

finding: The SNP rs12051290 was associated with molecular mechanisms that regulate obesity-related hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). In the study by Rajesh and Sarkar (2020), it was determined that this genetic variant played a significant role in the pathophysiology of HCC related to obesity, thereby establishing a clear link between genetic predispositions and susceptibility to this type of cancer.
title: Hybrid Adipocyte-Derived Exosome Nano Platform for Potent Chemo-Phototherapy in Targeted Hepatocellular Carcinoma

finding: The study reported that individuals carrying the FTO rs1421085 obesity-risk allele (CC) exhibited suppressed expression of mitochondrial and thermogenesis genes in comparison to those with the healthy TT alleles. Additionally, it was observed that ThTr2 expression was lower in neck fat derived adipocytes from CC individuals, indicating a potential link between this allele and impaired energy metabolism and thermogenic capacity.
title: Availability of abundant thiamine determines efficiency of thermogenic activation in human neck area derived adipocytes

finding: The SNP rs8053350 was identified as a dynamic eQTL associated with the level of RNF166 expression. It was located within an intron of the PIEZO1 gene and was linked to varicose veins, which are associated with a higher risk for developing deep vein thrombosis and other vascular conditions. Additionally, this SNP was found to be associated with a novel heart eGene, ZC3HC1, which is implicated in myocardial infarction, coronary artery disease, and ischemic stroke. Furthermore, it was also connected to bronchodilator responsiveness in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.
title: Dynamic effects of genetic variation on gene expression revealed following hypoxic stress in cardiomyocytes

finding: The rs11076256 variant, a missense variant Gly188Ser in the GOT2 gene encoding AST, was found to strongly associate with AST levels with a notably significant p-value of 6.3 × 10^-62.
title: Genome-wide association study of circulating liver enzymes reveals an expanded role for manganese transporter SLC30A10 in liver health

finding: The rs9937140 SNP, located upstream of the APOOP5 pseudogene, conferred odds of 1.99 for cryptosporidiosis within the first year of life, highlighting its significance in the genetic predisposition to the disease.
title: Genome-wide association study of cryptosporidiosis in infants implicates PRKCA

finding: The SNP rs12051339 was associated with the regulation of Src Family Kinases in the context of colorectal cancer development. This finding linked the genetic variant to altered signaling pathways crucial for angiogenesis and cellular maintenance, highlighting its relevance in cancer progression and treatment responses.
title: N-VEGF, the forgotten isoform of VEGF-A, activate cellular stress survival circuits

finding: The SNP rs34177108 was identified as the lead SNP for the NonEA-INC phenotype, which pertains to genetic variance related to income that is not shared with educational attainment. This locus on chromosome 16 was previously associated with vitamin D levels and various traits related to hair and skin, indicating potential links to social factors and discrimination in the job market.
title: Associations between common genetic variants and income provide insights about the socioeconomic health gradient

finding: The SNP rs12103014 was associated with the development of dual targeting strategies in cancer therapy. Specifically, findings indicated that it contributed to the effectiveness of DARPin-based toxins in overcoming tumor escape mechanisms, particularly in HER2-positive tumor models.
title: Internalization-Responsive Nano-PLGA For Image-Guided Photodynamic Therapy Against HER2-Positive Breast Cancer

finding: The analysis indicated that rs6420415, found in an intron of the gene CDYL2, negatively impacted FOXA1 binding due to alterations in a Forkhead motif. This rSNP was associated with an increased breast cancer risk, suggesting that the G allele may lead to lower expression of CDYL2, potentially contributing to changes in tumor behavior.
title: Breast cancer risk SNPs converge on estrogen receptor binding sites commonly shared between breast tumors to locally alter estrogen signalling output

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with connectivity asymmetries, showing a z-score of 6.15.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: In high LD with rs56023709, this variant was previously linked to thalamus volume.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: While this SNP had weak associations, its significant connections to coronary atherosclerosis and triglycerides, paired with concordant effect size directions in related traits, illustrate its potential role in cardiovascular genetics.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The missense variant Gly188Ser (rs11076256) in GOT2, which encodes a mitochondrial isoform of AST, was strongly associated with AST (p = 6.3 × 10^-62), confirming its role as a cis-pQTL.
title: GWAS of serum ALT and AST reveals an association of SLC30A10 Thr95Ile with hypermanganesemia symptoms

finding: The variant rs9923231 (c.-1639G>A), associated with warfarin sensitivity, was found to have a high prevalence in East Asian populations (89.95%), while being comparatively less common in African populations (10.09%). This SNP likely influenced variance in blood clotting responses in COVID-19 patients.
title: Potential impact on coagulopathy of gene variants of coagulation related proteins that interact with SARS-CoV-2

finding: This SNP was found within a known enhancer element that regulates alpha-globin genes and was identified as one of two potential causative alleles for several hematic traits, including red blood cell count, validated using a massively parallel reporter assay.
title: Parallel evolution at the regulatory base-pair level contributes to mammalian inter-specific differences in polygenic traits

finding: The SNP rs6498169, located between the loci of the master MHC-II regulator Ciita and Socs1, exhibited chromatin accessibility specifically in OPC- and MOL5/6-EAE context, but not in control (Ctr) OLG or MiGl. This accessibility change in MS patients may suggest its role in regulating inflammation and possibly contributing to MS pathogenesis.
title: A primed immune transcriptional program is activated in oligodendroglia in multiple sclerosis

finding: This missense mutation was associated with recent selection signals; its significance was derived from its role in conditions like Joubert syndrome and Meckel syndrome.
title: Scalable probabilistic PCA for large-scale genetic variation data

finding: This SNP, associated with the CETP gene, was significant (p < 10^{-85}) and involved in HDL particle remodeling. The G2PT framework noted significant epistatic interaction with SNP rs483082, suggesting that these SNPs acted in an opposing manner to modulate the TG/HDL phenotype.
title: Mechanistic genotype-phenotype translation using hierarchical transformers

finding: It was associated with 4 traits, with varying levels of pleiotropy among its 15 significant SNPs within 100kb, where 8 were linked to 2-5 traits and 7 to 6-10 traits.
title: Genome-Wide Large-Scale Multi-Trait Analysis Characterizes Global Patterns of Pleiotropy and Unique Trait-Specific Variants

finding: The SNP rs12051089 was associated with the efficacy of combined immunotherapy treatments involving PD-1 antibodies and VEGF inhibitors in advanced hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). This genetic variation was highlighted in the context of enhancing treatment responses to new therapeutic regimens, as indicated in the study by Kudo (2020).
title: Informing virtual clinical trials of hepatocellular carcinoma with spatial multi-omics analysis of a human neoadjuvant immunotherapy clinical trial

finding: The SNP rs17822931 was successfully modified from a homozygous CC to either homozygous TT or heterozygous CT when synthetic T allele DNA was spike-in at varying concentrations. A wider range of concentrations such as greater than 10 ng led to a homozygous TT result, while intermediate amounts of 0.1-1 ng resulted in heterozygous CT or no call, indicating that synthetic DNA spiking could effectively alter DTC genotyping results.
title: Doctoring Direct-to-Consumer Genetic Tests with DNA Spike-Ins

finding: The rs16260 SNP, identified as a C-to-A substitution in the CDH1 promoter, was previously associated with cancer-specific risk, affecting transcriptional regulation. In analyzed samples, the A allele was observed in 38% of reads in GBM Nx18-25 cells, but not at all in NSC, underscoring its potential clinical significance in glioblastoma biology.
title: Flap-enabled next-generation capture (FENGC): precision targeted single-molecule profiling of epigenetic heterogeneity, chromatin dynamics, and genetic variation

finding: Linked to traits associated with diabetes, this SNP was found near CTRB2 related to pancreatic characteristics.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: Colocalised with CBFA2T3 expression in pancreatic tissues, indicated a role in pancreatic development.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: Associated with kidney function parameters, particularly linked to hypertension and kidney health.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: This SNP at the FTO locus was associated with ASAT volume, beyond being linked to body composition.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: The SNP rs10468280 at the FTO locus was associated with sex, showing that the body mass index (BMI) increasing allele was present at a higher frequency in males compared to females, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.02 and a p-value of 4.4×10−36 in the 23andMe dataset. The UK Biobank also reported similar findings with an OR of 1.02 (1.01-1.03) and a p-value of 3.6×10−5. Mendelian randomization analyses confirmed a causal effect of BMI on sex participation biases in both cohorts, though the dose-response relationship showed considerable heterogeneity.
title: Genetic analyses identify widespread sex-differential participation bias

finding: This SNP was classified as shared across four T2D-relevant tissues with mid-level TOA scores, supporting its role in T2D pathways.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: rs17817964 was strongly associated with overall breast cancer risk (P=4.67E-20), ER-positive breast cancer (P=2.48E-13) and ER-negative breast cancer (P=1.56E-09).
title: Coffee consumption and risk of breast cancer: a Mendelian Randomization study

finding: The rs183130 variant at the CETP locus was associated with reduced LDL-C concentration (beta = -1.568 mg/dL, p-value = 2.88×10^-09). This variant was most significantly associated with LDL-C among individuals of African ancestry (beta = -2.762 mg/dL, p-value = 5.71×10^-07).
title: Whole genome sequence analysis of blood lipid levels in >66,000 individuals

finding: The lead HDL-C-associated variant rs3764261 at the CETP locus was found to be significantly associated with an increase in HDL-C (3.5 mg/dL increase, p-value = 8.03×10^-283). It was one of the primary variants informing HDL-C associations in the study.
title: Whole genome sequence analysis of blood lipid levels in >66,000 individuals

finding: The chr16:56957451:C:T variant (rs183130) aligned with significant reductions in LDL-C and was specifically noteworthy among African ancestry individuals.
title: Whole genome sequence analysis of blood lipid levels in >66,000 individuals

finding: The chr16:56959412:C:A variant (rs3764261) was associated with increased HDL-C, reinforcing its established role in lipid physiology.
title: Whole genome sequence analysis of blood lipid levels in >66,000 individuals

finding: SNP rs10445003 was linked to the CIITA locus, associated with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). Initially not showing eQTL colocalization, the meta-analysis revealed a strong association with CIITA expression, demonstrating significant eQTL colocalization after the increase in sample size.
title: Chromatin accessibility variation provides insights into missing regulation underlying immune-mediated diseases

finding: The findings for rs13331259 reflected its significance for the trait MCH, where it was also selected as the lowest p-value association from chromosome 16 in the analyses performed.
title: Interpreting SNP heritability in admixed populations

finding: This well-known missense variant in the ABCC11 gene was associated with phenotypes related to sweat and earwax production and was found to be under selection in East Asian populations.
title: Ohana: detecting selection in multiple populations by modelling ancestral admixture components

finding: The variant rs373256534, identified as chrE3:g.42850283C>T (p.Arg2162Trp) in cats, was found to be identical to a human variant associated with autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease (ADPKD). This variant was predicted as damaging by PolyPhen-2 and was one of four singleton variants unique to ADPKD cases that did not carry the conventional PKD1 variant.
title: Large-scale epidemiological study on feline autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease and identification of novel PKD1 gene variants

finding: The SNP rs4784220 was identified as a strong association with breast cancer risk when using the DOT method. It received a significant weight in the statistical analysis within the LD block of the TOX3 gene.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: This SNP was identified amongst the top-ranking results in a calculation of the DOT statistic, indicating its potential role in breast cancer risk.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: The analysis determined rs43143 as a possible new association with breast cancer, identified from within the TOX3 gene's LD block.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: The SNP rs113001936 on chromosome 16 showed a significant participation effect with Bonferroni correction. The analysis indicated that this SNP was part of a broader participation polygenic score (pPGS) derived from a genome-wide association study (GWAS) involving first-degree relatives in the UK Biobank. While the excess of SNPs had p-values less than 0.01, a literature search did not reveal explicit reasons for rs113001936's association with participation.
title: The Genetics of Participation: Method and Analysis

finding: The SNP rs72802342 was associated (p=2.9e-15, beta=0.11) with pancreatic volume, implicating it in metabolic conditions.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs7404039 was associated (p=1.1e-12, beta=0.06) with pancreatic fat.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs77924615 was associated (p=4e-11, beta=0.0558) with renal-related traits supporting a link to overall kidney function.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning
