finding: The SNP rs1421085 was linked (p=1.6e-21, beta=0.07) to spleen volume, implicating it in body composition traits.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs153109 was identified as the most significant overlapping SNP for ulcerative colitis (UC) located in an intron of the Interleukin-27 (IL-27) gene. This SNP has also been associated with Crohn's disease and inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). IL-27, produced by macrophages, has been implicated in regulating immune response in IBD and proposed as a potential drug target for this disease.
title: Scalable ultra-high-throughput single-cell chromatin and RNA sequencing reveals gene regulatory dynamics linking macrophage polarization to autoimmune disease

finding: The rs1421085 SNP, located within the FTO locus, was found to be associated with the genetic predisposition to obesity. The presence of the C risk-allele correlated with a shift in the differentiation program from brown to white adipocytes, leading to lipid-storing characteristics and decreased thermogenesis. In contrast, carrying the T/T genotype, which is considered risk-free, allowed for the expression of certain transcription factors (ARIDB5 repressor) that favored brown adipocyte differentiation. This shift was linked to the regulatory control of IRX3 and IRX5, which play roles in adipocyte identity.
title: FTO intronic SNP strongly influences human neck adipocyte browning determined by tissue and PPARγ specific regulation: a transcriptome analysis

finding: This SNP is at the CDH13 locus within a smooth muscle cell (SMC) peak, showing co-accessibility with the CDH13 promoter, linking it to CAD pathophysiology.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: The SNP rs5882 (I405V) was associated with exceptional longevity and healthy aging in centenarians. This variant led to decreased CETP expression or decreased CETP activity, resulting in good cognitive performance and a decreased risk of developing Alzheimer’s disease. Additionally, CETP variants with lower activity were noted to potentially reduce Alzheimer’s disease risk specifically in individuals carrying the APOE4 allele, highlighting the variant’s impact on both longevity and cognitive health.
title: CETP inhibitor evacetrapib enters mouse brain tissue

finding: The variant rs4782568 was predicted by the ABC Model to be regulated in hepatocytes via an enhancer. This variant had a fine-mapping posterior inclusion probability (PIP) of >= 10% for 14 complex traits, including various serum levels of liver-produced proteins and metabolites. OSGIN1, the gene linked to this variant, encodes a protein that regulates cellular growth in response to oxidative stress, potentially affecting hepatic metabolic functions.
title: Genome-wide maps of enhancer regulation connect risk variants to disease genes

finding: The more frequent <italic>p.Gln48Ter</italic> variant was shown to be greater than 20 fold enriched in a cohort of Hong Kong Chinese patients suffering from Alzheimer's disease.
title: A common human MLKL polymorphism confers resistance to negative regulation by phosphorylation

finding: The hypomorphic <italic>p.G316D</italic> missense variant was reported to be associated with Maturity Onset Diabetes of the Young.
title: A common human MLKL polymorphism confers resistance to negative regulation by phosphorylation

finding: The SNP rs35219837 was linked to the expression of PGAP6 when analyzing TB-T2D vs T2D patients while adjusting for Khoe-San ancestry.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: This SNP was associated with the expression of MRPL28 between TB-T2D and T2D patients adjusted for Khoe-San ancestry.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: SNP rs113496159 influenced the expression of MRPL28 when examining TB-T2D versus T2D patients with diligence toward Khoe-San ancestry.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: The rs17677328 was found to affect MRPL28's expression in the context of TB-T2D and T2D patients while adjusting for Khoe-San ancestry.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: For SNP rs11150606, a favored mutation was associated with the scalp hair shape phenotype in East Asian populations. It exhibited a significant drug response correlation, where allele C was tied to a required lower dose of Warfarin as compared to allele T (p = 0.0221). The C mutation displayed a high frequency (>76.4%) in East Asians but was rare in other populations. The DFscore for this mutation was reported as 0.713/0.795/0.651/0.667 across different East Asian populations, denoting its positive selection.
title: PopTradeOff: a database for exploring population-specific trade-offs between adaptive evolution, disease susceptibility, and drug responsiveness

finding: The p.Gly169Glu variant encoded by rs138628476 in SEPT12 was previously reported to cause male subfertility in a mouse model, highlighting its pathogenic role.
title: In vivo versus in silico assessment of potentially pathogenic missense variants in human reproductive genes

finding: The SNP rs12051329 was linked to findings that indicated a regulatory role for TOMM40 in lipid metabolism. The study revealed that suppression of TOMM40 led to upregulation of APOE and LDLR, which influenced plasma lipid levels. In vivo knockdown experiments in mice demonstrated significant impacts on plasma triglyceride and cholesterol concentrations, linking the SNP to mechanisms affecting lipid metabolism due to TOMM40’s role in mitochondrial function.
title: TOMM40 regulates hepatocellular and plasma lipid metabolism via an LXR-dependent pathway

finding: Located in IGFALS, this SNP was identified as another high severity SNP for Parkinson disease, indicating its potential impact on disease development.
title: Genetic variability in pathways associates with pesticide-induced nervous system disease in the United States

finding: The rs1805007 variant was a known common variant in the MC1R gene associated with freckles and sun sensitivity, present in family AF1. It provided an odds ratio of 4.38 for the effect allele T, with presence in additional families UF21 and UF7.
title: A Weights-based variant ranking pipeline for familial complex disorders

finding: The rs1805008 variant in the MC1R gene was observed in family UF19 and was heterozygous for the T/C alleles. This variant had an odds ratio of 1.64 for the T effect allele, indicating its potential association with melanoma.
title: A Weights-based variant ranking pipeline for familial complex disorders

finding: This variant, causing a premature stop gain in IL34, was linked to decreased IL34 levels in cis and decreased CD207 levels in trans.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: Driven by this missense variant, strong colocalizations were found with LAMP3 levels and COVID-19 hospitalization.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: The SNP rs12102805 was associated with homologous recombination deficiency in ovarian carcinomas, contributing to the understanding of cancer sensitivity to therapies targeting such pathways. This finding was based on observations that depleted PSMC3IP or MND1 impaired DNA repair mechanisms, underscoring the relevance of this SNP in germline and somatic contexts where D-loop formation impacts therapeutic responses.
title: MND1 and PSMC3IP control PARP inhibitor sensitivity in mitotic cells

finding: The SNP rs12102953 was linked to Polo-Like Kinase 1 (PLK1), which is a known stem cell marker associated with developmental processes. This marker was downregulated following irradiation-based ablation of neoblasts in Fasciola hepatica, indicating its role in stem cell functionality and potential therapeutic targeting.
title: Neoblast-like Stem Cells of Fasciola hepatica

finding: The SNP rs11643718 in SLC12A3 was found to be associated with the development of diabetic kidney disease in a Chinese population with type 2 diabetes. This finding highlighted its potential role in the pathology of diabetes-related complications.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The CETP rs708272 polymorphism was implicated in susceptibility to Coronary Artery Disease (CAD), suggesting its role in lipid metabolism and cardiovascular risk.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The C-Maf-inducing protein gene rs2287112 polymorphism was associated with schizophrenia, indicating a link in psychiatric genetics.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs115775278 was associated with sexual dimorphism, being an imputed intergenic variant located on chromosome 16. This variant was linked to a total of 17 complex traits, with nearby genes including PMFBP1, which is related to spermatogenesis function, indicating potential implications in reproductive health and traits.
title: Sexual differences in genetic architecture in UK Biobank

finding: Associated with psoriasis, rs58726213 demonstrated allele-specific binding (ASB), preferred by CREB1 and JUN depending on the allele. This SNP was located in the STX4 intron and served as an eQTL for STX4 and HSD3B7, with STX4 being significantly down-regulated in psoriasis.
title: Landscape of allele-specific transcription factor binding in the human genome

finding: The SNP rs12102792 was associated with findings related to the response of meniscus cells under inflammatory conditions. Specifically, the study highlighted that TNF-α treatment, which was influenced by the genetic context of this SNP, significantly impeded the migration speed of inner meniscus cells, indicating a potential link between this SNP and the tissue's regenerative capacity in clinical scenarios involving meniscus injuries. This underscores the relevance of genetic factors in the zonal dependency of meniscus healing processes.
title: Epigenetic Dynamics in Meniscus Cell Migration and its Zonal Dependency in Response to Inflammatory Conditions: Implications for Regeneration Strategies

finding: The variant rs3212379, which is 120bp upstream of the transcriptional start site of MC1R, was strongly associated with red hair. The study reported that among the individuals carrying this variant, 376 out of 380 also had a coding variant related to a frameshift mutation (rs796296176), indicating its potential role as a functional variant related to red hair coloration.
title: Expanded Analysis of Pigmentation Genetics in UK Biobank

finding: The frameshift variant rs796296176 was identified in high linkage disequilibrium with rs3212379 and was found to be present in 376 out of 380 individuals with red hair who also had the rs3212379 variant. This suggests that this frameshift mutation is likely a significant functional variant associated with red hair, marking its first association in previous analyses.
title: Expanded Analysis of Pigmentation Genetics in UK Biobank

finding: The gene ATXN2L, located near the SNP rs7359397, was also identified as a 'positive hit' in this investigation.
title: A multi-component screen for feeding behaviour and nutritional status in Drosophila to interrogate mammalian appetite-related genes

finding: Associated with arrhythmia (beta=0.094, p=8.28×10^-12), this SNP was part of cardiovascular-related findings.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP showed significant association with arrhythmia, supporting its relevance to cardiovascular health.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: The SNP was linked to allele-switching ASM in the PKD1L3 gene, with significant methylation differences observed between cancer and non-cancer samples.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The variant rs3790099, located in the GNAO1 gene, was identified in the CCSp analysis as being associated with cardioembolic stroke (CES). This variant was replicated in the Europeans-only analysis, showing its relevance in the genetic landscape of this ischemic stroke subtype.
title: Alternate approach to stroke phenotyping identifies a genetic risk locus for small vessel stroke

finding: The SNP rs12051111 was associated with circulating tumor cell clusters (CTC-clusters) in a study analyzing metastatic breast cancer patients. High expression levels related to this SNP were predictive of patient outcomes and indicated a significant role in predicting unfavorable outcomes related to distant metastasis-free survival.
title: Computational ranking-assisted identification of Plexin-B2 in homotypic and heterotypic clustering of circulating tumor cells in breast cancer metastasis

finding: The SNP rs12102861 was linked to interactions between circulating tumor cells (CTCs) and cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs). This relationship highlighted the importance of CTC clustering in tumor progression and provided insights into the molecular mechanisms influencing metastasis in breast cancer.
title: Computational ranking-assisted identification of Plexin-B2 in homotypic and heterotypic clustering of circulating tumor cells in breast cancer metastasis

finding: The rs1421085 SNP located in the intronic region of the FTO gene was identified as critical in modifying the development of the thermogenic phenotype. The presence of the homozygous C/C obesity-risk alleles correlated with the expression of adjacent genes IRX3 and IRX5, which resulted in a less thermogenic adipocyte phenotype. In contrast, the T/T non-obesity risk genotype facilitated the binding of ARID5B, blocking IRX3 and IRX5 expression and promoting the browning adipocyte phenotype.
title: Regulatory Modules of Human Thermogenic Adipocytes: Functional Genomics of Meta-Analyses Derived Marker-Genes

finding: The SNP rs7196032 was identified as an eQTL for COG4 with a p-value of 1.1e-4. It was associated with Alzheimer's disease-related functional implications in the context of Golgi apparatus function.
title: Leveraging functional annotation to identify genes associated with complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs7192890 was identified as an eQTL for COG4 with a p-value of 3.5e-3 and was also considered a potential GWAS hit related to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Leveraging functional annotation to identify genes associated with complex diseases

finding: In HDL analysis, rs1800775 showed a perfect replication with a PIP of 1.00, which supported its previously discovered association within the study populations.
title: Multi-scale Inference of Genetic Trait Architecture using Biologically Annotated Neural Networks

finding: The SNP rs12103014 was associated with increased efficacy of DARPin-based toxins in targeting cancer cells, suggesting a correlation with improved treatments for tumors. This finding specifically related to enhanced tumor escape mechanisms, which was relevant for advancing therapeutic strategies.
title: Internalization-Responsive Nano-PLGA For Image-Guided Photodynamic Therapy Against HER2-Positive Breast Cancer

finding: The C/A polymorphism at SNP rs16260, located at position -160 from the transcriptional start site of the CDH1 gene, was found to significantly decrease the activity of the CDH1 promoter by approximately 70%, indicating that the A-allele is associated with increased prostate cancer risk. This finding was supported by data showing that the C allele recruits transcription factors more effectively than the A allele. Moreover, the study clarified that the mutation affects the RNA structure, influencing transcriptional regulation by altering the interaction with miRNAs and affecting chromatin modifications.
title: A functional SNP regulates E-cadherin expression by dynamically remodeling the 3D structure of a promoter-associated non-coding RNA transcript

finding: The SNP rs12923477 had significant effects on hippocampal volumes, notably impacting CA1 volume. This SNP's associations add to the understanding of genetic influences on brain structure, particularly related to neuroinflammation and Alzheimer's disease mechanisms.
title: A fast non-parametric test of association for multiple traits

finding: The variant rs12925026, located in the intronic region of ZNF276, was associated at genome-wide significance with non-melanoma skin cancer. ZNF276 is implicated as a candidate tumor suppressor gene in breast cancer and is biologically rational due to its overlap with FANCA, which is involved in DNA repair and has been previously linked to cancer predisposition.
title: Pleiotropy-guided transcriptome imputation from normal and tumor tissues identifies new candidate susceptibility genes for breast and ovarian cancer

finding: The SNP rs12102870 was implicated in melanoma's resistance to targeted therapy and immunotherapy, emphasizing the tumor microenvironment's impact on treatment outcomes, according to the work of Falcone et al. (2020). This finding related to the adaptability of melanoma cells under therapeutic pressures.
title: Dynamical modelling of proliferative-invasive plasticity and IFNγ signaling in melanoma reveals mechanisms of PD-L1 expression heterogeneity

finding: The missense exonic variant encoding PLCG2<sup>P522R</sup> demonstrated a protective effect against Alzheimer's disease. In GWAS data, it presented an odds ratio (OR) of 0.76 (p=0.007), indicating a reduced risk for AD. This finding was validated in a European-American cohort with an OR of 0.63 (p=0.002), confirming PLCG2<sup>P522R</sup> as a protective factor against the disease.
title: Genetic Variants of Phospholipase C-γ2 Confer Altered Microglial Phenotypes and Differential Risk for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The study provided insights into the association between the FTO genotype related to the rs9939609 SNP and methylation levels impacting body mass and telomere length. In the context of the findings presented, rs9939609 was connected to variations in body weight. Specifically, lower methylation associated with the FTO genotype influenced body mass among the studied population, highlighting the role of genetic factors in obesity and longevity.
title: Body weight at young adulthood and association with epigenetic aging and lifespan in the BXD murine family

finding: The analysis linked the SNP rs12051201 to the expression of components within the mTOR pathway, indicating its potential role as a predictive biomarker in patients with advanced neuroendocrine tumors when treated with Everolimus. This finding was significant as it contributed to understanding individual patient responses to targeted therapies.
title: An Integrative Genetic, Epigenetic and Proteomic Characterization of Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Neoplasms (PanNENs) defines Distinct Molecular Features of α- and β-cell like Subgroups

finding: This SNP, located in the FTO intronic region, was found to have the strongest muQTL, raw vQTL, and RINT vQTL associations with body mass index (BMI), significantly affected by various environmental factors, such as alcohol intake frequency. The interaction between rs56094641 and alcohol intake emphasized its role in obesity regulation, indicating it as a gene-environment interaction hotspot.
title: Leveraging phenotypic variability to identify genetic interactions in human phenotypes

finding: This intronic variant in FTO associated with OSA severity (beta=0.09, p=8.08x10^-3) and diabetes.
title: Characterization of Genetic and Phenotypic Heterogeneity of Obstructive Sleep Apnea Using Electronic Health Records

finding: The SNP rs7500448 was strongly associated with diastolic blood pressure (DBP) based on analyses from the UK Biobank study (P=6.3×10^-15). It was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the gene CDH13, showing significant evidence of genetic influence on blood pressure variation through CDH13 expression in the aorta (MR P=2.78×10^-8).
title: A transcriptome-wide Mendelian randomization study to uncover tissue-dependent regulatory mechanisms across the human phenome

finding: The minor A allele at rs72802342, located near CTRB1/BCAR1 on chromosome 16q23.1, was found to be protective for type 2 diabetes (OR=0.87, p=4.00×10^-32) and susceptible for type 1 diabetes (OR=1.33, p=5.81×10^-10). This represented a shared genetic association between both diseases with a posterior probability of colocalisation of 0.98.
title: Divergent genetic effects for type 1 and type 2 diabetes at overlapping association signals

finding: The rs16260 SNP, a C-to-A substitution in the CDH1 promoter, was earlier identified as a cancer-specific risk factor. In this analysis, the A allele was observed within 0% of reads in NSC and 38% of reads in Nx18-25, highlighting a significant differential presence related to its implications in cancer risk.
title: Flap-enabled next-generation capture (FENGC): precision targeted single-molecule profiling of epigenetic heterogeneity, chromatin dynamics, and genetic variation

finding: The intergenic variant rs9989419 near CETP was identified as a core instrument for HDL levels. However, MR Corge consistently showed that HDL levels may not be causally associated with CAD.
title: MR Corge: Sensitivity analysis of Mendelian randomization based on the core gene hypothesis for polygenic exposures

finding: The study reported a high prevalence of the homozygous single nucleotide variant rs7187376C/C of CDH11 in patients with autism spectrum disorder (ASD), indicating a potential association between this SNP and the disorder. Additional findings suggested that partial deletion of CDH11 was observed in a case of non-syndromic ASD, alongside mild intellectual disability and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), reinforcing the potential relevance of CDH11 variants in autism-related phenotypes.
title: Association of CDH11 with ASD revealed by matched-gene co-expression analysis and mouse behavioral studies

finding: This SNP involved a G to A allele change, which created a strong polyadenylation signal AATAAA from a weak motif GATAA. This alteration correlated with the use of a longer 3'UTR isoform of the gene SLC9A3R2.
title: Genetic Basis of Alternative Polyadenylation is an Emerging Molecular Phenotype for Human Traits and Diseases

finding: The study identified rs2280381 as a causal variant that regulated IRF8 expression through a cell-type-specific enhancer mechanism. It was shown that alleles of rs2280381 modulated PU.1 binding and chromatin state, influencing both AC092723.1 and IRF8 expression levels. This regulatory role linked rs2280381 to the pathogenesis of autoimmune diseases, particularly through its impact on DNA methylation and gene expression in monocytes.
title: CRISPRa screen on a genetic risk locus shared by multiple autoimmune diseases identifies a dysfunctional enhancer that affects IRF8 expression through cooperative lncRNA and DNA methylation machinery

finding: The G180R substitution in ATP-binding cassette transporter, sub-family C member 11, exhibited a high allele frequency of 75% in East Asian populations and was significantly correlated with axillary osmidrosis among Chinese Han populations, as well as an increased risk for breast cancer in Japanese women.
title: Peptide Ancestry Informative Markers in Uterine Neoplasms from Women of European, African and Asian Ancestry

finding: This SNP, associated with risk factors for Crohn's disease, revealed that the Picene group exhibited the highest frequency of the effective allele throughout the analyzed periods, outpacing all other contemporary Italian populations. This highlighted unique genetic characteristics within the Picenes amidst the wider genetic landscape.
title: The Genomic portrait of the Picene culture: new insights into the Italic Iron Age and the legacy of the Roman expansion in Central Italy

finding: The SNP rs1065656 was involved in a genetic regulatory mechanism where it served as a cis-eQTL associated with the FAHD1 gene and its relation to the NUBP2 gene. This relationship was significant as it contributed to circulating levels of insulin-like growth factor (IGF-I) and IGFBP-3 concentrations. The context revealed that this involvement was relevant to metabolic and aging pathways, particularly those associated with oxidative stress, indicating a genetic influence on these biological aging rates.
title: A decade of epigenetic change in aging twins: genetic and environmental contributions to longitudinal DNA methylation

finding: This variant was linked to the regulation of integrin genes ITGAL, ITGAX, and ITGAM, highlighting its role in lymphocyte activation.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: Associated with primary T cells where it regulated integrin genes ITGAL, ITGAX, and ITGAM, supporting the concept of emVars impacting immune function.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: Identified in Jurkat cells as another emVar regulating ITGAL, ITGAX, and ITGAM, emphasizing differential regulatory roles in T cell contexts.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: The SNP rs9939609 was identified as having a strong association with BMI, correlating with increased BMI levels as the number of minor alleles increased. This finding was consistent with established associations of SNPs within the FTO gene.
title: A Comprehensive Genome-wide and Phenome-wide Examination of BMI and Obesity in a Northern Nevadan Cohort

finding: The SNP rs1558902 within the FTO gene demonstrated a strong association with obesity during the GWAS, reporting a p-value of 1.67×10^-7.
title: A Comprehensive Genome-wide and Phenome-wide Examination of BMI and Obesity in a Northern Nevadan Cohort

finding: The SNP rs1421085 also located in the FTO gene was associated with obesity with a p-value of 1.75×10^-7, confirming the relevance of FTO in obesity susceptibility.
title: A Comprehensive Genome-wide and Phenome-wide Examination of BMI and Obesity in a Northern Nevadan Cohort

finding: The SNP rs2238368 was confirmed to skip the proximal active gene NPRL3 to activate alpha-globin genes in the context of H2BK20ac+ functional GWASs.
title: Mammalian enhancers and GWASs act proximally and seldom skip active genes

finding: The SNP rs11864973 was similarly confirmed to skip the proximal active gene NPRL3 to activate alpha-globin genes, aligning with the findings from H2BK20ac+ functional GWASs.
title: Mammalian enhancers and GWASs act proximally and seldom skip active genes

finding: The SNP rs12051315 was associated with defective DNA damage repair mechanisms in high-grade serous ovarian carcinoma, as discussed in the work of Milanesio et al. (2020). This finding highlighted the relevance of DNA repair defects in the clinical context of ovarian cancer, which aligns with the study's focus on the mechanisms behind the disease.
title: A Scalable 3D High-Content Imaging Protocol for Measuring a Drug Induced DNA Damage Response Using Immunofluorescent Sub-nuclear γH2AX Spots in Patient Derived Ovarian Cancer Organoids

finding: The FTO rs1421085 obesity-risk allele was found to suppress the expression of mitochondrial and thermogenesis genes in individuals carrying the CC genotype compared to risk-free TT alleles, highlighting its negative impact on thermogenic response in adipocytes.
title: Availability of abundant thiamine determines efficiency of thermogenic activation in human neck area derived adipocytes

finding: The variant rs1211375 was selected by the SPLENDID framework due to its strong individual-level effect on mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH). It exhibited allele frequencies above 20% across all ancestries, but had particularly strong effect sizes in individuals of African ancestry, highlighting its biological relevance and the need for considering effect heterogeneity across different populations.
title: SPLENDID incorporates continuous genetic ancestry in biobank-scale data to improve polygenic risk prediction across diverse populations

finding: The SNP rs7193541 was associated with the regulation of RFWD3 gene splicing, showing colocalization with a RFWD3 sQTL (PPH4=1.000) and an RFWD3 eQTL across multiple tissues. This supported the suggestion that splicing alterations at this locus may impact telomere length.
title: Validation of human telomere length trans-ancestry meta-analysis association signals identifies POP5 and KBTBD6 as novel human telomere length regulation genes

finding: The study highlighted rs4784220 as a key SNP in the TOX3 gene associated with breast cancer risk. The DOT method demonstrated high weight significance for this SNP, contributing to strong associations.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: In the analysis, rs8046979, although not originally highlighted, emerged as significant when weighted heavily in the DOT method for the TOX3 gene.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: The SNP rs43143 indicated new possible associations with breast cancer in the context of the TOX3 gene's LD block, identified through high weights in the DOT analysis.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: The SNP rs12103017 was found to influence the sensitivity of TNBC cells to chemotherapy, particularly in the context of BCL-xL expression. The study indicated a positive association between this SNP and the regulation of BCL-2 family proteins, suggesting that variations in this locus may impact tumor cell survival and chemotherapy resistance.
title: Cancer associated fibroblasts mitigate the efficacy of the combination of chemotherapy and BCL-xL targeting in triple negative breast cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs1558902, located in the FTO gene locus, was identified as exhibiting a significant gene-by-birth year interaction effect on Body Mass Index (BMI). This finding replicated earlier results which reported increasing penetrance of this variant over historical time. The analysis indicated that the observed GxE for this SNP was not attributable to a general modulation of variance, as evidenced by a highly significant genetic heteroscedasticity statistic (p = 5.1e-07).
title: Heteroscedastic regression modeling elucidates gene-by-environment interaction

finding: The SNP rs12102921 was positively associated with the epidemiology of Cutaneous T-Cell Lymphomas (CTCL), as reported in a systematic review and meta-analysis involving 16,953 patients. This finding suggested that the presence of this SNP could serve as a significant epidemiological marker for CTCL, potentially aiding in diagnosis and understanding disease progression.
title: Cutaneous T cell lymphoma atlas reveals malignant Th2 cells supported by a B cell-rich microenvironment

finding: The rs1143679 (R77H) variant in the ITGAM gene, associated with systemic lupus erythematosus, was found to impair the function of complement receptor 3 in human monocytes. This impairment was linked to changes in the allosteric coupling between ligand binding and integrin signaling, affecting the integrin receptor αMβ2.
title: Structure of the integrin receptor αMβ2 headpiece in complex with a function-modulating nanobody

finding: The RNA editing QTL rs7184655 was associated with the expression of RPL13, potentially mediated through an editing event in the gene's 3'-UTR. This regulation was connected to tau interactions, uncovering possible neurodegenerative disease implications.
title: Genetic control of RNA editing in Neurodegenerative disease

finding: rs35878298 was documented alongside a series of other QTLs, including those affecting RPL13 expression, pointing to collective genetic regulation involved in neurodegenerative mechanisms.
title: Genetic control of RNA editing in Neurodegenerative disease

finding: Associated with the expression modifications of genes like RPL13, this QTL contributed to the understanding of the interplay between RNA editing and neurodegenerative features.
title: Genetic control of RNA editing in Neurodegenerative disease

finding: This QTL was significant in the context of A-to-I RNA editing, underscoring its importance in the potential regulatory networks involved in neurodegenerative disease.
title: Genetic control of RNA editing in Neurodegenerative disease

finding: This variant was implicated in the genetic architecture influencing RNA editing events and associated phenotypes related to neurodegenerative disease, reinforcing its role within this biological framework.
title: Genetic control of RNA editing in Neurodegenerative disease

finding: The study identified the lead variant rs55872725 at the FTO locus, showing a significant change in its association with dietary intake, particularly with the percentage fat in milk. The effect size decreased from 0.0045 log units to 0.0015 log units after adjusting for health status, indicating that the association was primarily mediated through BMI rather than direct dietary choices. This finding highlighted that individuals with higher BMI were more likely to report consuming healthier diets.
title: Using genetics to disentangle the complex relationship between food choices and health status

finding: The SNP rs140124801 in the gene KCNG4 was found to be associated with reduced labor pain observed in women who were heterozygotes for this SNP. Specifically, the rare allele caused a mis-sense change p.Val419Met in K_V6.4, which was shown to have a dominant-negative effect on wild-type K_V6.4. This rare variant failed to traffic to the plasma membrane and did not modulate the voltage-dependence of K_V2.1 inactivation, leading to an increase in action potential conduction probability and a reduction in the pain experienced during labor.
title: Human labor pain is influenced by the voltage-gated potassium channel KV6.4 subunit

finding: Identified as a Tier 1 AFR_high anc-eQTL for the haptoglobin (HP) gene, it showed strong evidence of colocalization with total cholesterol levels (PP=0.997) in a subsequent analysis.
title: Gene expression in African Americans and Latinos reveals ancestry-specific patterns of genetic architecture

finding: This SNP exhibited a posterior probability indicating strong association with expression levels of the HP gene, and experimental data demonstrated reduced transcriptional activity within West African populations, indicating its role as a likely causal variant.
title: Gene expression in African Americans and Latinos reveals ancestry-specific patterns of genetic architecture

finding: The SNP was identified as functional due to its disruption of RARA or RXRA binding sites, which has implications for retinoid receptor activity in the context of MDD.
title: Transcriptional-Regulatory Convergence Across Functional MDD Risk Variants Identified by Massively Parallel Reporter Assays

finding: The study highlighted the role of the FTO SNP (rs9939609 A allele) in individuals with obesity. It was found that participants who were homozygous for the 'obesity risk' allele showed a positive correlation between anticipatory reward responses and fasting acyl-ghrelin levels, while negatively correlating with satiated levels. In contrast, individuals without the risk allele exhibited the opposite correlation, suggesting significant interaction between this SNP and reward processing in the context of obesity.
title: How gut hormones shape reward: a systematic review of the role of ghrelin and GLP-1 in human fMRI

finding: The study provided evidence that individuals homozygous for the fat mass and obesity associated gene (FTO) at SNP rs9939609 (A allele) exhibited positive correlations between anticipatory responses and fasting levels of acyl-ghrelin. In contrast, those without the risk allele showed an opposite correlation, indicating that the presence of the obesity risk gene influenced reward responses related to ghrelin levels.
title: How gut hormones shape reward: a systematic review of the role of ghrelin and GLP-1 in human fMRI

finding: The SNP rs14235 was first linked to Parkinson's disease through the identification of a risk signal on chromosome 16. Subsequent expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) analysis indicated that the risk allele associated with this SNP resulted in lower levels of KAT8 mRNA. Further genome-wide association studies (GWAS) reiterated the significance of KAT8 as a candidate gene for Parkinson's disease, with colocalization and transcriptome-wide analyses providing additional evidence for its contribution to the disease.
title: The chromatin modulating NSL complex regulates genes and pathways genetically linked to Parkinson’s disease

finding: Associated with eGFR, this variant (P = 5.2×10^-4) was related to kidney function in both diabetic and non-diabetic populations, reinforcing its relevance to renal traits.
title: Genome-wide association study of diabetic kidney disease highlights biology involved in renal basement membrane collagen

finding: The variant rs11075995 was associated with increased variability in expression of four genes involved in the C21-steroidal biosynthesis pathway, which is crucial for converting cholesterol to hormones, including oestrogen. This SNP, located in the intron of the FTO gene, was tied to ER negative breast cancer risk and showed evidence of an epi-transcriptomic mechanism influencing the dysregulation of hormonal pathways that potentially heightens breast cancer risk.
title: Variable expression quantitative trait loci analysis of breast cancer risk variants

finding: The SNP rs1052429-A was identified as an OA risk allele, showing higher expression of WWP2 relative to rs1052429-G. This SNP was associated with increased expression of hypoxia-associated genes like EPAS1 and GDF10, while decreasing anabolic markers, COL2A1 and ACAN.
title: WWP2 osteoarthritis risk allele rs1052429-A confers risk by affecting cartilage matrix deposition via hypoxia associated genes

finding: The SNP rs34195470 was reported in a large genome-wide association study as an OA risk SNP. It was associated with higher expression levels of WWP2, acting as a proxy for the allelic imbalance observed in rs1052429.
title: WWP2 osteoarthritis risk allele rs1052429-A confers risk by affecting cartilage matrix deposition via hypoxia associated genes

finding: The SNP rs4985453-G was noted as a proxy for the identified OA risk allele rs34195470-G and exhibited associations with lower expression levels of WWP2, contradicting the findings observed with rs1052429.
title: WWP2 osteoarthritis risk allele rs1052429-A confers risk by affecting cartilage matrix deposition via hypoxia associated genes

finding: The SNP rs6498540 was employed as an instrumental variable for dihomo-linolenate (DGLA) to explore its causal relationship with BMI. Similar to rs174556 and rs968567, the use of rs6498540 as an IV hinged on prior knowledge from investigations into its association with BMI, despite the potential concerns regarding horizontal pleiotropy.
title: Bayesian network analysis complements Mendelian randomization approaches for exploratory analysis of causal relationships in complex data

finding: The rs3816117 variant was identified as the most significant interaction QTL for the percentage of triglycerides in large VLDL (L_VLDL_TG_pct) and was annotated as a modifier variant for cholesteryl ester transfer protein (CETP). Although this variant was replicated as a significant mQTL for L_VLDL_TG_pct in the overall UK Biobank cohort, it was not associated with T2D risk in the latest T2D GWAS meta-analysis, indicating that the relationship is similarly a consequence of T2D.
title: Insights into the metabolic consequences of type 2 diabetes

finding: It achieved the highest score among all variants in the risk locus, including GWAS SNP rs2018916.
title: WEVar: a novel statistical learning framework for predicting noncoding regulatory variants

finding: The SNP rs439967 was identified in a genome-wide association study, where it loosely associated with type 2 diabetes in a European population, showing a significance level of p=2 x 10-6. This indicated that genetic variants of ASRA might influence metabolic processes related to type 2 diabetes.
title: A brown fat-enriched adipokine, ASRA, is a leptin receptor antagonist that stimulates appetite

finding: The SNP rs11117427 was also featured in the findings related to MS and CD, further solidifying the genetic connection between multiple sclerosis and Crohn's disease.
title: Investigating the shared genetic architecture between multiple sclerosis and inflammatory bowel diseases

finding: The SNP rs1554999, located in the 5'UTR of IL32, exhibited an increasing effect on the dispersion level in multiple cell types, including naive and effective CD4 and CD8 cells, and was noted for its association with methylation levels.
title: Genetic variants associated with cell-type-specific intra-individual gene expression variability reveal new mechanisms of genome regulation

finding: The rs9923231 variant (c.-1639G>A) was associated with warfarin sensitivity, being very common in East Asian populations (89.95%) and less common in African populations (10.09%). This finding was significant in understanding the genetic factors affecting anticoagulation therapy in different racial groups.
title: Potential impact on coagulopathy of gene variants of coagulation related proteins that interact with SARS-CoV-2

finding: This SNP was identified to be associated with two traits in opposite directions, marking it as significant for understanding multi-trait genetic interactions.
title: Multivariate Genomewide Association Analysis with IHT

finding: The SNP rs12102760 was identified as significantly associated with cancer-related phenotypes. Specifically, it was implicated in the regulation of intracellular pH (pHi) dynamics, suggesting that genetic variations at this locus could influence cellular behaviors linked to cancer progression, such as cell polarization and migration. Given the context of pHi's role in membrane ruffling and dynamics, rs12102760 may affect how cells respond to physiological pH changes during oncogenic processes.
title: An optogenetic tool to raise intracellular pH in single cells and drive localized membrane dynamics

finding: This SNP, along with rs8062685 and rs9932282, was associated with the promoters of the genes PIG-Q, NHLRC4, and NME4, reinforcing its significance in the context of insomnia as these genes were implicated in sleep regulation.
title: Variant-to-gene-mapping followed by cross-species genetic screening identifies GPI-anchor biosynthesis as novel regulator of sleep

finding: Similar to rs3752495, rs8062685 was involved in looping interactions with PIG-Q, NHLRC4, and NME4, highlighting its role in the genetic architecture linked to sleep traits.
title: Variant-to-gene-mapping followed by cross-species genetic screening identifies GPI-anchor biosynthesis as novel regulator of sleep

finding: This SNP was also part of the significant chromatin loops that connected to the promoters of PIG-Q, NHLRC4, and NME4, and was indicative of its relevance in the genetic basis of sleep regulation.
title: Variant-to-gene-mapping followed by cross-species genetic screening identifies GPI-anchor biosynthesis as novel regulator of sleep

finding: The SNP rs4527034 was shown to be an eQTL regulating the KAT8 gene. The reference allele A was linked to lower expression of KAT8 under control conditions. In the presence of caffeine, TERF2IP, the transcription factor regulated by this SNP, was upregulated, leading to unexpected lower expression of KAT8 and affecting hypertension risk. Thus, this SNP displayed a complex interaction with caffeine that influenced gene expression and disease risk.
title: Characterization of caffeine response regulatory variants in vascular endothelial cells

finding: The variant rs2280381 was previously identified as being associated with Lupus disease. It was shown to lie 300bp downstream of the long noncoding RNA LNCRMP. Mechanistic studies indicated that this variant impacted the expression of both IRF8 and LNCRMP by modulating the binding of the transcription factor PU.1, thus suggesting its critical role in the regulation of monocyte proliferation and the underlying mechanisms of Lupus pathology.
title: CRISPRi Screen Uncovers lncRNA Regulators of Human Monocyte Growth

finding: The rs150745099 SNP corresponds to the human IFT140(G704S) variant, which was functionally analyzed in conjunction with the C. elegans IFT-140(G680S) MatchVar. The study suggested that the G704S variant had not been implicated in any IFT140-related disease, but the functional analysis of the corresponding C. elegans variant provided insights into the genetic implications.
title: Matching Variants for functional characterization of genetic variants

finding: The SNP rs1057518064 is associated with the human IFT140(P726A) variant. The research demonstrated that the C. elegans IFT-140(P702A) variant phenocopied ciliary dysfunction, offering experimental support that the P726A variant in humans might be pathogenic despite previously lacking functional evidence. This provided new insights into the variant's clinical significance.
title: Matching Variants for functional characterization of genetic variants

finding: This synonymous SNP in <italic>DHX38</italic> mediated significant effects on endothelial phenotypes such as E-selectin and VCAM1 during CRISPR screens.
title: CRISPR perturbations at many coronary artery disease loci impair vascular endothelial cell functions

finding: Similar to rs2074626, this synonymous SNP in <italic>DHX38</italic> also influenced endothelial phenotypes in the CRISPR screens.
title: CRISPR perturbations at many coronary artery disease loci impair vascular endothelial cell functions

finding: Similarly, the rs28418438 SNP matched the ZFX binding motif and was identified as an eQTL in the heart according to GTEx data, suggesting it plays a role in the regulatory mechanisms governing mitochondrial activity and angiogenesis.
title: Statistical framework for calling allelic imbalance in high-throughput sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs7196032 was identified with a significant p-value of 1.1e-4, marking it as an eQTL for the gene COG4, which is involved in the structure and function of the Golgi apparatus. This was a novel finding from the T-GEN method.
title: Leveraging tissue specific gene expression regulation to identify genes associated with complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs7192890 was identified with a significant p-value of 3.5e-3 as an eQTL for the gene COG4, making it another novel finding specifically associated with late-onset Alzheimer's disease.
title: Leveraging tissue specific gene expression regulation to identify genes associated with complex diseases

finding: At the ZFPM1 locus, the fpQTL rs55823018 was identified as the most significant SNP influencing TF binding. This SNP enhanced RXRA binding and resided within a ChIP-seq peak, suggesting its causal role in lipid regulation by affecting the strength of the NR1H4::RXRA motif.
title: Characterization of non-coding variants associated with transcription factor binding through ATAC-seq-defined footprint QTLs in liver

finding: The SNP rs12102913 was linked to oncogenic mutations in MYD88 and CD79B in diffuse large B-cell lymphoma. This finding indicated that the presence of this SNP may have implications for the clinical management of patients with lymphoma, especially regarding therapeutic strategies.
title: Metadichol an agonist that expresses the entire Toll Like Receptor family in various Cancer Cell Lines and its potential Impact on Cancer Treatment

finding: The SNP rs200517050, located in the upstream SHISA9 gene, was associated with decreased levels of the NOMO1 protein (β = -0.462, σ = 0.0855, p = 1.01×10<sup>-7</sup>). This finding was significant and indicated that this SNP could influence the protein levels of the closely related NOMO genes.
title: Population-wide copy number variation calling using variant call format files from 6,898 individuals

finding: The SNP rs3891245, which is located in the intronic region of the NOMO3 gene, showed a strong association with decreased NOMO1 protein levels (β = -0.371, σ = 0.0476, p = 5.12×10<sup>-14</sup>). This indicates that variations in the NOMO3 gene may independently affect circulating levels of the NOMO proteins, separate from the effects of the NOMO1 deletion.
title: Population-wide copy number variation calling using variant call format files from 6,898 individuals

finding: This SNP was linked to the efficient propagation of circulating tumor cells, representing a crucial first step for probing tumor metastasis.
title: Propagated circulating tumor cells uncovers the role of NFκB and COP1 in metastasis

finding: The SNP rs17822931 in the ABCC11 gene was associated with the phenotype of dry ear wax. The analysis revealed that Jomon-derived haplotypes included both ancestral and derived alleles, with frequencies of 10.6% for the ancestral allele (wet ear wax) and 24% for the derived allele (dry ear wax) in mainland Japanese.
title: Comprehensive analysis of Japanese population history by detecting ancestry-marker polymorphisms without using ancestral genomic information

finding: SIA detected a moderate signal of selection at the MC1R locus with a selection probability of 0.95 and a selection coefficient approximately equal to 0.0037, highlighting its importance in pigmentation.
title: SIA: Selection Inference Using the Ancestral Recombination Graph

finding: SIA identified a weak signal of selection at the ABCC11 locus with a selection coefficient of around 0.00035, which influences earwax and sweat production.
title: SIA: Selection Inference Using the Ancestral Recombination Graph

finding: The SNP rs3865188 in CDH13 was examined for its impacts on adiponectin levels, indicating metabolic regulation related to diabetes conditions.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The SNP rs12051065 was associated with the inhibition of the TCF11/Nrf1-mediated proteasome recovery pathway in the context of multiple myeloma. This finding highlighted its role in the regulation of proteasome activity, linking it to the pathological processes within this cancer.
title: The Aspartyl Protease Ddi1 Is Essential for Erythrocyte Invasion by the Malaria Parasite

finding: The SNP rs12102913 was associated with oncogenic mutations in MYD88, which were studied in the context of diffuse large B-cell lymphoma. This finding underscored the clinical implications of such mutations in cancer pathology and treatment strategies.
title: Metadichol, a modulator that controls expression of Toll Like Receptors in Cancer Cell Lines

finding: The SNP rs8050061 was characterized as a distal transcription initiation quantitative trait locus (diQTL), which had a localized impact on transcription initiation at a specific nucleotide. This influence was attributed to a disruption of an initiator motif overlapping the SNP position, demonstrating its critical role in modulating transcription initiation.
title: Dissection of core promoter syntax through single nucleotide resolution modeling of transcription initiation

finding: The SNP rs17822931, associated with dry earwax, was homozygous in most of the analyzed individuals. Its presence indicated that this trait was already established in the Korean population during the Three Kingdoms period, reflecting genetic continuity with modern Koreans.
title: Diverse northern Asian and Jomon-related genetic structure discovered among socially complex Three Kingdoms period Gaya region Koreans

finding: The rs72824905 variant, also denoted as PLCG2-P522R, was recognized for its role in reducing the risk of late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD). This rare gain-of-function variant not only decreased the risk for LOAD but also exhibited protective effects against dementia with Lewy bodies and frontotemporal dementia. Importantly, carriers of this variant were significantly represented among individuals over 100 years old who maintained well-preserved cognitive functions. Furthermore, it was noted to slow cognitive decline in patients with mild cognitive impairment, indicating its broadly favorable influence on cognition and brain health during aging.
title: Protective variant in PLCγ2 mitigates Alzheimer’s disease-associated pathologies via enhancing beneficial microglia functions

finding: The SNP rs12051201 was associated with the expression of the mTOR pathway and was suggested as a potential predictive biomarker for patients with advanced neuroendocrine tumors treated with Everolimus. This finding provided insights into patient stratification for therapy in the context of pancreatic neuroendocrine neoplasms (PanNENs), particularly in relation to their response to mTOR inhibiting treatments.
title: An Integrative Genetic, Epigenetic and Proteomic Characterization of Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Neoplasms (PanNENs) defines Distinct Molecular Features of α- and β-cell like Subgroups

finding: SNP rs7499892 was identified as equivalent to SNP rs1800961 with respect to effect size when the final model was adjusted in the analysis for HDL.
title: Iterative Hard Thresholding in GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: SNP rs3764261 was also identified as a significant predictor for HDL in the dichotomized analysis.
title: Iterative Hard Thresholding in GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: The SNP rs6500945 was associated with the RBFOX1 locus, another strong contender among high-priority ADHD candidate genes in the PGC-iPSYCH GWAS meta-analysis. This association underscored the relevance of genetic factors in ADHD, with RBFOX1 positioned as a significant candidate gene in relation to the disorder.
title: From rare Copy Number Variations to biological processes in ADHD

finding: The SNP rs289708 exhibited a significant association with HDL levels in the Samoan population with <italic>P</italic><sub>D</sub> = 1.19 × 10<sup>−11</sup>. This finding was part of the known genetic architecture shared across populations.
title: Genome-wide association studies in Samoans give insight into the genetic architecture of fasting serum lipid levels.

finding: This SNP was part of a hypomorphic allele associated with congenital scoliosis (CS) phenotype, contributing to the risk of CS by reducing gene expression.
title: Human iPSC-derived neuron of 16p11.2 deletion reveals haplotype-specific expression of MAPK3 and its contribution to variable NDD phenotypes

finding: This SNP was included in the defined hypomorphic alleles linked to congenital scoliosis, indicating its role in modifying the risk of the disease.
title: Human iPSC-derived neuron of 16p11.2 deletion reveals haplotype-specific expression of MAPK3 and its contribution to variable NDD phenotypes

finding: This SNP was identified as part of the hypomorphic TBX6 alleles, which are linked with increased risk of congenital scoliosis.
title: Human iPSC-derived neuron of 16p11.2 deletion reveals haplotype-specific expression of MAPK3 and its contribution to variable NDD phenotypes

finding: This SNP was functionally validated in enhancer assays, showing its involvement in regulating MAPK3 expression via a haplotype-specific enhancer mechanism.
title: Human iPSC-derived neuron of 16p11.2 deletion reveals haplotype-specific expression of MAPK3 and its contribution to variable NDD phenotypes

finding: In luciferase assays, this SNP contributed to variation in enhancer activity, thereby influencing the expression of MAPK3 in neurons.
title: Human iPSC-derived neuron of 16p11.2 deletion reveals haplotype-specific expression of MAPK3 and its contribution to variable NDD phenotypes

finding: This SNP was functionally validated as an enhancer SNP that regulates MAPK3 expression, with significant changes in luciferase activity based on allele variation.
title: Human iPSC-derived neuron of 16p11.2 deletion reveals haplotype-specific expression of MAPK3 and its contribution to variable NDD phenotypes

finding: This SNP was previously reported to regulate MAPK3 and was validated in this study as a determinant of luciferase activity, influencing schizophrenia risk.
title: Human iPSC-derived neuron of 16p11.2 deletion reveals haplotype-specific expression of MAPK3 and its contribution to variable NDD phenotypes

finding: Functionally characterized as an enhancer SNP that impacts MAPK3 expression in luciferase assays, showing significant allele-dependent differences in promoter activity.
title: Human iPSC-derived neuron of 16p11.2 deletion reveals haplotype-specific expression of MAPK3 and its contribution to variable NDD phenotypes

finding: Validated as an enhancer SNP associated with altered regulatory activity of enhancers involved in MAPK3 expression, confirmed through functional assays.
title: Human iPSC-derived neuron of 16p11.2 deletion reveals haplotype-specific expression of MAPK3 and its contribution to variable NDD phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs12051230 was associated with obesity’s impact on the immune system's role in cancer risk and immunotherapy response. In the context of PD-1 expression by macrophages, it was found that this SNP likely contributed to modifications in the metabolic signaling pathways that mediate PD-1's suppressive effects on tumor-associated macrophages (TAM). The findings indicated that the presence of rs12051230 might influence macrophage function and contribute to the enhanced responses to immune checkpoint blockade in TAM-enriched tumors.
title: PD-1 is induced on tumor-associated macrophages in obesity to directly restrain anti-tumor immunity

finding: Found adjacent to the SULT1A2 gene, the SNP rs4149398 was linked to creativity and associated with autism spectrum disorder (ASD), thereby reflecting the shared genetic factors connecting creativity and various psychiatric conditions.
title: Genetic architecture of creativity and extensive genetic overlap with psychiatric disorders revealed from genome-wide association analyses of 241,736 individuals

finding: Identified in a 2018 GWAS, this SNP was reported as a new risk locus for Alzheimer's disease along with linked gene PLCG2.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: This SNP was also determined as a new risk locus linked with the gene IL34 in the 2018 GWAS focusing on Alzheimer's disease.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: The study reported a significant frequency of NOD2 SNP rs2066843 in CD-PDOs when compared to healthy controls, indicating its potential role in Crohn's disease pathology.
title: A Living Organoid Biobank of Crohn’s Disease Patients Reveals Molecular Subtypes for Personalized Therapeutics

finding: The frequency of NOD2 SNP rs2076756 was also significantly higher in CD-PDOs relative to healthy controls, suggesting its involvement in the genetic susceptibility to Crohn's disease.
title: A Living Organoid Biobank of Crohn’s Disease Patients Reveals Molecular Subtypes for Personalized Therapeutics

finding: Variant rs145650870 was found to be an activity-increasing variant in the ASD risk locus 16p11.2, where it created a transcription factor binding site for EHF, affecting the regulation of nearby genes, including TUFM, ATXN2L, and SH2B1.
title: Massively parallel characterization of psychiatric disorder-associated and cell-type-specific regulatory elements in the developing human cortex

finding: The SNP rs12102910 was associated with the sphingolipid pathway, which was identified as a source of vulnerability in IDH1<sup>mut</sup> gliomas. This study highlighted that manipulating sphingolipid levels could affect cholesterol homeostasis in brain tumors, thereby establishing a relationship between the rs12102910 variant and the biological implications of sphingolipid metabolism in IDH1<sup>mut</sup> glioma context.
title: Targeting the sphingolipid rheostat in IDH1mut glioma alters cholesterol homeostasis and triggers apoptosis via membrane degradation

finding: The SNP rs55872725 at the FTO locus was significantly associated with the percentage of fat in milk. Its effect size reduced three-fold from 0.0045 to 0.0015 log units after correcting for health status, demonstrating that the initial association was primarily mediated through BMI. This finding suggested that higher BMI might lead to healthier dietary choices, rather than the reverse, highlighting biases in dietary assessments.
title: Using genetics to disentangle the complex relationship between food choices and health status

finding: The SNP rs2541645 was identified as a significant shared causal variant for the <italic>HBZ</italic> pGene across European American (EA) and African American (AA) populations. It was noted as the most significantly associated <italic>cis</italic>-pQTL for <italic>HBZ</italic> in AA, with a p-value indicating strong association in GTEx V8 for <italic>HBZ</italic> expression. Moreover, it showed associations with erythrocyte-related outcomes, such as mean corpuscular hemoglobin and reticulocyte fraction in the UK Biobank, suggesting its potential role as a regulatory variant affecting <italic>HBZ</italic> protein levels. These findings implied a need for further investigation into its phenotypic consequences, particularly regarding blood-related conditions and thalassemia.
title: Large Bi-Ethnic Study of Plasma Proteome Leads to Comprehensive Mapping of cis-pQTL and Models for Proteome-wide Association Studies

finding: The SNP rs12102824 was positively associated with the recognition of glycan neoantigens, particularly tumor-associated carbohydrate antigen CA19-9, by antibodies. This finding related to the improvements in antibody affinity through mutations in the context of cancer-related glycosylation, enhancing the clinical potential of therapeutic antibodies.
title: Biomolecular recognition of the glycan neoantigen CA19-9 by distinct antibodies

finding: The SNP rs62053262 was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the gene WWP2 in the aorta. The G allele of rs62053262 was associated with reduced expression of WWP2 and was correlated with smaller aortic size. This finding was significant in the context of understanding the genetic basis for aortic dimensions, particularly in relation to the ascending and descending aorta. WWP2, as an E3 ubiquitin ligase for PTEN, was shown to influence cardiac fibrosis via modulation of SMAD signaling, thus highlighting its potential role in aortic health.
title: Deep learning enables genetic analysis of the human thoracic aorta

finding: The SNP rs8050061 was classified as a diQTL that had a localized impact on transcription initiation at a specific nucleotide. This effect was accurately predicted by CLIPNET and was explained by the disruption of an initiator motif that overlapped the affected position.
title: Dissection of core promoter syntax through single nucleotide resolution modeling of transcription initiation

finding: At the MC1R locus, SIA detected a moderate signal of selection at rs1805007, with a sweep probability of 0.95 and a selection coefficient approximately equal to 0.0037, indicating positive selection related to pigmentation.
title: SIA: Selection Inference Using the Ancestral Recombination Graph

finding: At the ABCC11 gene, SIA identified a weak signal of selection at rs17822931, which influences earwax and sweat production, with a selection coefficient of approximately 0.00035.
title: SIA: Selection Inference Using the Ancestral Recombination Graph

finding: The SNP rs2228479 in the MCIR gene displayed significant divergence between Eurasians and Africans, indicating it underwent directional selection. The derived allele was associated with a lower affinity for alpha-melanocyte stimulating hormone, influencing pigmentation phenotypes.
title: Dissecting dynamics and differences of selective pressures in the evolution of human pigmentation

finding: The SNP rs885479, also in the MCIR gene, showed a significant selection difference between populations and was linked to a lower risk of developing freckles and solar lentigines in East Asians.
title: Dissecting dynamics and differences of selective pressures in the evolution of human pigmentation

finding: This noncoding variant was associated with elevated HbA1c levels in South Asians and potentially influences diabetes assessment due to its erythrocytic pathway involvement.
title: Analyses of Biomarker Traits in Diverse UK Biobank Participants Identify Associations Missed by European-centric Analysis Strategies

finding: This missense variant in PIEZ01 was also found to have a significant association with HbA1c, reflecting its pathophysiological relevance to glycemic control.
title: Analyses of Biomarker Traits in Diverse UK Biobank Participants Identify Associations Missed by European-centric Analysis Strategies

finding: The SNP rs12051258 was reported as a positive and original finding in a study that evaluated the feasibility of targeting Traf2-and-Nck-Interacting Kinase in Synovial Sarcoma. This study, published by Sekita et al. in 2020, highlighted the potential therapeutic implications of this pathway in cancer, contributing insights that could be relevant in understanding similar pathways in neurodegenerative diseases such as ALS.
title: A deep-learning-based screening platform in aging-relevant human motor neurons to identify therapeutic compounds for amyotrophic lateral sclerosis

finding: At the FTO locus, the intronic variant rs1421085 demonstrated significant non-linear effect sizes across 54 traits, particularly related to obesity metrics such as BMI. The findings indicated differing effect sizes between the addition of the first and second C alleles, with notable increases in weight associated with each transition from homozygous TT to heterozygous TC and then to homozygous CC, revealing an increase of 0.77 kg and 1.31 kg respectively.
title: Dispensing with unnecessary assumptions in population genetics analysis

finding: Found to have significant interaction with rs1129038, supporting its involvement in skin color phenotype, underscoring the correlation between skin and hair color traits.
title: Dispensing with unnecessary assumptions in population genetics analysis

finding: Identified alongside rs117119427 in significant interactions associated with skin color, demonstrating its relevance in the genetic architecture influencing pigmentation.
title: Dispensing with unnecessary assumptions in population genetics analysis

finding: Significant involvement in epistatic interactions related to skin color was attributed to this variant when analyzed through the TarGene framework, highlighting its importance in genetic correlations with pigmentation.
title: Dispensing with unnecessary assumptions in population genetics analysis

finding: The SNP rs11642015 from the FTO gene was positively associated with increased body mass index (BMI), reflecting the selection of traits that might have conferred advantages in energy storage and usage in the colder climate faced by the Jomon people.
title: Cold adaptation in Upper Paleolithic hunter-gatherers of eastern Eurasia

finding: The rs1421085 SNP within the FTO gene was positively selected in the Jomon ancestry, correlating with enhanced thermogenesis via increased FTO expression, thereby facilitating adaptation to colder environments.
title: Cold adaptation in Upper Paleolithic hunter-gatherers of eastern Eurasia

finding: The lead variant for the FTO gene, rs55872725, was associated with milk fat percentage, exhibiting an extremely significant p-value of 2×10⁻²⁹. However, after correcting for the indirect effects mediated by health determinants, the effect size of this SNP on milk fat percentage decreased three-fold, indicating the potential confounding influence of health factors on dietary phenotypes.
title: Using genetic variation to disentangle the complex relationship between food intake and health outcomes

finding: The SNP rs1555468634 was associated with the juvenile CLN3 disease, accounting for over 70% of patients being homozygous for a '1-kb' intragenic deletion. This deletion results in the loss of coding exons 7 and 8 of the CLN3 canonical transcript, leading to the identification of both 'major' and 'minor' transcripts from the affected allele. The 'major' transcript generates a premature stop codon, while the 'minor' transcript maintains the reading frame, suggesting potential differing functionalities of these transcripts in disease pathology.
title: CLN3 transcript complexity revealed by long-read RNA sequencing analysis

finding: In the KARE study conducted among Korean men, an association was found between the CDH13 gene SNP rs3865188 and levels of adiponectin, impacted by factors such as smoking and obesity.
title: Study on potential differentially expressed genes in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis by bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: This SNP was recognized for its association with obesity-related anthropometric traits, and it was part of 83 SNPs associated with cognitive abilities and educational attainment.
title: Comprehensive genomic analysis of dietary habits in UK Biobank identifies hundreds of genetic loci and establishes causal relationships between educational attainment and healthy eating

finding: The SNP rs3748393 was associated with the C16Orf95 gene repression in testis, with the alternative A allele leading to decreased G-quadruplex (G4) activity. This SNP altered the G4 structure stability due to its position within a G4 motif. Therefore, it represented a mechanism by which genetic variation could influence gene expression by affecting G4 function.
title: DeepG4 : A deep learning approach to predict active G-quadruplexes from DNA

finding: The intronic variant rs12925026 in the gene ZNF276 was associated at genome-wide significance with non-melanoma skin cancer, suggesting its potential role as a candidate tumor suppressor gene in breast cancer.
title: Pleiotropy-guided transcriptome imputation from normal and tumor tissues identifies new candidate susceptibility genes for breast and ovarian cancer

finding: The investigation by Samaan et al. (2013) found that the rs9939609 A variant, which is associated with obesity, exhibited a protective effect against depression. This finding indicated that individuals carrying this variant may have a reduced risk of developing depressive symptoms in comparison to those without the variant. The study underscored the relationship between genetic variants related to obesity and their implications for mental health conditions.
title: Effect of RNA m6A methyltransferase activation by a low molecular weight compound on anxiety- and depression-related behaviours, monoamine neurochemistry and striatal gene expression in the rat

finding: The SNP rs12103023 was associated with variations in NRF2 signaling pathways essential for managing oxidative stress and metabolic processes. In the context of the study by DeBlasi et al. (2020), significant findings related to NRF2 indicated its crucial role in the antioxidant response system, impacting mitochondrial function and cellular dynamics, particularly in conditions where glucose was the primary energy substrate.
title: Differential effects of diphenyl diselenide (PhSe)2 on mitochondria-related pathways depending on the cellular energy status in Bovine Vascular Endothelial Cells

finding: The rs1421085 obesity-risk allele was associated with suppressed expression of mitochondrial and thermogenesis genes in individuals with obesity. Studies showed that individuals carrying the FTO rs1421085 CC allele exhibited lower ThTr2 expression in neck fat-derived adipocytes compared to those with the healthy TT alleles, indicating a significant correlation between this SNP and thiamine transport in relation to thermogenesis.
title: Availability of abundant thiamine determines efficiency of thermogenic activation in human neck area derived adipocytes

finding: It was most strongly associated with risk of luminal-like subtypes (OR 1.28, p=6.68×10^-176) and with HER2-enriched-like tumors; showed weaker association with TN disease.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: The SNP rs61752717 (Met694Val in MEFV) was associated with Familial Mediterranean fever, particularly relevant to the diabetic subjects in the study.
title: Complete genome sequence and analysis of nine Egyptian females with clinical information from different geographic regions in Egypt

finding: The SNP rs12102910 was associated with the sphingolipid pathway, identified as a source of vulnerability in IDH1(mut) glioma. This finding suggested that variations in this SNP could influence tumor progression and response to therapies, correlating its significance in glioma pathology.
title: SMPD3 suppresses IDH mutant tumor growth via dual autocrine-paracrine roles

finding: The SNP rs12051232 was explored within the context of communication in the cancer microenvironment, highlighting its potential as a target for therapeutic interventions in glioma treatment. This correlation indicated that genetic variants at this locus could impact tumor behavior and patient treatment outcomes.
title: SMPD3 suppresses IDH mutant tumor growth via dual autocrine-paracrine roles

finding: The SNP rs12051341 was associated with small molecule KRAS inhibitors which are being explored as targeted therapies for pancreatic cancer. This finding was derived from research discussing the implications of such inhibitors in cancer treatment, highlighting potential therapeutic targets in KRAS-related pathways.
title: Single Cell Proteomics Using a Trapped Ion Mobility Time-of-Flight Mass Spectrometer Provides Insight into the Post-translational Modification Landscape of Individual Human Cells

finding: Showed high confidence of being causally associated with both mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration (MCHC) and several immature red cell traits through joint fine-mapping, validated by UK Biobank data.
title: Improved genetic discovery and fine-mapping resolution through multivariate latent factor analysis of high-dimensional traits

finding: The SNP rs12051307 demonstrated a positive correlation with fibroblast heterogeneity in breast cancer as per the findings of Sebastian et al. This study revealed that variations at this locus affected the immune response and ECM properties in breast cancer-associated fibroblasts.
title: In vitro-generated inflammatory fibroblasts secrete extracellular matrix with biochemical and biophysical properties similar to tissue-remodelling fibroblasts

finding: The SNP rs12051347 was highlighted in the context of pancreatic cancer where it showed association with cancer-associated fibroblast characteristics, thus contributing to the understanding of the tumor microenvironment as reported by Norton et al.
title: In vitro-generated inflammatory fibroblasts secrete extracellular matrix with biochemical and biophysical properties similar to tissue-remodelling fibroblasts

finding: The variant rs2280381 was identified in a monocyte-specific enhancer and was found to be associated with the overexpression of the IRF8 gene in monocytes. In patients with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), the risk allele T was shown to underexpress the IRF8 gene. This finding suggested that rs2280381 could significantly affect the differentiation of tolerogenic dendritic cells (tolDC), which was highlighted as essential for tolDC differentiation.
title: Logical model of human tolerogenic dendritic cells and their participation in autoimmune disease

finding: The SNP rs12051468, related to the mHA WEHGPTSLL from the gene CRISPLD2, demonstrated an association with decreased leukemia-free survival, indicated by an HR of 1.94 and a 95% CI of [1.27, 2.95], with a P-value of 0.044 in recipients with HLA-B*40:01.
title: Associations of Minor Histocompatibility Antigens with Clinical Outcomes Following Allogeneic Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation

finding: Identified with a very high posterior probability as a causal variant related to height.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: The rs75446625-tagged CRE showed significant regulatory activity affecting the expression of NUDT7, confirmed via CRISPR perturbations and validated through RT-qPCR.
title: Endogenous fine-mapping of functional regulatory elements in complex genetic loci

finding: The rs80159064 SNP also modulated NUDT7 expression, despite lacking classical epigenetic markers, indicating its regulatory potential as validated through CRISPR screenings.
title: Endogenous fine-mapping of functional regulatory elements in complex genetic loci

finding: The SNP rs1805007 in the MC1R gene was significantly associated with self-perceived facial aging, with carriers of alleles responsible for lower pigmentation being more likely to report looking older than their actual age (p-value=E-6).
title: Biological insights from self-perceived facial aging data of the UKBB participants

finding: The rs72824905 variant, also described as P522R in the PLCG2 gene, was recognized for decreasing the risk of developing late-onset Alzheimer's disease. Further studies confirmed it was associated with other dementias and increased longevity, reinforcing the importance of PLCG2 in neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Uncoupling of synaptic loss from amyloid burden by an Alzheimer’s disease protective variant of PLCγ2

finding: In a Western Siberian population, the G allele of rs708272 was associated with lower levels of high-density lipoprotein cholesterol and a higher index of atherogenicity, suggesting its involvement in the development of MI.
title: In-silico analysis of Myocardial Infarction-related missense SNPs to identify novel biomarkers to predict susceptibility

finding: The FTO rs1421085 T-to-C SNP was associated with upregulation of EN1 gene expression in the obesity-prone phenotype of human adipocytes.
