This discovery indicated a potentially diverse and species-specific role for EN1 in regulating UCP1 expression, thereby linking it to metabolic processes related to thermogenesis.
title: Deciphering Species-Specific and Conserved Regulation of Human UCP1 Gene Expression: Insights from Predicted Homeodomain Family Transcription Factor Binding Sites

finding: The CETP polymorphism rs1800775 (629A) was associated with a reduced CETP lipid transfer activity by 21-51% compared to wild type CETP. This polymorphism was linked to a lower risk of developing Alzheimer’s disease in patients expressing the apolipoprotein E isoform 4 (APOE4). The APOE4 allele is recognized as the greatest known genetic risk factor for late-onset Alzheimer’s disease.
title: CETP inhibitor evacetrapib enters mouse brain tissue

finding: The CETP polymorphism rs5882 (I405V) correlated with lower CETP protein expression and higher HDL-C levels. It was significantly associated with exceptional longevity and healthy aging specifically in the Ashkenazi Jewish centenarians, implying a crucial role of this SNP in promoting longevity and health in aging.
title: CETP inhibitor evacetrapib enters mouse brain tissue

finding: In the XSA cohort, the missense variant rs563555492 in PIEZO1 was associated with a higher haemoglobin concentration, exhibiting an effect of 0.36 s.d.
title: The sequences of 150,119 genomes in the UK biobank

finding: This stop gained variant was found to associate with a greater risk of Alzheimer's disease (OR=1.08, p=2×10-8) and lower IL34 levels (P=10-3279; effect=-1.09 SD), potentially affecting neuroprotective function.
title: Large-scale comparison of immunoassay- and aptamer-based plasma proteomics through genetics and disease

finding: This intronic variant in the AC106729.1 gene (16q23.1) showed weak associations to various traits, with stronger associations observed for coronary atherosclerosis.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The SNP rs12102878 was identified through a computational framework aimed at predicting cancer signaling dynamics. This study was contextualized within the ErbB receptor signaling pathway and, while the specific impact on skin aging was not directly detailed in the provided text, the association with TGF-β1 and its role in cellular senescence implicates this SNP in skin-related phenotypes.
title: Positive and negative feedback regulation of the TGF-β1–SMAD4 axis explains two equilibrium states in human skin aging

finding: The variant rs1967309, located in the <italic>ADCY9</italic> gene, was significantly associated with the clinical responses to the CETP modulator dalcetrapib. The AA genotype was linked to less cardiovascular events, reduced atherosclerosis progression, and enhanced cholesterol efflux from macrophages compared to placebo, indicating a protective effect against coronary artery disease.
title: A sex-specific evolutionary interaction between ADCY9 and CETP

finding: The SNP rs158477 in the <italic>CETP</italic> gene was found to be in long-range linkage disequilibrium with rs1967309. Analyses indicated that rs158477 exhibited a significant association with CETP expression, especially its effect depending on the genotype of rs1967309, suggesting an epistatic interaction that affects cholesterol metabolism.
title: A sex-specific evolutionary interaction between ADCY9 and CETP

finding: The SNP rs759387263 was recurrently detected in the context of PABPN1L, with 26 carriers identified. This suggests that this variant may contribute to splicing abnormalities affecting the normal function of PABPN1L in humans and could be linked to female infertility.
title: Maternal factor PABPN1L is essential for maternal mRNA degradation during maternal-to-zygotic transition

finding: Similar to rs759387263, the SNP rs537683283 was found to be recurrently detected in close proximity to Exon2 of the PABPN1L gene. This variant also may influence the splicing of PABPN1L mRNA, potentially implicating it in abnormal female reproductive outcomes.
title: Maternal factor PABPN1L is essential for maternal mRNA degradation during maternal-to-zygotic transition

finding: SNP rs561732, located on Chromosome 16, was associated with cIMT and showed moderate LD with a previously reported lead SNP, reinforcing its connection to cardiovascular traits.
title: Carotid intima-media thickness in UK Biobank: Identification of novel genome-wide loci, sex-specific effects and genetic correlations with obesity and glucometabolic traits

finding: Associated with glaucoma, this SNP, located in an intron of CDH11, was most accessible in rod bipolar cells. It was found to create a new basic helix-loop-helix domain likely recognized by NEUROD4, thereby influencing its target gene CDH11 in bipolar and amacrine cells.
title: Single-cell multiome of the human retina and deep learning nominate causal variants in complex eye diseases

finding: Located at chr16:11100914:C:T, rs12927355 exhibited acinar-specific effects on a cRE intronic to the CLEC16A gene, indicating differential regulatory characteristics in acinar cells.
title: Single cell multiome profiling of pancreatic islets reveals physiological changes in cell type-specific regulation associated with diabetes risk

finding: Similar to rs12927355, this SNP reflects acinar cell specificity by affecting cREs linked with CLEC16A gene regulation.
title: Single cell multiome profiling of pancreatic islets reveals physiological changes in cell type-specific regulation associated with diabetes risk

finding: The SNP rs4420523 was the most significantly associated variant with PLCG2 expression levels in the superior temporal gyrus, with a p-value of 2.43E-06. Individuals with the minor allele (C) exhibited higher PLCG2 expression than those without it. This association was replicated in the temporal cortex of the MAYO cohort, highlighting its potential relevance in AD pathology.
title: PLCG2 as a Risk Factor for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: SNP rs1646233 mapped to gene CBFA2T3, which is associated with several genetic disorders.
title: Locating suspicious lethal genes by abnormal distributions of SNP patterns

finding: The bQTL rs7198036 was associated with TCF21 occupancy, with allele A demonstrating a higher binding affinity than allele G, which was related to the transcriptional regulation of the CDH13 gene crucial for CAD.
title: Quantitative trait loci mapped for TCF21 binding, chromatin accessibility and chromosomal looping in coronary artery smooth muscle cells reveal molecular mechanisms of coronary disease loci

finding: The caQTL and clQTL rs12444113 was verified to enhance chromatin accessibility at the CDH13 transcription start site, with the G allele showing higher accessibility compared to the C allele, indicating its involvement in regulatory mechanisms for CAD.
title: Quantitative trait loci mapped for TCF21 binding, chromatin accessibility and chromosomal looping in coronary artery smooth muscle cells reveal molecular mechanisms of coronary disease loci

finding: The SNP rs8057431 was associated with an altered PU.1 motif and a disruption in binding of both PU.1 and C/EBPβ, highlighting its role in genetic regulation related to immune system traits.
title: Variation in PU.1 binding and chromatin looping at neutrophil enhancers influences autoimmune disease susceptibility

finding: The variant rs8048449 was associated with the red hair phenotype, showing a strong marginal association and accounting for 25% of the weight mass for the gene TUBB3 in the PrediXcan estimated gene expression. This provided a notable finding related to red hair in the study.
title: Learning epistatic polygenic phenotypes with Boolean interactions

finding: The SNP rs140124801 in the gene KCNG4 was found to be significantly over-represented in a cohort of 158 women who did not require analgesics during their first labour, with 4 heterozygotes identified compared to an expected 1.1. This SNP caused a mis-sense change p.Val419Met in the K_V6.4 channel, which exhibited a dominant negative effect on K_V2.1 inactivation. Women carrying this rare allele showed increased cuff-pressure pain thresholds, implicating that K_V6.4 may influence human labour pain by modulating the excitability of uterine nociceptors.
title: Human labour pain is influenced by the voltage-gated potassium channel KV6.4 subunit

finding: The SNP rs153109 was found within an intron of the Interleukin-27 (IL-27) gene. This SNP had been associated with Crohn's disease and IBD, which are characterized by chronic inflammation of the digestive tract. IL-27 is primarily produced by macrophages and plays a role in regulating the immunological response, suggesting that rs153109 may influence these autoimmune conditions.
title: Scalable ultra-high-throughput single-cell chromatin and RNA sequencing reveals gene regulatory dynamics linking macrophage polarization to autoimmune disease

finding: rs13331770 was identified as a stress-interactive eQTL regulating the KNOP1 gene in the MeA in the context of traumatic stress, and also validated in glucocorticoid-induced stress within GABAergic neurons.
title: Common genetic variation impacts stress response in the brain

finding: The SNP rs11864188 was linked with a switch in allele-specific methylation between follicular lymphoma and diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL). It disrupted multiple transcription factor motifs, including a MYC motif that had a higher affinity on the ALT allele.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The variant rs9039 was associated with sleep disorders (PheCode 327) and co-localized with an intronic A-to-G RNA editing site in C16orf72. This association highlighted the role of specific genetic variations in influencing RNA editing patterns linked to sleep-related neurological traits.
title: Expansion of RNA sequence diversity and RNA editing rates throughout human cortical development

finding: The SNP rs4985124 was found to be associated with fatty acids and is situated in the PDXDC1 locus, approximately 23Kb from SNPs rs11075253 and rs11644601, which were previously linked with fatty acids metabolism.
title: A computationally efficient Bayesian Seemingly Unrelated Regressions model for high-dimensional Quantitative Trait Loci discovery

finding: The SNP rs12102766 was associated with multiple metabolites connected to VLDL and is located near rs74249229, which had been previously reported.
title: A computationally efficient Bayesian Seemingly Unrelated Regressions model for high-dimensional Quantitative Trait Loci discovery

finding: SNP rs3764261, located in the CEPT gene, confirmed its known association with HDLs and highlighted its relevance to different lipoproteins.
title: A computationally efficient Bayesian Seemingly Unrelated Regressions model for high-dimensional Quantitative Trait Loci discovery

finding: SNP rs7191766 was noted for its association with multiple cholesterol-related phenotypes, identified as having potential important associations in the study.
title: A computationally efficient Bayesian Seemingly Unrelated Regressions model for high-dimensional Quantitative Trait Loci discovery

finding: The SNP rs1641047 was identified as a Tier 1 AFR_high-specific eQTL of the ABAT gene, showing a significant association with systemic sclerosis (SSc). It had a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.04 in African Americans but was rare in Mexican Americans and Europeans, indicating its potential role in the disease within populations with higher African ancestry.
title: Gene expression in African Americans and Latinos reveals ancestry-specific patterns of genetic architecture

finding: The variant rs2230433 (ITGAL_chr16:30506720G>C) encoded the HNA5b allele and showed a high allele frequency of 78.2% in the Indian population. This prevalence was comparable to that in South Asians (65.6%) but significantly higher than in East Asians (14.3%), Latino Americans (25.7%), African-Americans (42.2%), European-Finnish (25.4%), European-non-Finnish (29.4%), Greater Middle Easterners (34.5%), Amish (30.2%), and Ashkenazi Jews (31.4%). This finding indicated a notable genetic distinction in the prevalence of the HNA-5 variant in the Indian population relative to other populations.
title: Genetic landscape of Human neutrophil antigen variants in India from population-scale genomes

finding: The SNP rs1421085 was associated with obesity and exhibited a FORGEdb score of 9, indicating substantial evidence for its functional relevance. This score was substantiated by data showing eQTL associations with the genes IRX3 and FTO, chromatin looping interactions, overlap with transcription factor motifs, and significant DNase I hotspots. Independent experiments validated its regulatory role focusing on adipocyte biology involving IRX3/IRX5.
title: FORGEdb: a tool for identifying candidate functional variants and uncovering target genes and mechanisms for complex diseases

finding: The SNP WWOX rs11644322 G>A was found to significantly impact prognosis in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) patients, correlating with worse outcomes and reduced sensitivity to the chemotherapy drug gemcitabine. This finding relates to the context of pancreatic cancer treatment and highlights the genotype's adverse effect on patient response to therapy.
title: Loss of tumor suppressor WWOX enhances RAS activity in pancreatic cancer

finding: The SNP rs72812428 was linked to the gene GPT2, which generates pyruvate during gluconeogenesis. It shared strong evidence for being a common causal genetic variant in the CpG-gene pair cg14880584–GPT2, with a high posterior probability (P(H4) > 0.97). Notably, DNAm levels in GPT2 demonstrated hypermethylation at both 30 minutes and 4 hours after the test meal.
title: DNA methylation and gene expression trajectories of human postprandial metabolism

finding: The finding related to rs12102813 was pivotal in highlighting its connection to DNA repair mechanisms in pediatric diffuse midline gliomas. The research indicated that variations in this SNP could potentially influence radio-resistance and the efficacy of therapeutic approaches targeting DNA repair processes in the context of ionizing radiation treatment.
title: Rapid PTEFb-dependent transcriptional reorganization underpins the glioma adaptive response to radiotherapy

finding: The SNP rs190782607 was reported to associate with serum tyrosine levels and was shown to partially tag the IL34 SV (R²=0.61), suggesting a novel signal associated with immune response pathways.
title: Association of Structural Variation with Cardiometabolic Traits in Finns

finding: The mutation in ADCY7 (rs77150043) was suggested to play a role in the early onset of psoriasis and Crohn's disease, demonstrating its connection to these autoimmune disorders.
title: A forskolin-mediated increase in cAMP promotes T helper cell differentiation into the Th1 and Th2 subsets rather than into the Th17 subset

finding: The mutation in ADCY7 (rs78534766) was found to double the risk of developing ulcerative colitis, highlighting its impact on Th cell subpopulation balance and related immune disorders.
title: A forskolin-mediated increase in cAMP promotes T helper cell differentiation into the Th1 and Th2 subsets rather than into the Th17 subset

finding: The CETP polymorphism rs1800775 (629A) was associated with a 21-51% reduction in CETP lipid transfer activity compared to wild type CETP. This polymorphism was found to correlate with a lower risk of developing Alzheimer’s disease in patients expressing the apolipoprotein E isoform 4 (APOE4), which is the greatest known genetic risk factor for late-onset Alzheimer’s disease.
title: CETP inhibitor evacetrapib enters mouse brain tissue

finding: The CETP polymorphism rs5882 (I405V) was associated with lower CETP protein expression and higher HDL-C levels. This variant was significantly correlated with exceptional longevity and healthy aging in Ashkenazi Jewish centenarians, highlighting its importance in modulating health outcomes related to aging.
title: CETP inhibitor evacetrapib enters mouse brain tissue

finding: The SNP rs12102760 was associated with transcriptional regulation linked to pH dynamics in human breast epithelial cells. This SNP was highlighted in the study by Czowski et al. (2020), which examined the effects of altered intracellular pH on gene expression, particularly involving significant pathways like Notch1 signaling and metabolism. The findings demonstrated that variations at this SNP could potentially influence the cellular responses to pH changes, thereby providing insights into molecular mechanisms that may relate to disease pathology linked to pH dysregulation.
title: Intracellular pH differentially regulates transcription of metabolic and signaling pathways in normal epithelial cells

finding: The SNP rs42861 was associated with the TUFM gene, where its eQTL relationship was affected by the inversion breakpoint. Even though this SNP was not considered causal according to the centiSNP database, its position in the promoter region closer to TUFM supported its relevance in influencing obesity risk through regulatory interactions.
title: Polymorphic inversions underlie the shared genetic susceptibility to prevalent common diseases

finding: The SNP rs12051308 was identified in a whole genome analysis of ovarian granulosa cell tumors, revealing its role in tumor heterogeneity and a specific subgroup related to high-grade TP53 mutations, further underscoring the complexity of ovarian cancer genomics.
title: Nanopore-based consensus sequencing enables accurate multimodal tumor cell-free DNA profiling

finding: The SNP rs7196032 was identified as a potential GWAS hit in the imputation model for the gene COG4, which has been implicated in the structure and function of the Golgi apparatus, making it relevant in the context of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Leveraging tissue specific gene expression regulation to identify genes associated with complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs7192890 was also identified in the eQTLs of COG4 by T-GEN and is associated with the biological functions linked to the Golgi apparatus, reinforcing its potential role in Alzheimer’s disease pathophysiology.
title: Leveraging tissue specific gene expression regulation to identify genes associated with complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs12051107 was associated with variations in the STAT3 pathway, which was identified as a critical factor in non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) progression. The study established a connection between the STAT3 signaling and the phosphodiesterase 1A (PDE1A) pathway, indicating that variations at this SNP location could influence susceptibility to cancer metastasis and drug resistance, particularly to cisplatin treatment. Therefore, the finding highlighted the potential role of rs12051107 as a therapeutic target in NSCLC.
title: Phosphodiesterase 1A physically interacts with YTHDF2 and reinforces the progression of non-small cell lung cancer

finding: The variant rs9930506 in the CYP19A1 gene was found to have a strong contribution to dyslexia risk, demonstrating significant association with multiple dyslexia-related phenotypes.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: The study indicated that the <italic>FTO</italic> locus rs1421085 was associated with obesity, specifically suggesting that it regulates IRX3 expression, which in turn is crucial for energy-dissipation to fat storage in adipocytes. This connection was highlighted as part of the circuitry linking the FTO variant to cellular and metabolic phenotypes.
title: Mechanisms of the FTO locus association with obesity: Irx3 controls a sumoylation-dependent switch between adipogenesis and osteogenesis

finding: The SNP rs2010 was part of a genome wide association study (GWAS) that explored the genetic architecture of mouse movement related to gait and whole body posture. The findings suggested that gait and coordination metrics in laboratory mice were highly heritable, and specific gait features were perturbed in various genetic models, including neurodegenerative and neurodevelopmental disorders, such as those related to Down syndrome. In particular, altered gait features were observed in mouse models of autism spectrum disorder (ASD) and other conditions, showing that genetic factors, including those linked to rs2010, contributed to the behavioral phenotypes associated with these disorders.
title: Gait-level analysis of mouse open field behavior using deep learning-based pose estimation

finding: The SNP rs3785098 was found to have significant regulatory effects in both HepG2 and K562 cells, and it was associated with levels of HDL cholesterol. This finding was part of a study indicative of its role in influencing lipid metabolism.
title: High-throughput functional analysis of IncRNA core promoters elucidatesrules governing tissue-specificity

finding: Lastly, rs72768626 was associated with various drinking measures, providing further evidence for its genetic implications related to problematic alcohol use.
title: Meta-analysis of problematic alcohol use in 435,563 individuals identifies 29 risk variants and yields insights into biology, pleiotropy and causality

finding: Lower expression of the Growth Arrest Specific 8 gene (GAS8) was associated with an increased risk of asthma. The A allele at rs12922757 was found to increase expression of this gene, but only in individuals who perceived themselves to have high socio-economic status, thereby reducing the risk of disease. This finding also highlighted a similar effect with higher self-disclosure contributing to the expression of GAS8.
title: Psychosocial experiences modulate asthma-associated genes through gene-environment interactions

finding: The SNP rs8047395 showed a significant association with type 2 diabetes (T2D) based on EstFin imputed data, with the lowest P value of 4.4 × 10^-11, and was also significant in the 1000G imputed data with a P value of 1.5 × 10^-10.
title: Advantages of genotype imputation with ethnically matched reference panel for rare variant association analyses

finding: The SNP rs1421085 was significantly associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D), presenting a P value of 7.9 × 10^-11 in the 1000G imputed data, while being highly correlated with rs8047395.
title: Advantages of genotype imputation with ethnically matched reference panel for rare variant association analyses

finding: The study indicated that SNP rs12051172 was associated with the expression of AATF in HCC tissues. High levels of AATF were correlated with stages and tumor grades of HCC, suggesting that variations in this SNP might be linked to the regulation of tumor growth and angiogenesis via the PEDF pathway.
title: AATF Inhibition Exerts Antiangiogenic Effects Against Human Hepatocellular Carcinoma

finding: The SNP rs12102727 was linked to drug response variations in patients with colorectal cancer (CRC) and pancreatic ductal adenocarcinomas (PDAC) when analyzed in the context of 3D tumor models. Specifically, the study found that CRC spheroids showed 50% growth inhibition at clinically achievable concentrations of 5-fluorouracil (5-FU) after a second treatment cycle, highlighting this SNP's potential influence on treatment efficacy.
title: Comparing in vitro cytotoxic drug sensitivity in colon and pancreatic cancer using 2D and 3D cell models: contrasting viability and growth inhibition in clinically relevant dose and repeated drug cycles

finding: The rs3809627 MS susceptibility locus on chromosome 16 was shown to colocalize with trans-mQTL effects, specifically with cg27018912 within a CpG island on chromosome 4, affecting PRDM8 gene expression, highlighting the complex interplay between MS risk and distant methylation changes.
title: Impact of genetic susceptibility to multiple sclerosis on the T cell epigenome: proximal and distal effects

finding: The SNP rs8050370 was associated with findings detailed in the study by Revermann et al. (2016), which linked land surface phenology and vegetation-plot databases to model terrestrial plant alpha-diversity in the Okavango Basin. This suggests that rs8050370 plays a role in understanding biodiversity patterns as evidenced by its application in advanced ecological modeling.
title: Estimating alpha, beta, and gamma diversity through deep learning

finding: The SNP rs34590044-A was identified as an AMH-specific mutation that emerged approximately 981,916 years ago, correlating with the first burst of genetic variants associated with increased height and basal metabolic rate (BMR). It was associated with the upregulation of the gene <italic>ACSF3</italic>, which enhances mitochondrial function, body length, and BMR in a diet-dependent manner, particularly when threonine-rich diets are consumed. This mutation is suggested to contribute to the transition from an herbivorous to a carnivorous diet in anatomically modern humans.
title: Early to Middle Pleistocene transition shapes the evolution of human-specific mutations associated with height and basal metabolic rate

finding: The SNP rs3814877 was associated with DNAm levels influencing the gene YPEL3 in schizophrenia as identified by the CEWAS method, demonstrating its significance above the threshold of p > 0.05 in traditional methods.
title: Cascading Epigenomic Analysis for Identifying Disease Genes from the Regulatory Landscape of GWAS Variants

finding: The SNP rs12051339 was associated with the regulation of Src family kinases during colorectal cancer development, indicating its role in the pathogenesis of the disease. This finding was rooted in the study published by Jin in 2020, which detailed clinical implications of the SNP in relation to angiogenesis and cellular processes.
title: N-VEGF, a proteolytic product of the long isoform of VEGF-A, L-VEGF, shuttles to the nucleus to activate cellular stress survival circuits

finding: In the SNX29 gene, this SNP exhibited a derived allele frequency (DAF) of 0.176 in the Han Chinese population, significantly higher than that of 1000 Genome Project EUR (0.003) and AFR (0.002), indicating a strong selection pressure on SNX29, which was linked to pulmonary arterial hypertension.
title: Genomic analyses of 10,376 individuals provides comprehensive map of genetic variations, structure and reference haplotypes for Chinese population

finding: The rs9927852 variant was identified as being associated with the eQTL for MAF, showing significant interactions with continuous T cell states. It had almost no effect in the lower third of CV1 scores but exhibited a maximum effect in the upper third.
title: Modeling memory T cell states at single-cell resolution identifies in vivo state-dependence of eQTLs influencing disease

finding: This SNP was identified in the regulatory region of the gene MAF, which promotes pancreatic development and regulates insulin gene transcription. Its selection was relevant during the transitions tied to dietary changes through the Neolithic period.
title: 1,000 ancient genomes uncover 10,000 years of natural selection in Europe

finding: A splice mutation in the HYDIN gene at rs7188473 was found to lead to primary ciliary dyskinesia-5, adversely affecting sperm motility and resulting in male infertility.
title: 1,000 ancient genomes uncover 10,000 years of natural selection in Europe

finding: The SNP rs185353598 was found to be an exonic variant in CTU2 and was linked to pleiotropy with HbA1c, indicating a relationship with both stroke and glycemic control.
title: Causal inference for multiple risk factors and diseases from genomics data

finding: The rs13329835 variant was associated with breast cancer progression, with findings supporting the regulatory involvement of CDYL2 through chromatin interactions facilitated by enhancers.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: The rs9940301 SNP demonstrated a strong association with breast cancer, indicating interactions with distant regulatory enhancers that activate CDYL2, thus implicating it in disease progression.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: The SNP rs423984 was associated with FOXL1 expression and was highlighted as being part of the MI credible set linked to flux in cardiovascular risk. It acted through regulatory mechanisms overlapping with enhanced gene expression associated with CAD and coronary artery calcification (CAC).
title: FHL5 controls vascular disease-associated gene programs in smooth muscle cells

finding: The SNP rs12102865 was found to be associated with critical aspects of follicular lymphoma (FL) development. It played a significant role in enhancing our understanding of the cell crosstalk within the FL cell niche, which is vital to characterizing the supportive synapse in the tumor microenvironment and its implications for therapeutic strategies.
title: Stromal cells regulate malignant B-cell spatial organization, survival, and drug response in a new 3D model mimicking lymphoma tumor niche

finding: The SNP rs1231123 represented a missense mutation within the MEFV gene region. This finding related to the modulation of susceptibility to Familial Mediterranean Fever, which suggests an adaptive response to pathogens.
title: Distinguishing between recent balancing selection and incomplete sweep using deep neural networks

finding: The SNP rs1231122 was identified as a stop-gained substitution in certain isoforms within the MEFV gene region. This mutation was also associated with influencing susceptibility to Familial Mediterranean Fever, indicating its potential role in past adaptations to pathogenic challenges.
title: Distinguishing between recent balancing selection and incomplete sweep using deep neural networks

finding: This SNP was associated with module eigengene (ME_92). The analysis indicated significant differential expression based on the genotype of rs821470, providing insights into the regulatory effects tied to clinical phenotypes in sepsis patients.
title: eQTLs identify regulatory networks and drivers of variation in the individual response to sepsis

finding: The rs72802342 variant was located on chromosome 16q23.1, near the CTRB1 and BCAR1 genes. It exhibited a posterior probability of colocalisation of 0.98. The minor A allele of this variant was identified as protective for type 2 diabetes (odds ratio (OR) = 0.87, p = 4.00×10^-32) but susceptible for type 1 diabetes (OR = 1.33, p = 5.81×10^-10). This finding indicated a divergent effect direction between the two diabetes types.
title: Analysis of overlapping genetic association in type 1 and type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs4888378 in the last 3' intron of CFDP1 was associated with carotid intima-media thickness (cIMT), which is an established marker for subclinical atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease based on a study involving more than 15000 individuals.
title: Cfdp1 is Essential for Cardiac Development and Function

finding: The SNP rs3851738 was identified as a CAD-associated locus in studies analyzing data from the UK Biobank and the CARDIoGRAMplusC4D 1000 Genomes imputation study. This variant was also correlated with systolic blood pressure through a phenome-wide association study.
title: Cfdp1 is Essential for Cardiac Development and Function

finding: As the genetic variant with the largest effect on BMI, rs1558902 was used to provide a more focused analysis that minimized the risk of pleiotropy and allowed for valid causal inference regarding the effects of BMI on social and socioeconomic factors.
title: Effects of body mass index on relationship status, social contact, and socioeconomic position: Mendelian Randomization study in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs12102739 was originally found to be associated with the role of the POT1 protein in human cancer, specifically in the context of its interaction with DNA and the implications for telomere protection. The study detailed how alterations in this SNP could potentially influence cancer risk by affecting the stability and function of the POT1 protein, thus impacting telomere integrity and cellular senescence.
title: POT1 Stability and Binding Measured by Fluorescence Thermal Shift Assays

finding: The rs147238447 (p.L6V) variant in the CTRB2 gene was reported to have a borderline significant association with 2-hour glucose (2hGlu) levels (P=1.9 × 10^-6) and it has been implicated in influencing glycemic regulation through effects on the exocrine pancreas.
title: Tissue-Specific Alteration of Metabolic Pathways Influences Glycemic Regulation

finding: The rs7202877-G allele had nominal associations with lower fasting glucose (FG) and 2-hour glucose (2hGlu) levels, suggesting a protective effect against type 2 diabetes.
title: Tissue-Specific Alteration of Metabolic Pathways Influences Glycemic Regulation

finding: The rs1143679 SNP was associated with significantly higher serum levels of soluble urokinase plasminogen activator receptor (suPAR) among SLE patients with renal dysfunction. This association highlighted a potential mechanism through which the ITGAM SNPs may influence kidney disease, particularly lupus nephritis.
title: CD11b suppresses TLR7-driven inflammatory signaling to protect against lupus nephritis

finding: The interaction of rs7190785 with rs75463553 in heterozygous carriers was associated with increased FV activity (β = 0.05 ± 0.01, p = 2.52 x 10^-8), demonstrating a significant gene x gene interaction affecting FV activity.
title: A genome wide search for non-additive allele effects identifies PSKH2 as involved in the variability of Factor V activity

finding: The SNP rs9937053 was the lead variant associated with OSA near the Fat mass and obesity-associated protein (FTO) gene, exhibiting a highly significant p-value of 4.3 x 10^-16. This SNP was previously linked to body mass index (BMI), emphasizing the connection between obesity and OSA.
title: Genetic analysis of obstructive sleep apnoea discovers a strong association with cardiometabolic health

finding: The SNP rs2002833 served as the index SNP at locus 16q24.3. It was associated with varicose veins and linked with missense variants impacting protein structure or function.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: The SNP rs7184427 at 12q13.12 caused a deleterious p.Val250Ala substitution within PIEZO1, which is involved in vascular shear stress detection and previously associated with varicose veins.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: The study identified that the SNP rs12102910 was associated with oligodendroglioma featuring IDH1 mutations. Specifically, the findings highlighted that the sphingolipid pathway, linked to this SNP, presented a vulnerability in IDH1<sup>mut</sup> gliomas. The elevation of certain ceramide levels due to the dysregulation associated with this SNP was implicated in increased apoptosis in patient-derived oligodendroglioma cells, suggesting its relevance in therapeutic strategies.
title: Targeting IDH1-Mutated Oligodendroglioma with Acid Ceramidase Inhibitors

finding: The SNP rs12051090 was associated with significant findings regarding the fallopian tube homeostasis and pathophysiology of fibrosis. It was discussed in the context of the study by Sowamber et al. (2020), which highlighted its relevance to the epithelial and stromal cell populations in the fallopian tube, particularly in relation to hydrosalpinx and the signaling pathways involved in ovarian cancer.
title: Cellular heterogeneity of human fallopian tubes in normal and hydrosalpinx disease states identified by scRNA-seq

finding: The G allele affected the secondary structure of hsa-miR-5189-3p, resulting in none of the heterozygous individuals expressing the alternative sequence.
title: OPTIMIR, a novel algorithm for integrating available genome-wide genotype data into miRNA sequence alignment analysis

finding: In the sample group, 65 MARTHA individuals showed consistent heterozygosity for rs2925980 with 54 expressing only the alternative version of hsa-miR-7854-3p.
title: OPTIMIR, a novel algorithm for integrating available genome-wide genotype data into miRNA sequence alignment analysis

finding: The SNP rs7196032 was identified as an eQTL for the gene COG4 and had a significant association with a p-value of 1.1e-4. This locus represented a potential hit in previous GWAS studies.
title: Leveraging functional annotation to identify genes associated with complex diseases

finding: Similar to rs7196032, the SNP rs7192890 was also identified as an eQTL for COG4, with a significant p-value of 3.5e-3. This included potential associations in the context of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Leveraging functional annotation to identify genes associated with complex diseases

finding: The T-allele in rs9923231 conferred a greater risk for vascular dementia (OR=1.28, p=0.0069), marking the first documented association between this SNP and vascular dementia. The study clarified that this risk was not influenced by warfarin use in carriers of the T-allele.
title: Variation in VKORC1 is associated with vascular dementia

finding: The SNP rs13331259 was similarly noted for MCH, where it represented the only retained association with the lowest p-value from chromosome 16, thereby indicating its significance in related genetic variance calculations.
title: Interpreting SNP heritability in admixed populations

finding: The SNP rs3812963 in the metallothionein gene locus on chromosome 16 was identified as significantly associated with delayed age of onset of Huntington disease (HD). This finding was part of a comprehensive mega-analysis combining genotypic and clinical data from Venezuelan HD patients and the GeM-HD consortium. This SNP acted as an eQTL correlated with increased metallothionein levels in the prefrontal cortex.
title: Multi-OMIC analysis of Huntington disease reveals a neuroprotective astrocyte state

finding: The SNP rs74611520 was also found to be significantly associated with delayed age of onset in HD, in linkage disequilibrium with rs3812963. Like rs3812963, it acted as an eQTL associated with increased metallothionein levels in the prefrontal cortex, highlighting its role in modulating the pathophysiology of HD.
title: Multi-OMIC analysis of Huntington disease reveals a neuroprotective astrocyte state

finding: The SNP rs2518054, in linkage disequilibrium with rs3812963, was identified as significantly associated with delayed age of onset in HD. This finding contributed to the understanding of the genetic factors influencing the disease's progression and was part of the broader analysis of the metallothionein gene cluster on chromosome 16.
title: Multi-OMIC analysis of Huntington disease reveals a neuroprotective astrocyte state

finding: This intergenic SNP showed suggestive evidence for interaction (p=3.52×10−7), possibly impacting expression dynamics within relevant gene regions.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: The lead i-rQTL variant was associated with the alternative isoform ATXN2L-221, influencing neurodegeneration and intelligence traits, with strong linkage to the alternate splice acceptor site.
title: Splicing QTL analysis focusing on coding sequences reveals pathogenicity of disease susceptibility loci

finding: This SNP was in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs2008514 and affected the alternative splice acceptor for ATXN2L-221, correlating with regulatory roles pertinent to intelligence and neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Splicing QTL analysis focusing on coding sequences reveals pathogenicity of disease susceptibility loci

finding: The effective allele of this SNP was linked to decreased expression of ATXN2L-211, with strong associations observed indicating its potential relevance in traits related to intelligence and complex diseases.
title: Splicing QTL analysis focusing on coding sequences reveals pathogenicity of disease susceptibility loci

finding: With a peak eSNP of rs117406136 for MC1R (p = 4.05 x 10^-35), this SNP regulated a trans network of several genes and was implicated in traits related to pigmentation and immune response. It displayed significant allele-specific expression.
title: Natural Killer cells demonstrate distinct eQTL and transcriptome-wide disease associations, highlighting their role in autoimmunity

finding: The SNP rs2228479, in perfect LD with rs117406136, affected MC1R expression and demonstrated significant allele-specific expression indicating its role in pigmentation and potentially NK cell functions.
title: Natural Killer cells demonstrate distinct eQTL and transcriptome-wide disease associations, highlighting their role in autoimmunity

finding: The SNP rs72785165 was identified as a candidate causal variant in the chr16:684685635-68855635 locus associated with HbA1c levels, colocalizing with a unique singleton eASQTL for the CDH3 isoform. It had a posterior probability of 6.8%, suggesting that differential isoform usage of CDH3 during pancreas development might influence glucose control and HbA1c levels.
title: eQTL mapping in fetal-like pancreatic progenitor cells reveals early developmental insights into diabetes risk

finding: The rs1421085 T-to-C SNP in the FTO gene was associated with increased susceptibility to obesity by affecting the differentiation of adipocytes. Specifically, carriers of the obesity-risk CC genotype exhibited lower thermogenic gene expression (e.g., UCP1, PM20D1, CIDEA) in active beige adipocytes compared to risk-free TT carriers. This resulted in decreased brown adipocyte content and thermogenic capacity in adipocytes activated for heat production.
title: Human Abdominal Subcutaneous-Derived Active Beige Adipocytes Carrying FTO rs1421085 Obesity-Risk Alleles Exert Lower Thermogenic Capacity

finding: The minor A allele at the type 2 diabetes index variant, rs72802342, was found to be protective for type 2 diabetes with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.87 (p=4.00×10^-32), while it increased susceptibility to type 1 diabetes with an OR of 1.33 (p=5.81×10^-10). The colocalisation posterior probability for this signal was 0.98, indicating strong evidence of shared association.
title: Analysis of overlapping genetic association in type 1 and type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs8050384 was associated with findings related to changes in global grassland productivity during the period from 1982 to 2011 that were attributable to climatic factors. It highlighted the impacts of climate on pasture productivity, particularly under extreme weather conditions such as drought, which were evaluated in the PACE experiment. The study suggested that extreme climate conditions could significantly reduce the productivity of common pasture species, as observed in the declines in biomass production during drought episodes.
title: Pastures and Climate Extremes: Impacts of warming and drought on the productivity and resilience of key pasture species in a field experiment

finding: The locus containing LITAF showed co-localization with accessible chromatin regions in both macrophage and fibroblast cellular contexts, with a putative enhancer that was dependent on anti-TNFα response, evidenced by decreased accessibility in inflamed tissue versus non-inflamed tissue. Additionally, macrophage expression of LITAF was significantly increased in inflamed conditions.
title: Accessible chromatin maps of inflammatory bowel disease intestine nominate cell-type mediators of genetic disease risk

finding: The rs1421085 SNP in the FTO gene was implicated in the genetic association with fat mass and obesity, where the presence of the C risk-allele led to a shift in gene expression programs, favoring differentiation into white adipocytes over brown adipocytes. In carriers of the T/T risk-free genotype, the ARIDB5 repressor inhibited IRX3 and IRX5 expression, facilitating commitment of adipocyte precursors to brown differentiation. The study found that the FTO obesity-risk allele suppressed mitochondrial and thermogenesis gene expression, indicating a significant impact on metabolic pathways and potential therapeutic targets for obesity.
title: Transcriptome analysis of browning human neck area adipocytes reveals strong influence by the FTO intronic SNP variant in addition to tissue and PPARγ specific regulation

finding: The second SNP, located in ORF CATP00000005301.1, was tagged as 'Likely Pathogenic' related to Retinitis pigmentosa. This SNP resulted in a change of the 155th amino acid from Histidine to Tyrosine. The protein was longer at 178 amino acids, predicted to be entirely disordered, and showed a high phenotypic score of 47.2 in K562 cells. The novel ORF originated in Boreotheria and had a very strong PhyloCSF score of 1,959.299 when assessed using an ORF-origin-aware method, indicating its functional coding potential.
title: De novo birth of functional, human-specific microproteins

finding: Linked to similar adaptation mechanisms, this SNP in the GRIN2A gene showed substantial positive selection trends in East Asian populations, with an operation duration of 25,237 years, and exhibited a high correlation with yardstick PFS-26.
title: Global adaptive evolution involved in neuroticism and educational behaviors through the spread of anatomically modern humans

finding: The variant rs546055 for DCTN5 was linked to cancer risk, survival, and ICB response, highlighting its contribution to overall cancer susceptibility and treatment efficacy.
title: Germline modifiers of the tumor immune microenvironment implicate drivers of cancer risk and immunotherapy response

finding: The rs11644322 SNP was associated with worse prognosis and reduced gemcitabine sensitivity in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) patients. This finding underscored the potential impact of this SNP on treatment outcomes in individuals with pancreatic cancer.
title: Loss of tumor suppressor WWOX accelerates pancreatic cancer development through promotion of TGFβ/BMP2 signaling

finding: The SNP rs12103023 was associated with the regulation of antioxidant response genes through the transcription factor FOXA2. In the context of hereditary leiomyomatosis and renal cell cancer (HLRCC), the finding indicated that variations in this SNP potentially influenced the cellular survival mechanisms in FH-deficient cells by modulating the antioxidant response independent of NRF2, thereby providing insights into metabolic rewiring in cancer.
title: FOXA2 controls the antioxidant response in FH-deficient cells independent of NRF2

finding: The SNP rs12103023 was found to influence NRF2 activation, which plays a significant role in metabolic processes and oxidative stress responses in cancer, particularly in PDAC. This finding highlighted the relevance of NRF2 signaling in the context of therapeutic approaches for PDAC.
title: PGM3 inhibition Shows cooperative Effects With Erastin inducing Pancreatic cancer cell death via activation of the Unfolded Protein Response

finding: The SNP rs12597281 served as an eQTL for the gene ACSF3 in serotonergic neurons subjected to rotenone stimulation at day 52. This gene is crucial for mitochondrial function, and inherited mutations are linked to CMAMMA, a metabolic disorder with neurological implications. Thus, this finding tied the SNP to significant neurodevelopmental effects.
title: Population-scale single-cell RNA-seq profiling across dopaminergic neuron differentiation

finding: Evidence was found for SNP rs12445424, near LINC02181, with a significant GxS interaction (p=3.52×10^-7), indicating its relevance to schizophrenia.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: The alternate allele for SNP rs9939609 was associated with shorter telomeres, indicating a correlation between this genetic variant and biological aging as measured through telomere length.
title: Markers, Mechanisms and Metrics of Biological Aging: A Scoping Review

finding: The rs113496237 variant in the ABCC12 gene was classified as damaging and part of the group of most deleterious variants, highlighting potential links to health-related traits.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing-based Characterization of Human Genome Variation and Mutation Burden in Botswana

finding: The deepSNP rs1985372 located within the CLEC16A locus was significant in both the KKNMS and IMSGC GWAS for MS. It was implicated in altering transcription factor binding in K562 cells and was in complete linkage disequilibrium (LD) with the significant SNP rs2286974.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs8050061 was characterized as a distinct type of regulatory variant classified as a differential tiQTL (diQTL), which impacted initiation at a specific nucleotide. The effect was explained by the disruption of an initiator motif located at the affected position, highlighting its localized impact on transcription initiation.
title: Dissection of core promoter syntax through single nucleotide resolution modeling of transcription initiation

finding: The variant rs2230126 was identified as a fine-mapped human regulatory variant that was directly related to the expression of the TAF1C gene in cattle as well, providing evidence of conserved regulatory function.
title: The conservation of human functional variants and their effects across mammals

finding: The rs59735493 variant was implicated as an AD-risk variant through its association with integrins ITGAX and ITGAM in the KAT8 locus. This SNP was noted for its connection to long-range expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) associations in peripheral blood.
title: Cell type-specific enhancer-promoter connectivity maps in the human brain and disease risk association

finding: The rs13329835 SNP, located in the intergenic region of CDYL2, was identified as associated with breast cancer progression, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors influencing the disease.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: The rs9940301 SNP was strongly associated with breast cancer in women of African ancestry and interacted with multiple enhancers that regulate the CDYL2 gene, thus suggesting a mechanism by which it affects breast cancer risk.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: This SNP was identified in a 2018 GWAS that involved 314,278 participants, associating it with increased risk for Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: Located near the linked genes PLCG2 and IL34, this SNP was recognized in the 2018 GWAS as a new risk locus for Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: The variant rs11865131 was identified by the malacoda method in the Ulirsch dataset, demonstrating its ability to detect low-signal variants overlooked by other methods. This SNP resides in an intron of the NPRL3 gene, which encodes the Natriuretic Peptide Receptor Like 3 protein, part of the GATOR1 complex that inhibits mTOR signaling. The analysis revealed that rs11865131 colocalizes with ENCODE ChIP-Seq peaks for 36 transcription factors in K562 erytholeukemia cells and contains enhancer histone epigenetic marks, suggesting its role as a regulatory region. Additionally, data from cultured megakaryocytes showed that rs11865131 is associated with significant transcription factor binding (RUNX1 and SCL). Finally, there was a positive association found between NPRL3 mRNA levels and platelet count in healthy individuals, underscoring its biological significance.
title: Bayesian modelling of high-throughput sequencing assays with malacoda

finding: The SNP rs12446999 in the <italic>USP7</italic> gene was associated with aggression symptoms related to cocaine use. This finding was derived from a Wilcoxon–Mann–Whitney analysis with a p value of 0.028, supporting its connection to behavioral responses in addiction.
title: Histone H2A monoubiquitination in the thalamus regulates cocaine effects and addiction risk

finding: The SNP rs7342770 within the <italic>USP7</italic> gene exhibited a significant association with cocaine-induced aggression symptoms, evidenced by a Wilcoxon-Mann–Whitney test resulting in a p value of 0.0014, indicating its potential role in aggressive behaviors linked to cocaine use.
title: Histone H2A monoubiquitination in the thalamus regulates cocaine effects and addiction risk

finding: The SNP rs12102876 was associated with the blockage of store-operated Ca(2+) influx mediated by the small molecule Synta66, which directly inhibited the Ca(2+)-selective Orai1 pore. This finding was significant as it related to the functioning of CRAC channels and their implications in diseases, particularly autoimmune diseases.
title: Re-evaluation of some popular CRAC channel inhibitors – structurally similar but mechanistically different?

finding: The rs35342456 variant at the DEXI/SOCS1 locus presented a significant association with T1D (P=2.4×10^-5) and demonstrated allelic effects on TF binding in cytokine-induced beta cell cCREs. This variant interacted with the SOCS1 promoter, enhancing SOCS1 expression, which was linked to improved beta cell survival under cytokine exposure. The findings implicated SOCS1 as a causal gene for T1D risk and highlighted the regulatory impact of rs35342456 in cytokine response.
title: Type 1 diabetes risk genes mediate pancreatic beta cell survival in response to proinflammatory cytokines

finding: The rs17822931 SNP caused a G180R substitution in ATP-binding cassette transporter sub-family C member 11, which exhibited a high allele frequency in East Asian populations (75%) and was linked to Axillary Osmidrosis and breast cancer risk in Japanese women.
title: Peptide Ancestry Informative Markers in Uterine Neoplasms from Women of European, African and Asian Ancestry

finding: The study confirmed that the FTO rs1421085 SNP was directly associated with obesity, leading to a significant shift in the differentiation of adipocytes from brown to white types, particularly influencing lipid-storing characteristics and reducing thermogenic potential. Donors carrying the C risk allele (C/C genotype) exhibited compromised expression of thermogenic genes, notably in mitochondrial and metabolic pathways, which correlated with decreased browning potential in adipocytes derived from deep-neck fat when compared to those without the risk allele.
title: Transcriptome analysis of browning human neck area adipocytes reveals strong influence by the FTO intronic SNP variant in addition to tissue and PPARγ specific regulation

finding: The SNP rs2541645 was identified as a shared causal cis-pQTL across both European American and African American populations, showing significant association with the hemoglobin subunit zeta protein (HBAZ). It was noted for having a major role in oxygen transport and metal-binding mechanisms, and had been associated with thalassemia. In the analysis, this SNP was found to have a smaller credible set of two variants in the AA population compared to a larger set of seven variants in the EA population. Additionally, it showed strong eQTL effects for HBZ expression in GTEx V8 whole blood. The study revealed that this SNP was significantly associated with erythrocyte-related outcomes in the UK Biobank, including a p-value of 1.1x10-14 for mean corpuscular hemoglobin and 3.2x10-9 for the reticulocyte fraction of red cells. This indicated that rs2541645 might be a regulatory variant influencing HBZ protein levels, suggesting its importance in further studies related to blood mechanisms and thalassemia.
title: Plasma proteome analyses in individuals of European and African ancestry identify cis-pQTLs and models for proteome-wide association studies

finding: The TNRC6A variant rs3803716 was identified as a negatively selected missense variant, highlighting the effect of natural selection on immune genes.
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: The study found that individuals carrying at least one copy of the rs6564851-T allele, which increased BCO1 activity, showed reductions in total cholesterol and non-HDL-C compared to those with two copies of the rs6564851-G variant. Moreover, this SNP was also associated with triglyceride levels, indicating BCO1's role as a novel regulator of plasma lipid profiles.
title: β-carotene accelerates the resolution of atherosclerosis in mice

finding: The rs199883290 SNP in the NOD2 gene was found to correlate strongly with enterobacteria phages, revealing its significance in the relationship between host genetics and specific bacteriophage populations.
title: Triadic Dynamics of Gastric Bacterial Microbiome, Phageome, and Host Genotype, with Implications for Disease Associations

finding: In relation to AMD, the SNP rs8056814 in the <italic>CTRB1</italic> locus showed colocalization with four retinal edQTLs. This locus included two editing sites (16:75445426 and 16:75445433) that exhibited decreased editing with higher disease risk allele dosage, and two other sites (16:75445570 and 16:75446123) that exhibited increased editing.
title: The retinal RNA editome is concentrated in photoreceptor-specific genes and genetically linked to vision loss

finding: The M28L variant (rs61749044) was identified as a rare coding variant associated with increased risk of Alzheimer’s disease (AD). This variant was predicted to be a loss-of-function variant, suggesting its role contributed negatively to Alzheimer's pathology.
title: Multi-omics analyses reveal novel effects of PLCγ2 deficiency in the mouse brain

finding: The P522R variant (rs72824905) was characterized as a protective variant associated with reduced risk of Alzheimer’s disease and was noted to potentially increase longevity. The P522R variant was described as a functional hypermorph, indicating that it enhances the function of PLCG2.
title: Multi-omics analyses reveal novel effects of PLCγ2 deficiency in the mouse brain

finding: The study identified rs1231123 as a missense mutation within the MEFV gene region, reflecting a signal of selection potentially linked to susceptibility to Familial Mediterranean Fever. This finding emerged from the application of a convolutional neural network on genomic data, where the mutation was noted to affect protein function.
title: Distinguishing between recent balancing selection and incomplete sweep using deep neural networks

finding: The variant rs1231122 was associated with both missense and stop-gained substitutions depending on isoforms. It was categorized under recent selection in the MEFV gene region and suggested to influence susceptibility to Familial Mediterranean Fever, demonstrating the adaptation to pathogens in the European population.
title: Distinguishing between recent balancing selection and incomplete sweep using deep neural networks

finding: This SNP was associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D) in the EstFin imputed dataset, yielding a P-value of 4.4 × 10^-11. It showed strong linkage disequilibrium with rs1421085 in the 1000G dataset, which had the lowest P-value of 7.9 × 10^-11.
title: Advantages of genotype imputation with ethnically matched reference panel for rare variant association analyses

finding: This SNP was associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D) as reported in the 1000G imputed dataset. Its significant association was corroborated by strong linkage disequilibrium with rs8047395.
title: Advantages of genotype imputation with ethnically matched reference panel for rare variant association analyses

finding: The ERCC4 rs1799801 variant was linked to platinum response in CRC, highlighting its role as a pharmacogenomic biomarker.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: This SNP was associated with recurrent stones and had connections to the history of gout.
title: GWAS identifies nine nephrolithiasis susceptibility loci related with metabolic metabolic and crystallization pathways

finding: The polymorphism rs2230739 in the AC9 gene was associated with variations in susceptibility to drug treatment in asthma patients, positioning AC9 as a potential drug target for asthma interventions.
title: Structural basis of adenylyl cyclase 9 activation

finding: The study identified a high prevalence of the homozygous single nucleotide variant rs7187376C/C in patients with autism spectrum disorders (ASD). A de novo partial deletion of CDH11 was also observed in a case of non-syndromic ASD, suggesting the significance of CDH11 in these conditions.
title: Identification of CDH11 as an ASD risk gene by matched-gene co-expression analysis and mouse behavioral studies

finding: The finding described rs72785165 (chr16:68755635:T>A) as the candidate causal variant for the HbA1c levels, correlated with differential isoform usage of CDH3 during pancreas development.
title: Disease-associated regulatory variation often displays plasticity or temporal-specificity in fetal pancreas

finding: The SNP rs4774 in the MHC2TA gene was positively associated with the active replication of HHV-6A in patients with multiple sclerosis. This finding highlighted the role of genetic factors in susceptibility to viral infections that may have neurological implications.
title: Differential susceptibility of neuronal neurotransmitter phenotypes to HHV6 infection

finding: The analysis revealed that rs4784220 from the TOX3 gene contributed significantly to breast cancer risk in a combined method, demonstrating a strengthened association compared to previous reports.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: The analysis found that rs8046979 was significantly weighted in the DOT statistic within the TOX3 gene region, indicating its potential as a new risk variant for breast cancer.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: The assessment identified rs43143 as a new possible association with breast cancer risk, showcasing its importance in the context of the analysis around the TOX3 gene.
title: DOT: Gene-set analysis by combining decorrelated association statistics

finding: Similarly, the SNP rs439967 was also found to be loosely associated with type 2 diabetes in a European population, with a significant p-value of 2 × 10−6. This finding underscored the importance of ASRA genetic variants in influencing metabolic health and possibly contributing to leptin resistance.
title: A brown fat-enriched adipokine, ASRA, is a leptin receptor antagonist that stimulates appetite

finding: The SNP rs12102760 was tied to the transcriptional regulation of cancer dynamics, particularly relating to how cellular pH alterations affect cancer metabolism. This finding was linked to the overall metabolic changes during tumor development and the resulting extracellular acidification.
title: Computational investigation of missense somatic mutations in cancer and potential links to pH-dependence and proteostasis

finding: The SNP rs11642841, located at the FTO locus, was noted for its effect on body mass index (BMI). After excluding this SNP due to its main effect on BMI, it was reported that a total of 15 SNPs at fasting plasma glucose (FPG)-associated loci and 38 SNPs at type 2 diabetes (T2D)-associated loci remained for analysis in both the HAPO and DIP studies. This exclusion highlighted the focus on SNPs directly linked to fasting glucose and type 2 diabetes rather than confounding factors such as BMI.
title: All thresholds of maternal hyperglycaemia from the WHO 2013 criteria for gestational diabetes identify women with a higher genetic risk for type 2 diabetes

finding: SNP rs6498021, located close to IL21R, was associated with allergy and asthma, indicating its relevance in immune regulation.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: Linked with allergy and asthma, rs6498019 was found in chromatin accessibility regions associated particularly with B cells.
title: Integrated single-cell transcriptomics and epigenomics reveals strong germinal center-associated etiology of autoimmune risk loci

finding: FTO rs9939609 was identified as a key SNP associated with the risk of being overweight. The average BMI increase per A allele was 0.3 kg/m2. In the NFBC cohort, the risk of being overweight (BMI > 25 kg/m2) was 41% in TT, 44% in AT, and 48% in AA genotypes. The influence of FTO on BMI was found to be minor, explaining only about 0.4% of the variability in BMI, with a specific likelihood of null effect (no increase in BMI due to FTO genotype) being 96.8% for AT and 92.8% for AA genotypes.
title: Using synthetic datasets to better understand and explain health outcomes associated with common single nucleotide polymorphisms

finding: The SNP rs1421085 was found to have a FORGEdb score of 9, indicating strong evidence for its functional relevance in gene regulation. This score was derived from various sources of evidence including eQTL associations with IRX3, chromatin looping interactions (ABC), transcription factor (TF) motifs, DNase I hotspot overlap, and histone mark broadPeaks. Furthermore, independent experimental analyses supported its regulatory role in the modulation of white vs. beige adipocyte proliferation through the targets IRX3 and IRX5.
title: FORGEdb: systematic analysis of candidate causal variants to uncover target genes and mechanisms in complex traits

finding: The study referenced SNP rs12103023 in connection with the KEAP1-NRF2 pathway in the context of non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC). It was established that mutations in this pathway, including those associated with this SNP, were prevalent in a significant proportion of NSCLC cases, leading to therapeutic resistance and poor patient outcomes. The research indicated a complex relationship where while NRF2 activation could initiate lung tumor formation alongside Kras mutations, it could hinder progression to more advanced tumor grades, thus highlighting its potential role as a critical factor in lung tumorigenesis.
title: Distinct Nrf2 Signaling Thresholds Mediate Lung Tumor Initiation and Progression

finding: The frequency of G allele in rs17822931 (ABCC11) was significantly higher in Amami-Oshima island (0.311) compared to Hondo cluster (0.121) with a P-value of less than 0.001. The frequency was not significantly different from the Ryukyu cluster (0.258) (P=0.123). In Kikai island, the G allele frequency dropped to 0.118, significantly lower than both Amami-Oshima island and Ryukyu cluster, but not significantly different from Hondo cluster. This difference may suggest population specific adaptations or influences.
title: Genetic lineage of the Amami islanders inferred from classical genetic markers

finding: The variant rs1065656 was identified as a cis-eQTL associated with FAHD1, which is implicated in metabolic and aging pathways related to insulin-like growth factor (IGF). This finding was significant as it suggested that the genetic variant may contribute to variations in circulating IGF-I and IGFBP-3 concentrations, linking it to oxidative stress pathways.
title: A decade of epigenetic change in aging twins: genetic and environmental contributions to longitudinal DNA methylation

finding: The SNP rs12932935 was associated with an intronic region of Rbfox1, which exhibited significant chromatin decondensation (melting) after cocaine exposure. Specifically, its melting score increased from 43 at day 1 to 125 at day 14 post-cocaine exposure. This change occurred in the context of Rbfox1 being a key gene involved in cocaine addiction and its splicing after multiple treatments in the nucleus accumbens (NAc). Its melting indicated potential transcription factor binding, suggesting involvement in long-term epigenetic reorganization.
title: A single dose of cocaine rewires the 3D genome structure of midbrain dopamine neurons

finding: The rs77924615 variant was recognized as another putative functional regulatory variant, confirmed through fine-mapping and colocalization analysis. High-quality samples displayed optimal alignment of an open-chromatin peak with this SNP, whereas lower quality samples failed to identify corresponding peaks, underscoring the utility of high-quality data in regulatory element identification.
title: Quality assessment and refinement of chromatin accessibility data using a sequence-based predictive model

finding: This SNP was identified as one of the top lead eQTLs in pancreas tissue and demonstrated a significant association with the HsInv0030 inversion region, which implicated it in the expression changes of the CTRB1 gene.
title: Functional and evolutionary impact of polymorphic inversions in the human genome

finding: Similar to rs9928842, this SNP was also found associated with gene expression changes in the vicinity of the HsInv0030 region and implicated in the expression variations of the CTRB2 gene.
title: Functional and evolutionary impact of polymorphic inversions in the human genome

finding: This SNP was in almost perfect linkage disequilibrium (LD) with the HsInv0031 inversion and was associated with decreased expression of the FAM92B gene in the cerebellum. It also correlated with Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: Functional and evolutionary impact of polymorphic inversions in the human genome

finding: The SNP rs1421085 was confirmed to have a causal and experimentally validated association with body mass index (BMI). It was located in the FTO gene and showed regulatory effects on the IRX5 and IRX3 genes. This variant exhibited extremely high evolutionary constraint with a phyloP score of 6.31, leading to a posterior inclusion probability (PIP) of 0.84 when using the baseline-LF+Zoonomia model.
title: Leveraging Base Pair Mammalian Constraint to Understand Genetic Variation and Human Disease

finding: In the context of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC), the SNP rs12051089 was found to be relevant in the study by Kudo et al., where it was associated with the efficacy of combined immunotherapy involving PD-1/PD-L1 antibodies and VEGF inhibitors. This finding underscored the genetic factors that could influence therapeutic outcomes in advanced HCC patients.
title: Cancer cell genetics shaping of the tumor microenvironment reveals myeloid cell-centric exploitable vulnerabilities in hepatocellular carcinoma

finding: The SNP rs12103023 was found to be associated with the regulation of anti-oxidant response genes in the context of HLRCC, specifically through its interaction with the transcription factor FOXA2, which is critical for metabolic rewiring in FH-deficient cells. This association highlights the role of this SNP in modulating cellular responses to fumarate accumulation and provides a potential target for therapeutic intervention in HLRCC.
title: FOXA2 controls the anti-oxidant response in FH-deficient cells

finding: This ERCC4 SNP was associated with a highly conserved residue linked to breast cancer.
title: Predicting functionally important breast cancer SNPs using pleiotropy, conservation, and protein structure

finding: The L1143P mutation in PALB2 was associated with reduced homologous recombination.
title: Predicting functionally important breast cancer SNPs using pleiotropy, conservation, and protein structure

finding: The variant rs8050061 was identified as a distinct type of regulatory effect associated with diQTL, having a localized impact on transcription initiation at a specific nucleotide. This effect was explained by CLIPNET through a disruption to an initiator motif overlapping the affected position, indicating that the model accurately predicted this localized initiation impact.
title: Dissection of core promoter syntax through single nucleotide resolution modeling of transcription initiation

finding: The SNP rs8062895 was identified as an intronic variant of DHODH, which has been previously linked to cholesterol traits, supporting its relevance in lipid regulation.
title: Genetically regulated gene expression underlies lipid traits in Hispanic cohorts

finding: The SNP rs6498540 was also utilized as an instrumental variable for dihomo-linolenate (DGLA) when assessing its effects on body mass index (BMI). Similar to rs968567, rs6498540 indicated a causal relationship with BMI at the 0.05 significance level, corroborating the effects of DGLA on BMI.
title: Bayesian network analysis incorporating genetic anchors complements conventional Mendelian randomization approaches for exploratory analysis of causal relationships in complex data

finding: The SNP rs4774 in the MHC2TA gene was found to be associated with active replication of HHV-6A in patients with multiple sclerosis. This finding indicated a potential role of the genetic variant in the pathology of multiple sclerosis, particularly in relation to HHV-6A infection.
title: Differential susceptibility of neuronal neurotransmitter phenotypes to HHV6 infection

finding: The intergenic variant rs12921479, an eQTL for TRAPPC2L in the brain, was originally found to be associated with Parkinson's Disease (PD) with a significance level of P = 9.31 × 10^-7 in an autopsy-confirmed cohort of PD. However, in the meta-analyzed PD dataset of this study, its association was only nominal with P = 1.01 × 10^-2.
title: Overlapping Genetic Architecture between Parkinson Disease and Melanoma

finding: Associated with CFDP1, this SNP was validated through CRISPR experiments that indicated its significant regulatory role on gene expression levels in SMCs, contributing to understanding gene regulation in CAD.
title: Comprehensive identification of coronary artery disease-associated variants regulating vascular smooth muscle cell gene expression

finding: The SNP rs12102850 was associated with the regulation of breast cancer cell adhesion and was identified as an original finding in the context of cellular response to glutathione levels. This study demonstrated that altered glutathione levels could significantly influence cell volume and adhesion processes in breast cancer cells, highlighting the critical role of extracellular glutathione in tumor biology.
title: Role of glutathione on cell adhesion and volume

finding: The SNP rs3198697 was shown to influence the expression of the gene NPIPA5, where the T allele was associated with the gene being switched on across tissues, while the C allele correlated with the gene being switched off. NPIPA5 was also identified as a differentially expressed gene in patients with multiple sclerosis, impacting expression in both blood and brain and being switch-like in nature, with co-expression across all tissue pairs studied.
title: Switch-like Gene Expression Modulates Disease Susceptibility

finding: For the SNP rs201525245, it was found to explain the bimodality of the PKD1P5 gene, with the C allele associated with the gene being switched on and the G allele associated with the gene being switched off. This exemplifies the role of this SNP in regulating the expression state of PKD1P5.
title: Switch-like Gene Expression Modulates Disease Susceptibility

finding: The rs6564851-T allele was identified to increase BCO1 activity and led to a reduction in total cholesterol and non-HDL-C levels in comparison to individuals with two copies of the rs6564851-G variant. This finding highlighted the role of BCO1 activity as a novel regulator of plasma lipid profile, linking variations in the BCO1 gene to alterations in circulating carotenoids and lipid metabolism in humans.
title: β-carotene accelerates resolution of atherosclerosis by promoting regulatory T cell expansion in the atherosclerotic lesion

finding: The SNP rs12051094 was linked to the effects of beta-blockers on the melanoma microenvironment, with findings indicating that this SNP might play a role in disease survival. The study highlighted how the presence of this SNP could modify the immune landscape in melanoma patients undergoing treatment.
title: Intracranial tumors elicit systemic sympathetic hyperactivity that limits immunotherapeutic responses

finding: The SNP rs12102773 was identified in the context of altered sperm sncRNA expression and DNA methylation profiles associated with childhood maltreatment exposure (CME). The study highlighted that high CME was related to significant changes in specific tRNA-derived small RNAs, including the epigenetic regulator miRNA hsa-mir-34c-5p, which was implicated in brain development. This finding suggested a potential link between rs12102773 and the epigenetic regulation mechanisms that may affect the next generation's central nervous system development.
title: Exposure to childhood maltreatment is associated with changes in sperm small non-coding RNA and DNA methylation profiles

finding: The variant demonstrated significant AEs with higher expression in its reference allele compared to alternate alleles.
title: Massively Parallel Reporter Assay Confirms Regulatory Potential of hQTLs and Reveals Important Variants in Lupus and Other Autoimmune Diseases

finding: This variant also showed AEs, prioritizing it as a candidate causal SNP for SLE and other autoimmune diseases.
title: Massively Parallel Reporter Assay Confirms Regulatory Potential of hQTLs and Reveals Important Variants in Lupus and Other Autoimmune Diseases

finding: The SNP rs2000999 was associated with haptoglobin levels and demonstrated a link to diabetic macrovascular diseases in Chinese patients with type 2 diabetes. This finding was significant as it provided insights into the genetic factors affecting diabetic complications.
title: BMI-CNV: A Bayesian framework for multiple genotyping platforms detection of copy number variation

finding: The SNP rs7196853, found in the RIPOR1 gene at 16q22.1, showed a significant association with the ratio of FEV1 to forced vital capacity (FEV1/FVC), with a p-value of 1.3×10^-16, emphasizing its role in lung function.
title: Immune-mediated genetic pathways resulting in pulmonary function impairment increase lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs750739 in the PIEZO1 gene showed significant effects on FEV1 (p-value of 1.8×10^-10), linking it to the mechanosensory adaptations necessary for lung epithelial and endothelial cells.
title: Immune-mediated genetic pathways resulting in pulmonary function impairment increase lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The rs9806806 SNP demonstrated highly significant differential activity in induced neurons, with specific activity noted in this cell type, influencing the GRIN2A gene expression.
title: Cell type and condition specific functional annotation of schizophrenia associated non-coding genetic variants
