finding: The SNP rs9939609 was confirmed to be significantly associated with Body Mass Index (BMI) in the Pelotas cohort, consistent with previous findings reported in European ancestry populations.
title: Admixture/fine-mapping in Brazilians reveals a West African associated potential regulatory variant (rs114066381) with a strong female-specific effect on body mass- and fat mass-indexes

finding: The SNP rs1558902 showed significant association with Body Mass Index (BMI) in the Pelotas cohort, aligning with prior research established in European populations.
title: Admixture/fine-mapping in Brazilians reveals a West African associated potential regulatory variant (rs114066381) with a strong female-specific effect on body mass- and fat mass-indexes

finding: The SNP rs76416629-G was found to be negatively associated with Body Mass Index (BMI) in the Pelotas cohort within a specific genomic region where African ancestry had a negative impact.
title: Admixture/fine-mapping in Brazilians reveals a West African associated potential regulatory variant (rs114066381) with a strong female-specific effect on body mass- and fat mass-indexes

finding: The SNP rs9930333 was confirmed to be significantly associated with Body Mass Index (BMI) in the Pelotas cohort, consistent with prior GWAS findings.
title: Admixture/fine-mapping in Brazilians reveals a West African associated potential regulatory variant (rs114066381) with a strong female-specific effect on body mass- and fat mass-indexes

finding: The SNP rs62033400 was found to be associated with Body Mass Index (BMI) in the Pelotas cohort, corroborating results from European ancestry populations.
title: Admixture/fine-mapping in Brazilians reveals a West African associated potential regulatory variant (rs114066381) with a strong female-specific effect on body mass- and fat mass-indexes

finding: The SNP rs8050136 exhibited significant association with Body Mass Index (BMI) in the Pelotas cohort, similar to findings in previous studies.
title: Admixture/fine-mapping in Brazilians reveals a West African associated potential regulatory variant (rs114066381) with a strong female-specific effect on body mass- and fat mass-indexes

finding: The SNP rs3751812 was confirmed to be significantly associated with Body Mass Index (BMI) in the Pelotas cohort, indicating its relevance in controlling this phenotype.
title: Admixture/fine-mapping in Brazilians reveals a West African associated potential regulatory variant (rs114066381) with a strong female-specific effect on body mass- and fat mass-indexes

finding: The SNP rs138628476 (p.Gly169Glu) was reported to cause male subfertility in a mouse model, establishing its pathogenic potential.
title: In vivo versus in silico assessment of potentially pathogenic missense variants in human reproductive genes

finding: The SNP rs12103023 was associated with the KEAP1-NRF2 pathway, impacting non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) dynamics. Specific mutations related to this SNP contributed to chronic Nrf2 stabilization, which was shown to influence tumor initiation but also impaired the progression to advanced-grade tumors when assessed in the context of murine models with the Kras<sup>G12D/+</sup> mutation. Furthermore, in KEAP1 mutant NSCLC cell lines, NRF2 overexpression linked to this SNP was shown to have detrimental effects on cell proliferation and viability, indicating a critical role in cancer progression.
title: Distinct Nrf2 Signaling Thresholds Mediate Lung Tumor Initiation and Progression

finding: In the ABCC1 gene, rs2062541 showed associations with glutarylcarnitine (C5-DC), highlighting its role in carnitine metabolism.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: The variant rs889398 was part of the findings linking lifetime smoking to waist-hip ratio (WHR<sub>adjBMI</sub>). This indicates its significance in the genetic basis of smoking-related obesity metrics.
title: Estimating the causal relationship between smoking and abdominal adiposity using Mendelian randomization

finding: The variant rs1050847 was identified within the context of box smoking leading to changes in waist circumference (WC<sub>adjBMI</sub>). It was linked to the genetic basis of abdominal fat accumulation.
title: Estimating the causal relationship between smoking and abdominal adiposity using Mendelian randomization

finding: The allele associated with rs12051315 was found to correlate with DNA repair defects in high-grade serous ovarian carcinomas (HGSOC), indicating its potential role in influencing the sensitivity of ovarian cancer to platinum-based therapies.
title: Collective amoeboid dynamics drives colonization of drug-resistant ovarian cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs12051094 was found to impact the melanoma microenvironment and disease survival in humans. The corresponding study indicated that the presence of this SNP was associated with better survival rates in melanoma patients receiving treatment that included beta-blockers, supporting the need for further investigation into the role of genetic markers in therapeutic responses.
title: Glioblastoma and other intracranial tumors elicit systemic sympathetic hyperactivity that limits immunotherapeutic responses

finding: The SNP rs77870048 exhibited associations with two traits in opposite directions, reinforcing its significance in the context of differing blood pressure traits.
title: Multivariate Genomewide Association Analysis with IHT

finding: The rs876661305 variant produced a frame-shift mutation in PARN, another novel gene implicated in short telomere syndrome and associated strongly with telomere length.
title: Novel genetic determinants of telomere length from a trans-ethnic analysis of 109,122 whole genome sequences in TOPMed

finding: The SNP rs57790054, located in 16p12.3, was significantly associated with several growth and body mass phenotypes as well as alcohol intake frequency, with extremely low P-values (P < 4E-10). It was identified as an eQTL for the gene KNOP1, and another SNP in high linkage disequilibrium (LD), rs72771074, was associated with alcohol use disorder (P = 5E-8). This highlights its relevance in studies related to body mass index (BMI) and addiction.
title: Diverse functions associate with trans-species polymorphisms in humans

finding: The SNP rs72771074, in high LD (R2=0.89) with rs57790054, was previously associated with alcohol use disorder in a European cohort (P = 5E-8). It emphasizes the role of these TSPs in addiction behaviors, particularly in relation to how genetic variation influences alcohol-related traits.
title: Diverse functions associate with trans-species polymorphisms in humans

finding: The SNP rs7196853, related to the gene RIPOR1 at 16q22.1, was significantly linked to the ratio of FEV1 to forced vital capacity (FEV1/FVC), with a p-value of 1.3×10^-16. This finding provided insights into the genetic factors affecting lung function parameters.
title: Immune-mediated genetic pathways resulting in pulmonary function impairment increase lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs750739, which is within the PIEZO1 gene, showed significant association with FEV1 (p=1.8×10^-10). The finding indicated the importance of this mechano-sensory ion channel in the adaptation and repair mechanisms of lung tissues.
title: Immune-mediated genetic pathways resulting in pulmonary function impairment increase lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The N-centiSNP rs4784812 was validated as having regulatory function, altering binding for six transcription factors, including NF-Y and ELK4. It was identified in a region of adaptive introgression with significant evidence based on RD and Q95 statistics (p-values of 0.046 and 0.040), suggesting its role in gene expression modulation in response to environmental factors.
title: A signature of Neanderthal introgression on molecular mechanisms of environmental responses

finding: The SNP rs4362387 was recognized as a GTEx eQTL for SPIRE2 and MC1R, both of which showed upregulation by Vitamin D. The Neanderthal allele led to increased expression of these genes in skin tissues, and its effects were consistent with findings from Massively Parallel Reporter Assay (MPRA) data, indicating its crucial role in gene regulation related to pigmentation and possibly childhood sunburn.
title: A signature of Neanderthal introgression on molecular mechanisms of environmental responses

finding: The predicted LOF variant c.1648G>A (rs563131364) in the SLC12A3 gene, which encodes a sodium-chloride co-transporter, was strongly associated with increased risk for several phenotypes, including severe chronic kidney disease (p=0.001, LO=1.723, ICD=N184), abnormal blood chemistry (p=0.003, LO=1.189, ICD=R7989), and retinal edema (p=0.006, LO=2.377, ICD=H3581). The variant was also protective against pure hypercholesterolemia (p=0.0396, LO=-1.512, ICD=E7800). It had a CADD PHRED score of 29.3 and an MSC 95 CI of 13.89, indicating pathogenicity in the context of SLC12A3.
title: Genome-wide prediction of pathogenic gain- and loss-of-function variants from ensemble learning of a diverse feature set

finding: The predicted GOF variant c.7471C>T (rs201746476) in the PIEZO1 gene, which encodes a mechanosensitive ion channel, was associated with increased risk for palpitations (p=0.009, LO=2.912, ICD=R002), abdominal pain (p=0.028, LO=1.842, ICD=R109), and susceptibility to viral hepatitis C (p=0.039, LO=2.438, ICD=B182; p=0.043, LO=2.389, ICD=B1920). This variant had a CADD PHRED score of 25.4, exceeding the MSC 95 CI of 2.185 for PIEZO1.
title: Genome-wide prediction of pathogenic gain- and loss-of-function variants from ensemble learning of a diverse feature set

finding: The SNP rs12051172 was originally found to be associated with angiogenesis in the context of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC). It was noted that the angiogenesis process was crucial for tumor growth and metastasis, highlighting the significance of the associated genetic variations in understanding HCC pathophysiology. The finding was emphasized due to its implication in therapeutic strategies targeting angiogenesis in HCC.
title: AATF Inhibition Exerts Antiangiogenic Effects Against Human Hepatocellular Carcinoma

finding: The SNP rs8061552 was associated with significant allelic differences in both K562 and SH-SY5Y cell lines, contributing to the broader understanding of gene regulation dynamics in the context of schizophrenia and Alzheimer’s disease.
title: A screen of 1,049 schizophrenia and 30 Alzheimer’s-associated variants for regulatory potential

finding: This SNP, an intronic variant in the GPR139 gene, was significantly associated with changes in lateral ventricle volume. The study identified it as a robust finding in both phase 1 and phase 2 analyses, emphasizing its relevance to brain morphology.
title: Age-dependent genetic variants associated with longitudinal changes in brain structure across the lifespan

finding: Identified as a top SNP with an age-independent effect, this intron variant of GPR139 was linked to changes in lateral ventricle volume, reinforcing its importance in brain structure evolution.
title: Age-dependent genetic variants associated with longitudinal changes in brain structure across the lifespan

finding: The rs193778 variant was part of the 99% credible set for the 16q13.13 T1D locus and demonstrated significant association with T1D. It mapped to a conserved cytokine-responsive regulatory element and showed higher enhancer activity in cytokine-exposed beta cells with the T1D-associated G allele compared to the protective A allele. This locus involved several upregulated genes that could be potential targets, including DEXI, which was suggested as a candidate gene for T1D in islet cells.
title: The impact of pro-inflammatory cytokines on the β-cell regulatory landscape provides new insights into the genetics of type 1 diabetes

finding: The variant rs587776991 (T2127M) was a gain of function variant that slowed inactivation kinetics of PIEZO1. It was associated with lower levels of HbA1c in patients with dehydrated hereditary stomatocytosis, indicating a potential link to red blood cell disorders.
title: Identifying interpretable gene-biomarker associations with functionally informed kernel-based tests in 190,000 exomes

finding: This SNP was a G/A substitution located in a peak linked to JPH3, encoding junctophilin-3, which is important for neuronal excitability. The variant was shown to abolish the activity of a luciferase reporter linked to JPH3, suggesting its critical role in gene regulation relevant to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Single nucleus multiomics identifies ZEB1 and MAFB as candidate regulators of Alzheimer’s disease-specific cis regulatory elements

finding: The SNP rs12051178 had been identified in a study focusing on metastatic prostate cancer, suggesting a potential link between genetic variants and therapeutic decision-making. The context of this finding indicated that variants at this locus could influence treatment outcomes in cancer, although specific physiological implications in relation to Puffy Snout Syndrome (PSS) were not directly discussed.
title: Transcriptomics Reveals Tumorigenesis and Pathogen Response in Scombrid Puffy Snout Syndrome

finding: The most significant interaction QTL for the percentage of triglycerides in large VLDL (L_VLDL_TG_pct) was identified as rs3816117. This variant was annotated as a modifier variant for cholesteryl ester transfer protein (CETP), a drug target aimed at altering lipid levels. Similar to other variants, rs3816117 showed stronger genetic associations with metabolite levels in controls than in T2D patients, indicating that its effect on L_VLDL_TG_pct was mitigated in those with diabetes.
title: Insights into the metabolic consequences of type 2 diabetes

finding: The variant rs587776991 (16:88719665:G:A, T2127M) was identified as a gain of function variant in PIEZO1 that slowed down inactivation kinetics in patients with dehydrated hereditary stomatocytosis. This variant was associated with decreased levels of HbA1c, consistent with previous observations in red blood cell disorders.
title: Identifying interpretable gene-biomarker associations with functionally informed kernel-based tests in 190,000 exomes

finding: The rs1421085 T>C variant within the FTO gene was identified as a functional variant linked to thermogenic capacity in knockout mice models. Specifically, mice carrying the C-alleles exhibited increased thermogenic activity and resistance to obesity when subjected to a high-fat diet (HFD). Furthermore, in human studies, this variant was associated with lower birthweight and its frequency displayed an increase aligned with diminishing environmental temperatures, suggesting an evolutionary adaptation related to early human migrations from warmer to colder climates.
title: The rs1421085 variant within FTO promotes but not inhibits thermogenesis and is potentially associated with human migration

finding: A significant association was found between the SLC7A5 SNP (rs28582913) and plasma levels of the metabolite 7-Cl-KYNA, with the recessive effect of this SNP leading to approximately 46% lower concentrations of 7-Cl-KYNA in individuals with two 'C' alleles compared to other genotypes.
title: Role of transporters and enzymes in metabolism and distribution of 4 chlorokynurenine and metabolites

finding: This SNP was also among the high severity SNPs implicated in Parkinson disease, reinforcing the link between genetic factors and nervous system disease development.
title: Genetic variability in pathways associates with pesticide-induced nervous system disease in the United States

finding: The SNP rs11559000 was associated with several clinically important erythroid traits. This finding emerged from an analysis of the GeneATLAS database, which indicated a significant association with p-values ranging from 10^{-2} to 10^{-5}, suggesting its potential relevance in erythropoiesis.
title: Identification of MAZ as a novel transcription factor regulating erythropoiesis

finding: The SNP rs572982482 displayed a strong association with clinically relevant erythroid traits according to the GeneATLAS study. The observed p-values fell between 10^{-2} and 10^{-5}, highlighting its role as a significant genetic variant in the context of erythroid differentiation.
title: Identification of MAZ as a novel transcription factor regulating erythropoiesis

finding: The SNP rs72798129 was linked to clinically important erythroid traits based on findings from the GeneATLAS database. This variant also showed p-values in the range of 10^{-2} to 10^{-5}, underscoring its potential impact in erythropoiesis and erythroid differentiation.
title: Identification of MAZ as a novel transcription factor regulating erythropoiesis

finding: The SNP rs12102871 was found to be significantly associated with high G2M pathway scores in pancreatic cancer, correlating with worse survival outcomes, particularly after margin-positive resections. This was highlighted in the study by Oshi et al. (2020a), which underscored its relevance in cancer prognosis.
title: Mass spectrometry-based proteomic exploration of diverse murine macrophage cellular models

finding: The SNP rs9939609 was confirmed to be associated with BMI in the Pelotas cohort. This association was recognized as emblematic due to its reported high effects on BMI-related traits.
title: Admixture/fine-mapping in Brazilians reveals a West African associated potential regulatory variant (rs114066381) with a strong female-specific effect on body mass- and fat mass-indexes

finding: Similar to rs9939609, rs1558902 was also replicated in its association with BMI in the Pelotas cohort, contributing to the understanding of genetic influences on BMI.
title: Admixture/fine-mapping in Brazilians reveals a West African associated potential regulatory variant (rs114066381) with a strong female-specific effect on body mass- and fat mass-indexes

finding: The SNP rs76416629 located upstream of the NOD2 gene demonstrated a negative association with BMI in the Pelotas cohort, indicating that ancestry-related variants can influence BMI in different ways.
title: Admixture/fine-mapping in Brazilians reveals a West African associated potential regulatory variant (rs114066381) with a strong female-specific effect on body mass- and fat mass-indexes

finding: The SNP rs9930333 was part of six FTO SNPs confirmed for their association with BMI in the Pelotas cohort, reinforcing the relevance of known BMI-associated SNPs in Brazilian populations.
title: Admixture/fine-mapping in Brazilians reveals a West African associated potential regulatory variant (rs114066381) with a strong female-specific effect on body mass- and fat mass-indexes

finding: This SNP was confirmed for its association with BMI in the Pelotas cohort, alongside other FTO SNPs, highlighting the genetic factors influencing body weight.
title: Admixture/fine-mapping in Brazilians reveals a West African associated potential regulatory variant (rs114066381) with a strong female-specific effect on body mass- and fat mass-indexes

finding: The SNP rs8050136 was also confirmed for its association with BMI in Pelotas, contributing to the repertoire of genetic markers associated with weight.
title: Admixture/fine-mapping in Brazilians reveals a West African associated potential regulatory variant (rs114066381) with a strong female-specific effect on body mass- and fat mass-indexes

finding: This SNP was confirmed to be associated with BMI in the Pelotas cohort, consistent with findings in other studies regarding its role in obesity.
title: Admixture/fine-mapping in Brazilians reveals a West African associated potential regulatory variant (rs114066381) with a strong female-specific effect on body mass- and fat mass-indexes

finding: The SNP rs891134 was associated with the expression of the ADAMTS18 gene. This interaction was identified through the Principal Interaction Component 2 (PIC2) analysis, demonstrating that the eQTL effect depended on the context of PIC2. The effectiveness of this finding was corroborated across samples from both European (EUR) and African (AFR) descent, highlighting its robustness and relevance in diverse populations.
title: Unbiased identification of unknown cellular and environmental factors that mediate eQTLs using principal interaction component analysis

finding: The SNP rs12103017 was implicated in mitochondrial dynamics associated with CAFs and cancer cell interactions. Its positive finding connected mitochondrial function to the tumor progression mediated by fibroblasts, highlighting its relevance in breast cancer ecosystems.
title: Targeting of MCL-1 in breast cancer associated fibroblasts reverses their myofibroblastic phenotype and pro-invasive properties

finding: In the CDH1/3 locus, rs4420522 was identified as a common likely causal variant influencing eQTL, meQTL, sQTL, and melanoma risk, highlighting its role in regulating neighboring gene expressions.
title: Cell-type-specific meQTL extends melanoma GWAS annotation beyond eQTL and informs melanocyte gene regulatory mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs12051341 was associated with the efficacy of small molecule KRAS inhibitors in the context of pancreatic cancer therapy. Its relevance was highlighted through discussions in the paper by Gillson et al. (2020), emphasizing its potential impact on treatment responses and the targeted therapy landscape.
title: Single Cell Proteomics Using a Trapped Ion Mobility Time-of-Flight Mass Spectrometer Provides Insight into the Post-translational Modification Landscape of Individual Human Cells

finding: The SNP rs10468280 at the FTO locus was found to be significantly associated with sex, with the BMI-increasing allele observed at a higher frequency in males compared to females (OR 1.02 [1.02-1.03], P=4.4×10^-36). This finding was supported by similar results in the UK Biobank study, which indicated a consistent effect and suggested potential causal relationships between BMI and sex participation differences.
title: Genetic analyses identify widespread sex-differential participation bias

finding: The SNP rs2010 was part of the plasmid ars2-3363, which underwent modification by promoter deletion, indicating a direct involvement in studying DNA replication origins.
title: Characterization of DNA replicators of a 75-kb region of Chromosome 2 of fission yeast, Schizosacharomyces pombe

finding: The SNP rs6498140 was identified as having the strongest evidence for its impact on enhancer activity associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD). The alternate allele of rs6498140, located proximal to the gene CLEC16A, was found to exhibit the highest regulatory activity in both brain tissue and HMC3. This finding was significant because the alternate allele created a MEF2 transcription factor binding site motif within the enhancer, suggesting that MEF2 plays an active role in transcription regulation in brain and microglia. Additionally, rs6498140 displayed marginal eQTL associations in various tissues, including the frontal cortex, where it correlated with increased expression of CLEC16A.
title: An in vivo massively parallel platform for deciphering tissue-specific regulatory function

finding: The SNP rs57348955 was associated with Graves' disease (GRD) and demonstrated the shared genetic risk across different AiDs highlighted in the study.
title: Unravelling the shared genetic mechanisms underlying 18 autoimmune diseases using a systems approach

finding: The SNP rs12445568 was found in relation to Psoriasis (PSO) and contributed to the characterization of shared genetic factors among multiple autoimmune diseases.
title: Unravelling the shared genetic mechanisms underlying 18 autoimmune diseases using a systems approach

finding: The SNP rs10782001 was associated with Psoriasis (PSO) and highlighted as a shared genetic factor influencing multiple autoimmune diseases.
title: Unravelling the shared genetic mechanisms underlying 18 autoimmune diseases using a systems approach

finding: The SNP rs13708 was linked with Psoriasis (PSO) and served as part of the shared genetic framework identified in the analysis of autoimmune diseases.
title: Unravelling the shared genetic mechanisms underlying 18 autoimmune diseases using a systems approach

finding: The SNP rs11150610 was connected to Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) and emphasized the shared genetic architecture among autoimmune disorders.
title: Unravelling the shared genetic mechanisms underlying 18 autoimmune diseases using a systems approach

finding: The SNP rs12708715 was specifically linked to Primary Biliary Cholangitis (PBC) and was found to interact significantly with other proteins related to autoimmune disease pathways.
title: Unravelling the shared genetic mechanisms underlying 18 autoimmune diseases using a systems approach

finding: The rs153109 polymorphism in the Interleukin-27 was linked to susceptibility and prognosis of aplastic anemia, hinting at immune modulation relevant to inflammatory conditions such as IBD.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and enriched pathways in inflammatory bowel disease using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs1421085 located in the intronic region of the FTO gene was found to critically contribute to the development of the thermogenic phenotype in adipocytes. Specifically, the homozygous C/C obesity-risk genotype was associated with decreased expression of nearby genes IRX3 and IRX5, resulting in less thermogenic adipocyte phenotype. In contrast, the T/T non-obesity risk genotype was linked to a higher thermogenic potential.
title: Regulatory Modules of Human Thermogenic Adipocytes: Functional Genomics of Meta-Analyses Derived Marker-Genes

finding: The rs1805007 SNP in the MC1R gene was associated with red hair color, with a genome-wide significance level of P < 1 × 10⁻⁵⁰⁰⁰.
title: Analysis of genetic dominance in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs8060054 was associated with the regulation of Wnt receptor turnover, particularly concerning its interaction with the R-spondin-ZNRF3/RNF43 signaling module. This regulation was found to be crucial for intestinal stem cell homeostasis and Paneth cell progenitor differentiation, demonstrating that alterations at this locus could impact Wnt signaling pathways that are fundamental for maintaining the balance of intestinal stem cells.
title: Intestinal Paneth cell differentiation relies on asymmetric regulation of Wnt signaling by Daam1/2

finding: The SNP rs12051173 was associated with the secretion of matrix metalloproteinases (MMPs) by breast fibroblasts, which played a critical role in breast cancer cell migration as reported by Lugo-Cintrón et al. (2020). This highlighted the importance of this SNP in influencing ECM component interactions that modulate cancer cell behavior.
title: EMT-dependent cell-matrix interactions are linked to unjamming transitions in cancer spheroid invasion

finding: This SNP, which causes a stop-gain in the ACSM2A gene and completely abolishes its catalytic activity, was associated with higher plasma concentrations of indolepropionic acid. It was noted to be more common in the Japanese population, with a MAF of 0.045 in the IGSR dataset and 0.012 in gnomAD. This discrepancy was attributed to the significantly lower representation of East Asian individuals in gnomAD.
title: Allele Dispersion Score: Quantifying the range of allele frequencies across populations, based on UMAP

finding: The variant rs2541645 was identified as the most significantly associated <italic>cis</italic>-pQTL for the HBZ pGene in the African American population, though it did not show similar significance in the European American population. This SNP was observed to have a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.32 in EA compared to 0.18 in AA, indicating population-specific allele frequency variations. Additionally, it acted as a strong eQTL for HBZ expression in whole blood, with an extremely low p-value (6.7×10<sup>-80</sup>). The SNP was also linked to multiple erythrocyte-related outcomes in the UK Biobank, specifically with mean corpuscular hemoglobin (p-value 1.1×10<sup>-14</sup>) and reticulocyte fraction of red cells (p-value 3.2×10<sup>-9</sup>). These results suggested that rs2541645 might function as a regulatory variant for HBZ protein levels and necessitated further investigation into its implications on related phenotypic effects, especially in the context of blood mechanisms and thalassemia.
title: Large Bi-Ethnic Study of Plasma Proteome Leads to Comprehensive Mapping of cis-pQTL and Models for Proteome-wide Association Studies

finding: The SNP rs2066844, a missense variant in the NOD2 gene, was identified as a leading causal variant associated with Crohn's disease and inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). Its significant role was confirmed across various neural network interpretation methods.
title: Detecting Genetic Interactions with Visible Neural Networks

finding: The SNP rs2066845, another missense variant in the NOD2 gene, was reported as part of a top epistatic pair with rs2066844, both linked to Crohn's disease and IBD, underscoring its significance in the context of these conditions.
title: Detecting Genetic Interactions with Visible Neural Networks

finding: SNP rs761726261 was implicated in strongly disrupting CEBPB regulation of HMOX2, a potential risk gene in AD pathogenesis.
title: Predicting gene regulatory networks from multi-omics to link genetic risk variants and neuroimmunology to Alzheimer’s disease phenotypes

finding: This SNP was found to strongly disrupt CEBPB regulation of HMOX2 as well, associating with potential implications in AD.
title: Predicting gene regulatory networks from multi-omics to link genetic risk variants and neuroimmunology to Alzheimer’s disease phenotypes

finding: SNP rs537044906 was documented to disrupt RFX2 regulation of HMOX2 in the Hippocampus, further linking it to AD risk pathways.
title: Predicting gene regulatory networks from multi-omics to link genetic risk variants and neuroimmunology to Alzheimer’s disease phenotypes

finding: This SNP was highlighted for disrupting SPI1 regulation of HMOX2, reinforcing the role of non-coding SNPs in AD pathogenesis.
title: Predicting gene regulatory networks from multi-omics to link genetic risk variants and neuroimmunology to Alzheimer’s disease phenotypes

finding: This missense variant in PIEZO1 was reported to be associated with higher haemoglobin concentration, showing an effect of 0.36 s.d. in the XSA cohort (freq = 3.65% XSA, p = 8.1·10⁻¹⁹). It was imputed into the XSA population with high imputation information (0.99).
title: The sequences of 150,119 genomes in the UK biobank

finding: In the context of HDL cholesterol, rs1800775 was replicated with a PIP of 1.00, demonstrating a strong association with HDL levels in both the Framingham Heart Study and the UK Biobank cohort.
title: Multi-scale Inference of Genetic Trait Architecture using Biologically Annotated Neural Networks

finding: SNP rs11866312 located in an intron of ABCC11 was identified as a likely candidate for altered binding motifs of transcription factors, particularly FOXA1, which is important for liver-specific gene regulation. SuRE data indicated minimal effect in K562 cells, aligning with the predicted functional context of this SNP.
title: Systematic identification of human SNPs affecting regulatory element activity

finding: SNP rs12051108 had a positive original finding related to acquired resistance to Trastuzumab in HER2-positive breast cancer, specifically implicating YAP1/TEAD in this resistance mechanism.
title: Structure-based discovery of a novel small-molecule inhibitor of TEAD palmitoylation with anticancer activity

finding: In a Spanish patient cohort, the CETP polymorphism rs1800775 (629A) was found to reduce CETP lipid transfer activity by 21-51% as compared to wild type CETP. This reduction was associated with a lower risk of Alzheimer's disease among patients expressing the apolipoprotein E isoform 4 (APOE4), which signifies a significant protective effect against cognitive decline related to Alzheimer’s.
title: CETP inhibitor evacetrapib enters mouse brain tissue

finding: The CETP polymorphism rs5882 (I405V) was associated with lower CETP protein expression and higher HDL-C levels, which in turn correlated with exceptional longevity and healthy aging in Ashkenazi Jewish centenarians. This implies that the rs5882 variant may contribute to increased lifespan and decreased risk of Alzheimer’s disease through its effects on lipid metabolism.
title: CETP inhibitor evacetrapib enters mouse brain tissue

finding: A significant association was identified between rs118024138 within the BBS2 gene and HDL cholesterol levels, with a p-value of 5.73e-37. This association was replicated in a meta-analysis and pertains to the role of BBS2 in Bardet-Biedl syndrome, characterized by dyslipidemia, kidney failure, and obesity.
title: Mendelian pathway analysis of laboratory traits reveals distinct roles for ciliary subcompartments in common disease pathogenesis

finding: A significant association was detected for rs9790 within the CLUAP1 gene and serum creatinine levels, with a p-value of 2.56e-12. This finding replicated in meta-analysis; CLUAP1 is linked to conditions similar to Joubert syndrome, wherein renal disease is prevalent.
title: Mendelian pathway analysis of laboratory traits reveals distinct roles for ciliary subcompartments in common disease pathogenesis

finding: The SNP rs8050047 was associated with the adenomatous polyposis coli (APC) gene, which was found to form a complex with CEP290. This complex was important for various cellular functions including microtubule organization and focal adhesion dynamics. The findings linked the genetics of this SNP to the dysfunction observed in non-ciliated cells, which suggested a potential impact on phenotypes related to ciliopathies.
title: Ciliary protein CEP290 regulates focal adhesion via microtubule system in non-ciliated cells1

finding: SNP rs7193181 was linked to the HTR2A gene on chromosome 10, highlighting its relevance to behavioral traits.
title: IDENTIFICATION OF CANDIDATE GENES AND PATHWAYS LINKED TO THE TEMPERAMENT TRAIT IN SHEEP

finding: The SNP rs9927316 was identified within the enhancer of the IRF8 gene and was associated with rheumatoid arthritis. This finding was significant as it highlighted the potential role of the IRF8 PTC in autoimmune disorders, specifically pointing to how PTCs could aid in discovering cell type-specific disease variants through the use of the SEGCOND computational method.
title: Synergistic and antagonistic activities of IRF8 and FOS enhancer pairs during an immune cell fate switch

finding: An association was previously established between the SNP rs3212379, located 120bp upstream of the transcriptional start site of MC1R, and red hair color. Exome sequencing data revealed a high linkage disequilibrium with a new frameshift variant, rs796296176, indicating that rs3212379's association with red hair might involve this novel functional variant.
title: Expanded Analysis of Pigmentation Genetics in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs796296176 was identified as a coding variant causing a frameshift at codon 29 of MC1R and was found in 376 out of 380 individuals with the rs3212379 variant and red hair, suggesting it is likely the functional variant responsible for red hair color.
title: Expanded Analysis of Pigmentation Genetics in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs62053992 was located in the LINC01572 gene on chromosome 16 and had a P value of 4.50 × 10^-8 in the UK Biobank study. It was weakly replicated in the GS:SFHS with a P value of 0.0202 but was not replicated in the TwinsUK cohort.
title: A genome-wide association study finds genetic variants associated with neck or shoulder pain in UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs62032983 was predicted to reduce the expression of the gene DCTN5 across all cell types. The model linked this effect to the disruption of a predicted binding site for the transcription factor ELF1, which is ubiquitously expressed.
title: scooby: Modeling multi-modal genomic profiles from DNA sequence at single-cell resolution

finding: The SNP rs78885610 was mapped to the expression of DNAAF1, where an LPS reQTL was observed. It was noted that LPS treatment changed the strength of the association between rs78885610 and DNAAF1 expression. Specifically, during LPS stimulation compared to baseline, the strength of association was notably reduced, and DNAAF1 was differentially expressed as indicated by a log fold change (LFC) of 1.33 and a highly significant adjusted p-value (< 1e-16), suggesting an important role in microglial responses to LPS.
title: The human microglia responsome: a resource to better understand microglia states in health and disease

finding: The rs72824905 SNP represented a rare protective variant (P522R) in the PLCG2 gene, which was associated with a decreased risk of late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD). It was shown to alter microglial activity, resulting in preserved synaptic integrity and reduced microglial engulfment of synapses, independent of amyloid burden. Furthermore, this variant was also associated with other dementias and increased longevity in centenarian studies, underscoring its potential therapeutic implications in neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Uncoupling of synaptic loss from amyloid burden by an Alzheimer’s disease protective variant of PLCγ2

finding: The SNP rs7192245 was colocalized with the KneeOA GWAS signal, enhancing our understanding of splicing contributions to OA.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: The SNP rs34195470 was marked as an index variant for the KneeOA GWAS signal and was linked to splicing differences mediated by rs7192245.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: The SNP rs9788910 was linked with transcript levels of IL32 and liver enzyme levels, indicating its relevance to NAFLD-related metabolic pathways.
title: Deciphering the genetic links between NAFLD and co-occurring conditions using a liver gene regulatory network

finding: In the study conducted by Diaz-delCastillo et al. in 2020, the SNP rs12102740 was found to be associated with modulation of cancer-induced bone pain in a rat model. This association highlighted the relevance of this SNP in the context of pain pathways potentially linked to CCR2 signaling, as CCR2 inhibition demonstrated significant effects on alleviating pain caused by bone metastases.
title: CCR2-targeting pepducins reduce T cell-nociceptor interaction driving bone cancer pain

finding: SNP rs7499892 was determined to have a similar effect size to rs1800961 and was identified following debiasing in the final model.
title: Iterative Hard Thresholding in GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: SNP rs3764261 was found under the dichotomized HDL model alongside rs9261224 and others.
title: Iterative Hard Thresholding in GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: The variant rs7203922 was linked to the PLLP gene, showing associations in the putamen related to myelin sheath integrity.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: At the UMOD-PDILT locus, the original finding indicated that for each additional A allele, the effect on eGFR decline adjusted for baseline eGFR was 0.092 mls/min/year (95% confidence interval 0.081 - 0.103). After applying the adapted MR-Horse method for bias reduction, this effect was attenuated to 0.067 mls/min/year (equal-tailed 95% credible interval: 0.056 - 0.078), suggesting that the original association had a true effect on kidney function decline.
title: An application of the MR-Horse method to reduce selection bias in genome-wide association studies of disease progression

finding: The SNP rs72824905, located in the PLCG2 gene, was previously reported to be protective against the risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD). In this study, it was found that microglial phenotypes were altered in mouse models with a hypermorphic variant of PLCG2. The research suggested that the role of PLCG2 in AD had not been comprehensively explored, despite its significant implications for immune signaling in the context of AD pathophysiology.
title: Plcg2M28L interacts with high fat-high sugar diet to accelerate Alzheimer’s disease-relevant phenotypes in mice

finding: The SNP rs12102760 was associated with cancer and intracellular pH dynamics, as described in the work by Czowski et al. (2020). This finding highlighted the gene's role in transcriptional regulation linked to pHi changes, which are critical for understanding cancer behaviors.
title: Single-cell intracellular pH measurements reveal cell-cycle linked pH dynamics

finding: This SNP was linked to Retinitis pigmentosa and categorized as 'Likely Pathogenic.' It was found in ORF CATP00000005301.1 and was associated with a mutation that altered the 155th amino acid from Histidine to Tyrosine. The ORF had a high phenotypic score (47.2) and a strong coding prediction when analyzed using the ORF-origin-aware approach. This SNP originated in Boreotheria and its lncRNA gene was associated with melanocytes.
title: De novo birth of functional, human-specific microproteins

finding: The SNP rs12102739 was found to be associated with the role of the POT1 protein in human cancer as reported by Wu et al. in their 2020 study. This research detailed how variations in the POT1 gene, including rs12102739, could impact the stability of telomeres and consequently contribute to cancer development. The study provided evidence of a potential link between this SNP and altered POT1 function, suggesting its relevance in oncogenesis.
title: POT1 Stability and Binding Measured by Fluorescence Thermal Shift Assays

finding: The SNP rs34177108 was identified as marking a locus of genome-wide significance for the NonEA-INC factor. This finding related to a common genetic factor underlying income measures after accounting for the genetic overlap with educational attainment. The locus was previously associated with vitamin D levels and traits concerning hair and skin, suggesting potential links to social factors influenced by physical traits.
title: Associations between common genetic variants and income provide insights about the socioeconomic health gradient

finding: Identified in a 2018 GWAS involving 314,278 participants, rs12444183 was linked to Alzheimer’s disease, marking it as a new risk locus.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: Along with its linked gene PLCG2, rs4985556 was identified from the same 2018 GWAS as a new risk locus for Alzheimer's disease.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: SNP rs7193263 in the intron of the RBFOX1 gene exhibited pleiotropic effects associated with all psychiatric disorders except anorexia nervosa (AN). It was implicated in neuronal development, including synapse formation and migration.
title: Genome wide meta-analysis identifies genomic relationships, novel loci, and pleiotropic mechanisms across eight psychiatric disorders

finding: The T-allele in rs9923231 was associated with a greater risk for vascular dementia, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.28 (p=0.0069). This finding suggested that while the association was significant for vascular dementia, it did not hold for general or Alzheimer dementia. Additionally, the risk of vascular dementia was unaffected by warfarin use in T-allele carriers.
title: Variation in VKORC1 is associated with vascular dementia

finding: The SNP rs551118 showed a significant association with hemoglobin concentration, indicated by a p-value of 5.18e-100 and beta coefficient of -0.0451. It was described as an upstream variant impacting genes related to sickle cell anemia.
title: Low generalizability of polygenic scores in African populations due to genetic and environmental diversity

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with the nearby CpG (cg16218405), which was further linked to the ACD gene. This connection established a cis-meQTL-mediation mechanism whereby the expression influenced by rs28711261 subsequently affected distal CpG sites (cg14343953), highlighting the SNP's role in the complex regulatory landscape.
title: Genetic impacts on DNA methylation help elucidate regulatory genomic processes

finding: The SNP rs8054034 was associated with site cg11024963, demonstrating significant co-localisation events with 13 different genes. The site served as a robust example of how a cis-meQTL can effect DNA methylation levels across multiple genes.
title: Genetic impacts on DNA methylation help elucidate regulatory genomic processes

finding: This SNP co-localised with cis-meQTLs of six CpGs and trans-meQTLs of 16 CpGs across different chromosomes, indicating its involvement in a shared genetic basis affecting multiple regulatory pathways related to methylation.
title: Genetic impacts on DNA methylation help elucidate regulatory genomic processes

finding: Similar to rs9936153, this SNP also co-localised with both cis and trans-meQTLs, showing significant genetic interactions impacting distally located CpG sites and emphasizing its role in the regulatory processes of DNA methylation.
title: Genetic impacts on DNA methylation help elucidate regulatory genomic processes

finding: The SNP rs2059850989 was implicated in cis-meQTL and had associations linked to downstream effects on the DNA methylation landscape, marking it an important variant in understanding methylation variability.
title: Genetic impacts on DNA methylation help elucidate regulatory genomic processes

finding: The SNP rs7187776 co-localised with eQTLs for genes TUFM and SPNS1, indicating its role in mediating effects on methylation and contributing to body mass index and fat distribution traits as previously noted in GWAS.
title: Genetic impacts on DNA methylation help elucidate regulatory genomic processes

finding: The SNP rs6498540 in the PDXDC1 locus was employed as an instrumental variable (IV) for DGLA in the analysis aimed at understanding the causal relationships related to BMI. Its role was part of a broader set of previously reported associations with BMI.
title: Bayesian network analysis complements Mendelian randomization approaches for exploratory analysis of causal relationships in complex data

finding: The rs2066847 variant in the NOD2 gene represented a frameshift mutation (NM_022162.3:c.3019dup) that was causally linked to an increased risk of Crohn’s disease (CD). This was highlighted as the first genetic variant associated with altered CD risk, with the homozygous genotype status showing a very high relative risk of 17.6 compared to wild-type controls.
title: MecCog: A knowledge representation framework for genetic disease mechanism

finding: This SNP was associated with HDL-C and demonstrated a MACIE-regulatory score greater than 0.99, suggesting it may be more functionally important than rs17231506, warranting further investigation.
title: A Multi-dimensional Integrative Scoring Framework for Predicting Functional Regions in the Human Genome

finding: Similar to rs72786786, rs12720926 exhibited a MACIE-regulatory score greater than 0.99 in relation to HDL-C, indicating potential functional significance in the biological mechanisms of the locus.
title: A Multi-dimensional Integrative Scoring Framework for Predicting Functional Regions in the Human Genome

finding: The SNP rs12920150 was identified as a novel locus for hay fever, located near CBLN1 and had a significant association with hay fever.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of 350,000 Caucasians from the UK Biobank identifies novel loci for asthma, hay fever and eczema

finding: The SNP rs35900865 was identified as a significant finding related to HFrEF among African American women in the WHI cohort, with a p-value of less than 5x10^-8.
title: Biological Pathways and Gene Networks Link Inflammation and Vascular Remodeling to Both Heart Failure with Preserved and Reduced Ejection Fraction in Women across Ethnicities

finding: The SNP rs78668964 was also significant for HFpEF among African American women, exhibiting a p-value of less than 5x10^-8.
title: Biological Pathways and Gene Networks Link Inflammation and Vascular Remodeling to Both Heart Failure with Preserved and Reduced Ejection Fraction in Women across Ethnicities

finding: The SNP rs12599260 was associated with HFpEF, concentrated on chromosome 16, corroborated by its central role in identified pathways related to inflammation and vascular remodeling.
title: Biological Pathways and Gene Networks Link Inflammation and Vascular Remodeling to Both Heart Failure with Preserved and Reduced Ejection Fraction in Women across Ethnicities

finding: The SNP rs11647589 was associated with the eGene ACSM5 and linked to the metabolite 3-phenylpropionate. It exhibited eQTL characteristics in 16 different tissues and was located intronically in ACSM5, indicating its regulatory role in the metabolism of this compound.
title: Reconstructing the blood metabolome and genotype using long-range chromatin interactions

finding: The SNP rs6497490 was noted for its association with the eGene ACSM2A and the unknown metabolite X-117478. It was positioned 24.9 Kb from ACSM5 in the tibial artery, representing a distinct eQTL influencing the metabolic pathways associated with ACSM2A.
title: Reconstructing the blood metabolome and genotype using long-range chromatin interactions

finding: The SNP rs1394678 was also associated with ACSM2A and linked to the metabolite indolepropionate. It demonstrated eQTL characteristics in 14 tissues and was located 38.5 Kb from ACSM5, further illustrating its regulatory influence on metabolic processes.
title: Reconstructing the blood metabolome and genotype using long-range chromatin interactions

finding: The rs16955379 polymorphism in the CMIP gene was associated with dyslipidemia, indicating a potential link between genetic variations in CMIP and lipid metabolism disorders. This finding correlated with the observations regarding the protective role of CMIP against lipotoxicity induced by free fatty acids (FFAs), thereby suggesting that this SNP may reflect broader implications for conditions related to dyslipidemia and type 2 diabetes (T2D).
title: FALCON systematically interrogates free fatty acid biology and identifies a novel mediator of lipotoxicity

finding: The C-Maf-inducing protein gene rs2287112 polymorphism was found to be associated with schizophrenia, highlighting its relevance for understanding genetic predispositions to this mental health disorder.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Cardiac Arrest by Integrated Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs8060056 was identified as a significant genetic variant related to the immune response to human alpha-lactalbumin, which has been investigated for its potential role in immunotherapy and primary immunoprevention of triple negative breast cancer. This finding was crucial in understanding how the genetic variation could influence treatment outcomes in cancer, particularly in relation to the apoptotic activities observed with alpha-lactalbumin and oleic acid complexes.
title: Effect of Alpha-Lactalbumin and Lactoferrin Oleic Acid Complexes on Chromatin Structural Organization

finding: SNP rs58726213 was associated with psoriasis and served as an ASB for CREB1 and JUN transcription factors, indicating a reference allele preference for CREB1 and an alternative allele preference for JUN. It was located in the STX4 intron, with STX4 significantly down-regulated in psoriasis. This SNP was also identified as an eQTL for STX4 and HSD3B7, the latter being reported as a psoriasis susceptibility locus.
title: Landscape of allele-specific transcription factor binding in the human genome

finding: The rs6564851-T allele was found to increase BCO1 activity, leading to a reduction in total cholesterol and non-HDL-C compared to individuals with two copies of the rs6564851-G variant. This SNP was also associated with triglyceride levels, highlighting BCO1's role as a novel regulator of plasma lipid profile, which correlates with findings in animal models where beta-carotene-rich diets mitigated the progression of atherosclerosis.
title: β-carotene accelerates the resolution of atherosclerosis in mice

finding: The SNP rs12920150 at CBLN1 was novel for hay fever and detected with significant association in this study.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of 350,000 Caucasians from the UK Biobank identifies novel loci for asthma, hay fever and eczema

finding: The ITGAL_16:30506720G>C variant (rs2230433), which encodes the antithetical epitope of HNA-5a, displayed significant frequency variations among major global subpopulations. Specifically, it was recorded at a frequency of 71.4% in South Asians, 13.4% in East Asians, 30.1% in Europeans, 42.1% in Africans, and 18.9% in Americans. Notably, no alloantibodies against this variant have been reported.
title: Genetic epidemiology of human neutrophil antigen variants suggest significant global variability

finding: The ITGAM_16:31265490G>A substitution (rs1143679) was confirmed as a crucial variant determining the translation of either 61Arg or its antithetical form 61His, with global allele frequencies ranging from 0% to 15%. This finding corroborated previous reports on HNA-4a allele frequencies.
title: Genetic epidemiology of human neutrophil antigen variants suggest significant global variability

finding: The SNP rs12102878 was identified in the context of research related to cancer signaling dynamics. In a computational framework designed for the analysis of RNA sequencing data, it played a role in the prediction and interpretation of mechanisms within the ErbB receptor signaling pathway, which is relevant to cancer biology.
title: Functional annotation-driven unsupervised clustering of single-cell transcriptomes

finding: The variant rs12447029 acted as a MG-specific sc-caQTL, enhancing the binding of NFE2L2 to a MG-specific enhancer, which also functioned as a sc-eQTL for GRIN2A in MG.
title: Integrative single cell multiomics analysis of human retina indicates a role for hierarchical transcription factors collaboration in genetic effects on gene regulation

finding: This SNP was found to localize to open chromatin regions in the UMOD locus in the adult kidney cortex. The analysis indicated that the regulatory element associated with this SNP displayed greater accessibility in intact renal cortex compared to tubular epithelial cells cultured in 10% fetal bovine serum, correlating with differential gene expression.
title: Multi-omic Characterization of Human Tubular Epithelial Cell Response to Serum

finding: Similar to rs4293393, this SNP also mapped to open chromatin regions within the UMOD locus in intact renal cortex. It was associated with enhanced chromatin accessibility compared to cultured tubular cells, reflecting its relevance to kidney disease-associated regulatory processes.
title: Multi-omic Characterization of Human Tubular Epithelial Cell Response to Serum

finding: The SNP rs11864188 showed switching of the ALT allele being hyper-methylated in the FL, and disrupted multiple TF motifs, indicating a complex interaction in DLBCL.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs1558902, a variant in the FTO gene locus, exhibited a significant gene-by-birth year interaction effect on Body Mass Index (BMI). This finding replicated earlier results indicating that the penetrance of this variant increased over time, and was associated with greater variability in BMI in later birth cohorts. The highly significant p-value for the genetic heteroscedasticity statistic (ξ<sub>G</sub>) confirmed that the GxE effect observed was not simply due to general modulation of variance.
title: Distinguishing between interaction and dispersion effects in the analysis of gene-environment interaction

finding: The SNP rs11866328 was identified in the GRIN2A gene and was found to affect disease progression of chronic HBV infection. This discovery highlighted the functional implications of the genetic variant in relation to viral load and patient outcomes, emphasizing its relevance in understanding chronic hepatitis B disease dynamics.
title: The interaction of DNA repair factors ASCC2 and ASCC3 is affected by somatic cancer mutations

finding: This intronic variant in <italic>GTF3C1</italic> was associated with complex processing speed and found to be an eQTL impacting related traits.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: This intronic variant in <italic>ATP2A1</italic> displayed associations with episodic memory and was found to regulate gene expression within the hypothalamus.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The SNP rs3748393, with a C allele as the reference and A allele as the alternative, was associated with repression of the C16Orf95 gene in testis. DeepG4 analysis indicated that the alternative allele A led to a decrease in G4 activity. The SNP was part of a G4 motif with several G stretches, and changing the C allele to A altered the stability of the G4 structure.
title: DeepG4: A deep learning approach to predict active G-quadruplexes

finding: The SNP rs4788084 was significantly associated with both splicing and gene expression of the SULT1A2 gene. The analysis indicated that colocalization with GWAS showed rs4788084 as part of two causal mechanisms within this locus contributing to COPD risk.
title: Analysis of genetically driven alternative splicing identifies FBXO38 as a novel COPD susceptibility gene

finding: The SNP rs750155 had the greatest colocalization with eQTL data (CLPP=0.21), suggesting that it might be involved in the expression of SULT1A2 related to COPD mechanisms.
title: Analysis of genetically driven alternative splicing identifies FBXO38 as a novel COPD susceptibility gene

finding: The SNP rs79039694 was connected with eQTL colocalization for the SULT1A2 at a significant level (CLPP=0.21), indicating its potential role in influencing gene expression relevant for COPD.
title: Analysis of genetically driven alternative splicing identifies FBXO38 as a novel COPD susceptibility gene

finding: At <italic>CTU2</italic>, the rare missense variant rs200779411 was found to associate strongly with 16q CNN-LOH events (OR=28, p=7.3 x10⁻²⁰), duplicating the <italic>CTU2</italic> risk allele. This SNP was predicted to impair <italic>CTU2</italic> function, which is crucial for maintaining genome integrity, thus promoting clonal expansion.
title: The genomic landscape of clonal hematopoiesis in Japan

finding: The SNP rs9933149, located in an intron of C16orf95 on chromosome 16, was significantly associated with endocranial globularity (p = 1.58 x 10^-26). Previous studies linked this locus to individual variation in neuroanatomical phenotypes, including sulcal morphology and white-matter microstructure. Furthermore, variants in this region were associated with congenital heart defects and were implicated in cases of microcephaly and neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: Imaging genomics reveals genetic architecture of the globular human braincase

finding: SNP rs2792 was positively identified as associated with cooking time, where genotypes with the GA allele exhibited a longer cooking time compared to GG homozygous accessions. This SNP was annotated as intergenic, located between the genes Dioal.01G006400 and Dioal.01G006500.
title: Detecting the genetic variants associated with key culinary traits in Dioscorea alata

finding: The SNP rs12051328 was associated with mechanisms of resistance to ibrutinib in B-cell lymphomas. The context of this finding related to understanding how certain genetic variations contribute to the survival of CLL cells under therapy, particularly in light of the therapy's prevalence in treating this type of leukemia.
title: A novel triple-action inhibitor targeting B-cell receptor signaling and BRD4 demonstrates preclinical activity in chronic lymphocytic leukemia

finding: The rs1805007 variant was associated with red hair color and pain sensitivity, showing a statistically significant increase in PSQ scores as the number of MC1R alleles increased.
title: Genome-wide association study of pain sensitivity assessed by questionnaire and the cold pressor test

finding: The rs1805008 variant contributed to the red hair phenotype and pain sensitivity, where carriers exhibited higher PSQ scores compared to non-carriers.
title: Genome-wide association study of pain sensitivity assessed by questionnaire and the cold pressor test

finding: The rs1805009 variant, associated with the red hair color in MC1R, also demonstrated a significant relationship with increased pain sensitivity as per higher PSQ scores.
title: Genome-wide association study of pain sensitivity assessed by questionnaire and the cold pressor test

finding: This non-coding variant in the CYP19A1 gene showed strong evidence for association with dyslexia risk, particularly affecting multiple dyslexia-related phenotypes.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: rs13331259 was identified as the lowest p-value association on chromosome 16 for the trait MCH, indicating its relevance in contributing to genetic variance in this trait type.
title: Interpreting SNP heritability in admixed populations

finding: Most strongly associated with luminal-like subtypes (P=6.68×10⁻¹⁷).
title: Common breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Associated with ER, showing significant results (P<0.05).
title: Common breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Associated with ER, showing significant results (P<0.05).
title: Common breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: The MLKL S132P polymorphism, with a global minor allele frequency of 0.0138, conferred a gain in necroptotic function in human cells, suggesting a role in the modulation of programmed cell death and has implications for understanding complex polygenic human diseases.
title: A common human MLKL polymorphism confers resistance to negative regulation by phosphorylation

finding: An association was established between rs811692 and CD4 T cell proportion, involving potential SMAD-mediated TGF-β signaling, which is crucial for immune responses.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: The association between rs2864754 and the gene ITGB2 was found in natural killer cells, illustrating its involvement in leukocyte adhesion mechanisms.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs9927316 (PIP=0.54) was associated with a myeloid-specific peak downstream of the IRF8 gene, a key transcription factor for myeloid and B cell development, exhibiting a significant overlap with chromatin accessibility (Wilcoxon p=4.165e-04). This was indicative of its role in myeloid cell functioning in RA.
title: The Chromatin Landscape of Pathogenic Transcriptional Cell States in Rheumatoid Arthritis

finding: The FTO intronic variant rs1421085 was identified as a candidate causal variant for obesity, demonstrating a non-linear effect size on body mass index (BMI). The addition of one copy of the C allele was associated with an increase of 0.77 kg/m² (95% CI: 0.68 - 0.85), while adding a second copy resulted in an even greater increase of 1.31 kg/m² (95% CI: 1.19 - 1.43). This finding indicated significant differences in effect sizes based on the genotype of rs1421085 across 54 traits, particularly those correlated with BMI.
title: Dispensing with unnecessary assumptions in population genetics analysis

finding: In the study by Gao et al. (2020), the SNP rs12051139 was linked to the modulation of adenoviral vectors used in cancer therapy. The findings suggested that the presence of this SNP played a role in the effectiveness of adenoviral vectors, potentially influencing immune responses, which are critical for the success of cancer treatments involving adenoviruses. This relationship highlighted the importance of genetic factors in tailoring adenoviral vector therapies to enhance patient outcomes.
title: Enforced dimerization of CD45 by the adenovirus E3/49K protein inhibits T cell receptor signaling

finding: The CDH13 gene polymorphism rs3865188 was associated with adiponectin levels, providing insights into its role in obesity and T2DM risk.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The homozygous single nucleotide variant rs7187376C/C of CDH11 was found to have a high prevalence in patients with autism spectrum disorder (ASD). This finding, alongside observations of partial deletion of CDH11 in a case of non-syndromic ASD coupled with mild intellectual disability and ADHD, indicates that variants at this locus are significantly associated with ASD and highlight the potential role of CDH11 as an important ASD risk gene.
title: Identification of CDH11 as an ASD risk gene by matched-gene co-expression analysis and mouse behavioral studies

finding: The C allele of rs9930307 was associated with decreased chromatin accessibility of a caPeak in neurons and was linked to increased expression of lncRNA AC022167.1, suggesting it disrupted TP53 binding, which may influence schizophrenia risk.
title: Cell-type specific effects of genetic variation on chromatin accessibility during human neuronal differentiation

finding: The variant rs62032983 was analyzed as an eQTL predicted to reduce expression of the gene DCTN5 across all cell types. This negative impact on expression was attributed to the disruption of a predicted binding site for the transcription factor ELF1, which is expressed ubiquitously, illustrating the variant's widespread effect on gene regulation.
title: scooby: Modeling multi-modal genomic profiles from DNA sequence at single-cell resolution

finding: The rs1861867 variant was identified as having a greater than 99% probability of being causal for the regulation of FTO expression in skeletal muscle. This finding was derived from fine-mapping efforts in a region initially associated with Body Mass Index (BMI), indicating that while rs558902 was linked to BMI, rs1861867 was more directly connected with FTO expression.
title: Widespread dose-dependent effects of RNA expression and splicing on complex diseases and traits

finding: The SNP rs8046545 was associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D) and located in the intron of <italic>ATP2A1</italic>. It was noted as a cis-eQTL of the gene <italic>SH2B1</italic> in the pancreas, indicating that the T2D GWAS signal might implicate <italic>SH2B1</italic> rather than <italic>ATP2A1</italic>. Decreased levels of <italic>SH2B1</italic> were linked to both leptin and insulin resistance, contributing to the conditions of obesity and diabetes in previous studies.
title: A Transcriptomic and Proteomic Atlas of Obesity and Type 2 Diabetes in Cynomolgus Monkeys

finding: The rs7206410 SNP, situated in the FTO gene, was associated with obesity and confirmed its previous linkage to BMI, thus reinforcing established associations regarding body weight regulation.
title: A genome-wide association study of neonatal metabolites

finding: The SNP rs72772740, located in the intronic region of the GPR139 gene on chromosome 16, was associated with changes in lateral ventricle volume. GPR139 is known for its expression in the central nervous system and may be involved in fetal brain development.
title: Dynamics of Brain Structure and its Genetic Architecture over the Lifespan

finding: The SNP rs12051080 was linked to drug-induced heterogeneity in cancer, facilitating the identification of biomarkers related to acquired resistance in cancer cell lines.
title: Resistance patterns in drug-adapted cancer cell lines reflect complex evolution in clinical tumors

finding: The SNP rs12102966 was linked to high expression levels of PD-L1 in monocytes and blood dendritic cells, which were identified as risk factors in lung cancer patients undergoing PD1 inhibitor therapy. This suggested that patients with this SNP might experience differing therapeutic responses based on PD-L1 expression.
title: Advancing CAR T-Cell Therapy: Simultaneously Attack Tumor and Immunosuppressive Cells in the Tumor Microenvironment

finding: The SNP rs8049439, located near ATXN2L, was associated with traits affecting BMI alongside the other identified outliers, thereby contributing to a multifaceted view on educational impacts on obesity.
title: MR-TRYX: A Mendelian randomization framework that exploits horizontal pleiotropy to infer novel causal pathways

finding: The SNP rs17822931 in the ABCC11 gene was associated with the dry ear wax phenotype, with Jomon-derived haplotypes reflecting a frequency of 24% for the derived allele (dry ear wax) in modern Japanese. Previous studies indicated that this derived allele was present in the Hokkaido Jomon population at a frequency of 47.6%, supporting the genetic continuity of this trait from the Jomon people.
title: Comprehensive analysis of Japanese archipelago population history by detecting ancestry-marker polymorphisms without using ancient DNA data

finding: The SNP rs2302178 was associated with the gene CLDN1, showing a significant trans-eQTL relationship with a q-value FDR ≤ 0.095. This association extended from the cis-association with the gene HS3ST6, suggesting its role in the network involving glucocorticoid response.
title: Causal Network Inference from Gene Transcriptional Time Series Response to Glucocorticoids

finding: SNP rs9989419 was reported in connection with HDL-C and detected by both the normal priors method and Bayestrat.
title: Bayestrat: Population Stratification Correction Using Bayesian Shrinkage Prior for Genetic Association Studies

finding: The rs2066847_G>GC frameshift mutation in NOD2 was associated with several phenotypes related to Crohn's disease and mouth ulcers.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The variant rs77924615 was strongly associated with kidney function, specifically eGFRCr-Cys levels, and was identified as a putative causal variant due to its location in a kidney cCRE. It exhibited low linkage disequilibrium with other variants, indicating its potential unique role in influencing kidney function.
title: Variants in tubule epithelial regulatory elements mediate most heritable differences in human kidney function

finding: This SNP was part of a known height locus and indicated strong association with relevant traits as validated by fine mapping.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: The rs9940301 SNP was located in proximity to regulatory elements influencing CDYL2 expression, participating in chromatin interactions that linked it to breast cancer risk.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: The SNP rs3814883 belonged to Cluster 1070, showcasing associations that were previously undocumented in brain imaging studies, indicating its potential novelty in genetic findings.
title: Enhanced Brain Imaging Genetics in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs2549095 was the most significant in Cluster 1067, associated with tissue contrast in higher cortical regions and was part of the CLEC18A gene associated with various body composition traits.
title: Enhanced Brain Imaging Genetics in UK Biobank

finding: The G-allele at rs1800124 in the ERCC4 gene was detected in the Riva-I cell line. This allele has been linked to weaker DNA-protein binding, leading to decreased DNA repair capabilities.
title: Epigenetic inhibitors sensitize DLBCL cells to rituximab and doxorubicin

finding: Germline polymorphism rs1800566 in the NQO1 gene was mentioned as being associated with response to alkylating agents such as cyclophosphamide, ifosfamide, and platinum compounds in the context of DLBCL treatment.
title: Epigenetic inhibitors sensitize DLBCL cells to rituximab and doxorubicin

finding: The SNP rs563131364 was identified as a predicted LOF variant in the SLC12A3 gene, associated with severe chronic kidney disease (p=0.001, LO=1.723, ICD=N184), abnormal blood chemistry (p=0.003, LO=1.189, ICD=R7989), and retinal edema (p=0.006, LO=2.377, ICD=H3581). Additionally, this variant conferred a protective effect against pure hypercholesterolemia (p=.0396, LO=-1.512, ICD=E7800), suggesting it might be pathogenic based on its CADD PHRED score of 29.3 and MSC CI of 13.89.
title: Genome-wide prediction of pathogenic gain- and loss-of-function variants from ensemble learning of diverse feature set

finding: The SNP rs201746476 was found to be a high confidence predicted GOF variant in the PIEZO1 gene. This variant was associated with risks for palpitations (p=0.009, LO=2.912, ICD=R002), abdominal pain (p=0.028, LO=1.842, ICD=R109), and viral hepatitis C (p=0.039, LO=2.438, ICD=B182; p=0.043, LO=2.389, ICD=B1920), illustrating its connection to relevant phenotypes when overexpressed.
title: Genome-wide prediction of pathogenic gain- and loss-of-function variants from ensemble learning of diverse feature set

finding: The SNP rs3748393, with a reference C allele and alternative A allele, was associated with gene expression repression of the C16Orf95 gene in testis. DeepG4 analysis indicated that the alternative allele A decreased G4 activity, affecting G4 structure stability due to its involvement in a G4 motif consisting of multiple G stretches.
title: DeepG4 : A deep learning approach to predict active G-quadruplexes

finding: The SNP rs3751837 at the CLUAP1 locus was classified as shared with comparable TOA scores across T2D-relevant tissues.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: The GP2 signal included rs4238595 among three variants that were linked to the GP2 promoter via co-accessibility in acinar cells. The cumulative probability of association (PPA) for this signal was 0.98, indicating a strong association with T1D risk.
title: Large-scale genetic association and single cell accessible chromatin mapping defines cell type-specific mechanisms of type 1 diabetes risk

finding: Similar to rs4238595, rs8060932 was also part of the GP2 signal which accounted for the majority of the causal probability linked to T1D. It was co-accessible with the GP2 promoter in acinar cells, emphasizing its role in T1D pathogenesis.
title: Large-scale genetic association and single cell accessible chromatin mapping defines cell type-specific mechanisms of type 1 diabetes risk

finding: The variant rs72802342 at the CTRB1/2/BCAR1 locus mapped to an acinar-specific cCRE that was co-accessible with the CTRB1 and CTRB2 promoters, showing a PPA of 0.30 for T1D risk, thereby highlighting its contribution to the disease.
title: Large-scale genetic association and single cell accessible chromatin mapping defines cell type-specific mechanisms of type 1 diabetes risk

finding: The T1D risk variant rs138099003 had a MAF of 0.0015 and an OR of 2.29, contributing to the overall risk ascribed to several non-coding regions linked with T1D.
title: Large-scale genetic association and single cell accessible chromatin mapping defines cell type-specific mechanisms of type 1 diabetes risk

finding: The IL4R gene variant rs1805010 was linked to increased Th17 cell frequency and poor clinical outcomes in rheumatoid arthritis, highlighting its importance in autoimmune diseases.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: This variant was strongly associated with risk for all luminal-like subtypes and had a weaker association with HER2-positive/non-luminal and TN subtypes.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: The SNP rs12102938 was identified in the context of clonal evolution and timing of metastatic colorectal cancer, indicating a potential association with the disease's progression mechanisms.
title: Visual Clustering of Transcriptomic Data from Primary and Metastatic Tumors – Dependencies and Novel Pitfalls

finding: The SNP rs8060055 was found to be associated with RASSF1A site-specific methylation hotspots in cancer. This finding suggested a correlation with RASSF1C and MOAP-1, providing insight into the oncogenic behaviors linked to RASSF1C's role in driving cancer cell plasticity and metastasis.
title: RASSF1C oncogene elicits amoeboid invasion, cancer stemness and invasive EVs via a novel SRC/Rho axis

finding: A mutation in ADCY7 (rs77150043) was suggested to play a role in the early onset of psoriasis and Crohn's disease, indicating its relevance in the dysregulation of Th cell subpopulation balance.
title: A forskolin-mediated increase in cAMP promotes T helper cell differentiation into the Th1 and Th2 subsets rather than into the Th17 subset

finding: Another mutation in ADCY7 (rs78534766) was reported to double the risk of developing ulcerative colitis, reinforcing the association between this genetic variant and Th cell-related pathological processes.
title: A forskolin-mediated increase in cAMP promotes T helper cell differentiation into the Th1 and Th2 subsets rather than into the Th17 subset

finding: An intronic variant within RPGRIP1L, this SNP showed significant regulatory function in enhancer activity linked to facial traits.
title: Novel genetic loci affecting facial shape variation in humans

finding: This SNP from the RPGRIP1L locus was associated with enhancer activity as well as potential facial morphogenesis implications.
title: Novel genetic loci affecting facial shape variation in humans

finding: Associated with the RPGRIP1L region, this SNP had effects on enhancer activity, although not statistically significant.
title: Novel genetic loci affecting facial shape variation in humans

finding: The SNP rs1805005 was known to be associated with hair colour variations, specifically influencing low eumelanin levels. It was part of the credible set of 14 variants identified that showed independent effects in various hair colour models.
title: Multi-ancestry tandem repeat association study of hair colour using exome-wide sequencing

finding: The SNP rs1805007 was recognized as a significant variant impacting hair colour, particularly in relation to low eumelanin. It was included in the 14 credible variants identified across multiple hair colour models.
