title: Multi-ancestry tandem repeat association study of hair colour using exome-wide sequencing

finding: The SNP rs1805008 was also linked to hair colour variation, impacting traits like low eumelanin. This SNP was included among the significant causal variants found during the study of the region around MC1R.
title: Multi-ancestry tandem repeat association study of hair colour using exome-wide sequencing

finding: The SNP rs9930984 was significantly associated with the TP53 R249S mutation in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) cases exposed to dietary aflatoxin B1 (AFB1) and hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection. This association was validated through genome-wide association study (GWAS) and subsequent replication analyses. It was reported that individuals carrying the TT genotype of rs9930984 showed a higher risk of TP53 R249S mutation compared to those with GG and GT genotypes. Furthermore, ADAMTS18 mRNA expression was significantly upregulated in HCC tissue compared to paired non-tumor tissue.
title: Genome-wide association study of TP53 R249S mutation in hepatocellular carcinoma with aflatoxin B1 exposure and hepatitis B virus infection in Guangxi

finding: The rs72824905 SNP, which corresponds to the rare coding variant in the gene PLCG2 (P522R), was found to have a significant protective effect against Alzheimer's disease (AD). The study reported an odds ratio of 0.68 with a p-value of 5.38×10^-10, indicating that this variant decreases the risk of developing AD. Through molecular dynamic modeling, it was suggested that the R522 variant alters the structure of the PLCγ2 protein, enhancing its signaling capabilities. This hyperfunctionality was corroborated by observing increased calcium store release in cells with the mutation in response to stimuli, which in turn led to a decreased ability to detect PIP2 levels and impairments in phagocytosis. Importantly, this variant's association with AD highlights its potential as a therapeutic target.
title: The Alzheimer’s disease protective P522R variant of PLCG2, consistently enhances stimulus-dependent PLCγ2 activation, depleting substrate and altering cell function

finding: While the original study assigned PRDM7 as the closest gene for rs56407236, the new annotation revealed FAM157C as the gene associated with significant eQTLs in blood.
title: snpXplorer: a web application to explore human SNP-associations and annotate SNP-sets

finding: The rs9939609 SNP was found to influence body fat accumulation, specifically indicating that low physical activity heightened its effect. This original finding was significant in the context of understanding the genetics of obesity and related traits.
title: Estimating narrow-sense heritability from genome-wide data in admixed populations

finding: The CDH13 gene variant rs9940180 was associated with schizophrenia risk in a North Indian population.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The MMP2 gene polymorphism rs243865 impacted clinical findings in Alzheimer's disease patients, linking genetic factors to disease severity.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: Associated with asymmetries in supplementary motor cortex and pallidum connectivity with a z-score of 6.15.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: In high LD with rs56023709, this SNP was previously associated with thalamus volume.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: The polymorphism rs9939609 in the FTO gene was associated with obesity and increased body mass index (BMI). Specifically, the presence of allele A was linked to an average weight increase of 1.2 kg for one A allele and approximately 3 kg for two A alleles compared to the TT genotype. Additionally, a significant decrease in the frequency of the A allele was observed in centenarians (age 86-100) compared to younger age groups, indicating a potential role of the FTO gene in longevity.
title: Evaluation of the possible association of Body Mass Index and four metabolic gene polymorphisms with longevity in an Italian cohort: a role for APOE, eNOS, and FTO gene polymorphisms

finding: This SNP displayed a perfect PIP of 1.00 in HDL analysis, indicating strong evidence of association in both Framingham Heart Study and UK Biobank datasets.
title: Multi-scale Inference of Genetic Trait Architecture using Biologically Annotated Neural Networks

finding: Positive selection on the non-risk allele of rs9922678 in the GRIN2A gene was detected with an estimated duration of 25,237 years, particularly in East Asian populations (EAS), indicating adaptation to psychosocial stress.
title: Global adaptive evolution involved in neuroticism and educational behaviors through the spread of anatomically modern humans

finding: The SNP rs8043757 was associated with the FTO enhancer and was shown to decrease binding affinity for FOXP3. This alteration in enhancer activity led to significantly lower expression levels of FTO and its neighboring genes IRX3 and IRX5 in human astrocytes after downregulation via CRISPRi.
title: Integrative single-cell characterization of hypothalamus sex-differential and obesity-associated genes and regulatory elements

finding: The SNP rs12102760 was related to studies investigating the dynamics of intracellular pH in the context of cancer. The research indicated that regulation of pH dynamics at the transcriptional level, influenced by this SNP, played a crucial role in cellular processes such as membrane ruffling and actin dynamics.
title: An optogenetic tool to raise intracellular pH in single cells and drive localized membrane dynamics

finding: The SNP rs16940186 was found to be located approximately 80 kb downstream of the gene IRF8. The study highlighted that eQTL data indicated this SNP significantly influences gene regulation primarily in the stomach epithelial cell type. The identified peak-to-gene link between IRF8 and the open chromatin region (OCR) associated with rs16940186 exhibited a correlation coefficient of 0.61 and a false discovery rate (FDR) of 3.8e-03, demonstrating a significant association and tissue-specific accessibility of the OCR in the stomach.
title: cisDynet: an integrated platform for modeling gene-regulatory dynamics and networks

finding: This SNP was connected to communication in the cancer microenvironment, showing its relevance to therapeutic interventions in cellular networks, such as those in breast cancer.
title: High-frequency extracellular spiking in electrically-active cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs12922757 was positively associated with the gene GAS8. Specifically, the A allele at this SNP increased the gene's expression in individuals with perceived high socio-economic status, which in turn, reduced their risk of developing asthma. This suggests a protective effect influenced by psychosocial factors.
title: Psychosocial experiences modulate asthma-associated genes through gene-environment interactions

finding: The rs1967309 variant in the ADCY9 gene was associated with clinical responses to the CETP modulator dalcetrapib. Individuals carrying the AA genotype at this SNP exhibited reduced cardiovascular events, a decrease in atherosclerosis progression, and improved cholesterol efflux when treated with dalcetrapib, compared to placebo. No such effects were seen in those carrying the GG genotype.
title: A sex-specific evolutionary interaction between ADCY9 and CETP

finding: The rs158477 SNP in the CETP gene exhibited long-range linkage disequilibrium with rs1967309 in the Peruvian population. The presence of the GG genotype at this locus was associated with increased cardiovascular risk in AA genotype carriers of rs1967309, suggesting a detrimental effect in males having this genotype combination.
title: A sex-specific evolutionary interaction between ADCY9 and CETP

finding: The PLCγ2 S707Y variant (rs397514562) was associated with severe autoinflammatory symptoms and immune dysregulation in patients. It was classified under the APLAID syndrome, characterized by gain-of-function activity resulting in altered signaling pathways. This variant exhibited hypermorphic enzymatic activity and was shown to diminish key microglial processes such as phagocytosis and cytokine production upon inflammatory challenge, indicating a detrimental effect on CNS functioning.
title: The hypermorphic PLCγ2 S707Y variant dysregulates microglial cell function – insight into PLCγ2 activation in brain health and disease, and opportunities for therapeutic modulation

finding: The PLCγ2 P522R variant (rs72824905) was linked to protection against late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD) and supported healthy aging. It displayed a mild increase in enzymatic activity, which promoted crucial microglial functions such as containment of amyloid plaques and preservation of synaptic integrity, contributing positively to cognitive functions in the context of neurodegeneration.
title: The hypermorphic PLCγ2 S707Y variant dysregulates microglial cell function – insight into PLCγ2 activation in brain health and disease, and opportunities for therapeutic modulation

finding: The SNP rs3751837 was classified as 'shared' at the CLUAP1 locus, featuring comparable TOA scores across four T2D-relevant tissues, with significant colocalization observed.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: The rs2066847 mutation, recognized as pathogenic for inflammatory bowel disease, showed associations with Crohn's disease and mouth ulcers, indicating its complex role in these phenotypes.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The single nucleotide polymorphism FTO rs1421085 T-to-C was associated with increased expression of EN1 in the obesity phenotype in human adipocytes. This finding suggested a species-specific role of EN1 in regulating UCP1 expression, where EN1 was identified as a marker for brown adipocyte lineage in rodents.
title: Homeodomain transcription factors in adipocyte thermogenesis: insights into the species-specific and conserved regulatory elements of human UCP1

finding: The rs9940646 SNP (FTO) was also noted for consistent genetic effects across multiple ancestry groups, showing a high degree of transferability.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide analysis identifies common genetic variants for self-reported sleep duration and shared genetic effects

finding: The SNP rs3752495 was implicated as a causal insomnia risk variant located in an intron of the WDR90 gene. The presence of the risk allele (C) was associated with approximately a 2.5-fold increase in luciferase expression, indicating that it exhibits strong regulatory potential and influences the expression of the neighboring gene PIG-Q. This finding was established through a series of luciferase reporter assays and was supported by prior variant-to-gene mapping efforts.
title: Perturbation of the insomnia WDR90 GWAS locus pinpoints rs3752495 as a causal variant influencing distal expression of neighboring gene, PIG-Q

finding: The rs61749044 variant was associated with LOAD, and Plcg2, the gene it affects, is a key protein involved in microglial activation in response to Alzheimer's disease pathology.
title: In vivo validation of late-onset Alzheimer’s disease genetic risk factors

finding: The SNP rs7196853 in the gene RIPOR1 at 16q22.1 was significantly associated with the ratio of FEV1 to forced vital capacity (FEV1/FVC) with a p-value of 1.3×10^{-16}, indicating its involvement in lung function.
title: Immune-mediated genetic pathways resulting in pulmonary function impairment increase lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs750739 in the PIEZO1 gene was associated with FEV1 (p=1.8×10^{-10}), supporting its role in lung epithelium repair and function.
title: Immune-mediated genetic pathways resulting in pulmonary function impairment increase lung cancer susceptibility

finding: This SNP was associated with HDL, with a discovery P-value of 1.19 x 10^-11. The finding contributed to the understanding of lipid levels in the context of the Samoan genetic background.
title: Genome-wide association studies in Samoans give insight into the genetic architecture of fasting serum lipid levels

finding: The SNP rs12102870 was implicated in melanoma's resistance to targeted therapies and immunotherapies, particularly through its role in influencing the tumor microenvironment, which was suggested to affect treatment response.
title: Dynamical modelling of proliferative-invasive plasticity and IFNγ signaling in melanoma reveals mechanisms of PD-L1 expression heterogeneity

finding: The G180R substitution in ATP-binding cassette transporter sub-family C member 11 was significantly correlated with Axillary Osmidrosis in Chinese Han populations and increased risk of breast cancer in Japanese women, with 75% allele frequency observed in East Asian populations.
title: Peptide Ancestry Informative Markers in Uterine Neoplasms from Women of European, African and Asian Ancestry

finding: The SNP rs1805007 was associated with hair colour, specifically showing strong non-additive effects relevant to red hair, with a significance level of P < 1 × 10<sup>-5000</sup>.
title: Analysis of genetic dominance in the UK Biobank

finding: The stop gain variant in PALB2 showed a strong association with breast cancer, with an odds ratio of 4.48 and a P-value of 6.92×10^-14. This finding was also part of the analysis involving 12,636 breast cancer cases and 200,417 controls.
title: Sequencing of 53,831 diverse genomes from the NHLBI TOPMed Program
